Reviews.Title: “Great value , excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: AcousticImmersion
Reviews.Content: I agree with prior posts, it does feel more of a three star than a four star hotel from the reception and lobby. But thats where that ends. The rooms come equipped with kitchenette, stove top, microwave, fridge, washer and dryer. It is the deluxe version of extended stay and since we got it for $100 a night from hotwire, this one's a keeper. Walking distance to everything downtown, minutes from eaton center. will try to get this one every time i visit toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Simply delightful and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Creatto
Reviews.Content: I happen to encounter a fantastic deal for this hotel and had really no expectations for it, but I was certainly glad that I stayed at the One King West hotel and I could have paid way more for the same room and service quite happily. The hotel is has a nice touch of luxury and it is really well designed and situated. My room has a washer and a dryer and a kitchenette, and that was just AMAZING! It was clean, its location is right on top of a subway station, and it is truly a very nicely designed hotel. I liked their fitness centre. Their equipment was top notch, and its location and maintainance was really good and inviting. Their Wi-Fi services were not the best and I didn't use them, but I found that they had a very well-situated work area, and I was able to remain productive for most of my time there. I will truly recommend this hotel as a nice alternative for visiting Toronto. Its atmosphere, sophistication, feeling and amazing service will certainly make a lasting impression on any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but closer to a 3 star than 4”
Reviews.Author: liveeatdrinktravel
Reviews.Content: We recently booked a block of rooms here for a wedding, and everyone enjoyed their stay. The rooms were fairly clean, but smelled a bit stale and were a bit dated. It looked like the rooms had been worn out from over usage, to be honest. Also, the bathrooms were quite small and not that well lit. Overall, a decent deal for the location within the city, but it's closer to a 3 star than a 4.

Reviews.Title: “St Paddy's day stay was awesome”
Reviews.Author: John V
Reviews.Content: Service when we got to the hotel was fast and friendly. Shown right to our room. Room was one of the best we have ever stayed in. Huge, clean room with all amenities and a wonderful balcony overlooking yonge st. Check out was fast and easy, valet was swamped but that's to be expected at check out time on a sunday morning. Even the valet price was reasonable when you consider trying to park downtown on a Saturday night. Overall a fabulous experience. Will defiinitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “One bedroom of marvelous!!”
Reviews.Author: ariesgirl00
Reviews.Content: Our one bedroom suite was spacious and comfortable!!! It really felt like we were at home. This time we had lake and city view which was an added bonus to our stay! Valet parking this time around was a lot easier than our previous stay. Dinner and breakfast at Bistro is always a delight. Food is really good & the service is beyond excellent!! Thank you One King West for making our stay a memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Like a Second Home”
Reviews.Author: Utcajh
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Toronto about a week a month for about a year during 2010-2011. I had stayed at the One King West all but one of those trips. The main influence on my choice was the company I was working with - they had a corporate discount and the location was very convenient to their office. The staff was always friendly and helpful during my stay. As I more frequently began to stay the staff greeted me with "Welcome Back" more often. The rooms seems more like small apartments than hotel rooms. They include a small kitchenette and also include washer and dryer which is nice when staying for a weeks time. The only compliant I have is about the TV since it was dated, but this seems to be the norm in Canada. In the U.S. most hotels of this caliber have flat screen TVs. Small compliant and it wouldn't cause me to stay anywhere else. There are also great restaurants in the area. Try Ki - it's one of the best sushi places I have ever eaten.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Clean, Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: YunaYuna
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel when they had the superior room for no tax rate of $159 and the room was exquisite, it was very modern and free wifi. It had a great view as well. The customer service is superb, I got a late check out for no extra cost. Also, after filling out the customer feedback form, the general manager replied to me through email and offered a complimentary room upgrade upon my next visit. This hotel is located in what use to be an old bank. The valet parking was great, the valet personnel were very polite. The room was a bit cold, but you can adjust the room temperature. It is conveniently located in the heart of downtown and short walk to the eaton centre. There's lots to do downtown Toronto. Overall, I had a great time and will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great night at One King”
Reviews.Author: Tyler H
Reviews.Content: Would Highly Recommend this to anyone Stayed at the One King West for one night while my friends and I were downtown, the building was amazing, stayed superior room on 38 floor, very unique strip layout..made for great views Also Scott at the lobby bar, is a great guy...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location, Rooms a Bit Small”
Reviews.Author: RobGS
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel, the only complaint is the rooms were a bit small. My room was on an upper floor and had a great view, I provided pictures. There was a small kitchen type area if you were staying for a few days. The bathroom only had a shower, maybe other rooms have a larger bathroom. The elevators were a bit slow, but not a huge issue. The location is great at the cross section of King and Younge Streets. I liked the lobby given the hotel was built virtually on top of one of the older buildings in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: joebliz
Reviews.Content: I have been to toronto multiple times in the last couple of years and i have stayed at the one king west, the intercontinental and sutton. I can definitely say that when i plan a trip here that this is the first place i choose. The one king west offers a washer and dryer which are awesome if you are staying longer than a week in your own suite. I have yet to see this anywhere else. Also, I need to give a big shout out to Junard that works at the bar who is a blast and just a good guy to have a conversation with. They have other amenities which i enjoy such as the workout room, sauna and hot tub but overall, the friendliness and customer service prevail. Joe

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming apart-hotel in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Skibummer
Reviews.Content: One King West is a well-located 40 plus-storey skyscraper mounted atop an historic bank. It markets itself as an all-suite hotel designed for extended stays. Fortunately, my stay was not extended as the stained carpets and furniture, chipped cabinets and climate control that sounded and vibrated like a jet engine at takeoff throttle would have made this unpleasant. The hotel seems to be somewhere between a serviced apartment and an hotel, but it is in no man's land between the two: a fridge, but no minibar; a microwave, but extraordinarily limited room service; a full-size washing machine and separate dryer + dishwasher, but an ancient television only visible from the bed. The meeting facilities are very basic for a business hotel and the reception, bar and other public areas are inadequate for a 40 plus-storey hotel. It is hard to imagine staying here comfortably for more than a couple of nights and it is below-par for a hotel, so it cannot be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Who knew?”
Reviews.Author: Santa Katarina
Reviews.Content: We planned an over-night trip to Toronto and decided to use HotWire to save some money. We ended up at One King West and paid an extra $10 to upgrade to a top floor. We were surprised and very happy with our room, the view from the large window and the warm sunshine we enjoyed in the afternoon. When the weather changed, we walked to the Royal York for our dinner using The Path. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location & Outstanding Rooms”
Reviews.Author: silagroup
Reviews.Content: For a couple of years now I have been staying at this hotel for most of my business meetings in Toronto. What a find. I can walk underground to the hotel from Union Station (I usually arrive in Toronto by train) and when I arrive, the customer service is outstanding. The rooms are clean, well appointed and the views amazing. But I recommend the hotel for more than business travel. Located at a subway stop you can get anywhere in the city easily. And you can walk easily to great shopping, restaurants and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: americanjim
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a suite in the "old" part of the hotel on the 6th floor - the heritage bank building part of the hotel - while my condo was being repainted. The suite included a kitchenette with stovetop, fridge, dw, washer & dryer, etc - you could easilly live in it for an extended stay. My room faced the inner courtyard so I didn't have much of a view. It was compact but comfortable and fine for myself as a singleton or for a couple. King bed was very comfortable and I slept like a rock - it was very quiet all night. Bathroom had showerstall only which was fine for a single guy. The hotel was at capacity due to a business convention so I couldn't upgrade to a high floor like others have suggested to do, but my room was fine and I was really pleased with my stay - neat, clean, comfortable, inviting, effecient and pleasant. The breakfast buffet was top-quality and the little bar in the lobby was classy & inviting. The lobby is beautiful and you go right down the main stairs into the PATH underground at Commerce Court. I scheduled several business meetings in the lobby for checkout morning and it's a great place to have a private conversation over coffee. Other reviewers have been too harsh - I found One King West to be above expectations and I would reccomend this hotel highly to personal and professional contacts.

Reviews.Title: “Classy place with lots of character”
Reviews.Author: mike r
Reviews.Content: My wife and stayed this past weekend with some clients from out of town and had a blast. Perfect location with great service in parking and registration, we were in our room in minutes fabulous lobby and great heritage all through the hotel, quite interesting. We attended a function at the ACC and were there in ten minutes walking in the underground paths right from the hotel, we did not even have to bring our coats! Our room was gorgeous with a great view of the citys east side, all the comforts of home, we could have easily moved in for a week The night lounge was great fun and the breakfast in the morning was just what we needed,everything was fresh with freindly service. we would not consider any where else; it is so convienient.

Reviews.Title: “modern sophistication”
Reviews.Author: k k
Reviews.Content: Yes, there IS a washer and Dryer in every room! What a great treat! My husband and I stayed in a Superior Sweet because I prefer the addition of the tube (or we would have stayed in a studio). The room was perfect and the view was spectacular. EVERYTHING is around there, grocery stores, shopping, restaurants, jazz bars, easy travel (trolley car and Subway), and a great bar tender right down stairs. Clean, clean clean, I say this because I'm a little anal. [if I have to compare or make reference - this would be the W Hotels' modern, not so little sister] THE ONE KING IS THE ONLY PLACE I WANT TO STAY IN TORONTO!!

Reviews.Title: “The comforts of home”
Reviews.Author: AndreaD068
Reviews.Content: This hotel in the heart of downtown Toronto presents as an ultra-classy boutique hotel at street level, but turns out to be a glass skyscraper in disguise. Very cool! Magnificent lobby entrance and informative historical info throughout the hotel. The rooms are set up for overnight guests and for temporary residents, so although our room was a bit cramped, they contain a kitchenette with stovetop, micowave, fridge, washer/dryer, and dishwasher. Writing desk, sink and counter as well. Negatives: small washroom and hard mattress, Wifi only in the lobby, old-style TV. But overall, a classy joint at a reasonable price, well located at King and Yonge.

Reviews.Title: “Great views..great location”
Reviews.Author: travelcato
Reviews.Content: Nice location..right downtown. Close to ACC and hockey hall of fame ans shopping. Lounge is quaint and new york style ( lots of people in and out). Ask to see the giant bank vault that doubles as a meeting room! Breakfast is good and not much need to go elsewhere for it. Rooms have kitchens and washer dryers... Nicely done and they are kept very clean.

Reviews.Title: “awesome location!!!”
Reviews.Author: pjah30
Reviews.Content: WE came into union station by go train and was at our hotel within in minutes by walking if you have a lot of luggage there is a subway stop right near hotel. Parking is pricey at hotel also there is not free internet in rooms, these two things I felt were big minuses. I would pick this hotel for location alone. If you want a bathtub make sure you request it, not all rooms come with.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed-felt like i wasted my money”
Reviews.Author: andreea a
Reviews.Content: So i booked a premium suite and paid the extra fee for a high floor...i got to the hotel at 2:45pm, check in was at 3...i was told, we have you booked in a 44th floor room...then she tells me that the room isn't ready yet-so i said ok, check in isn't until 3 anyways, i went and waited at the bar....i was then told that they are very busy so my 44th floor room won't be ready until 3:30 or so.... i told them i had a meeting to go at 4 and need to shower and change, they offered to let me "shower and change in another room, then you can move to your room"...i said no thanks, just give me whatever you have so i can go on about my business... i went upstairs, my room was on the 33rd floor, room was ok, smaller than other suites I have been in....i was about to take a shower and realized there were no bath robes- i called and asked for one...it took them 40min TO BRING ME A BATHROBE!!!! 40 MINUTES! totally unnaceptable- i took my shower and got ready, by the time the robe came, i was heading out the door to my meeting! i also requested the newspaper at door in the morning, surprise surprise...woke up to find no newspaper...i didn't even bother to call down and ask for one, for the fear that it'll take them another 40min to bring a simple item! oh i also have to mentioned that the "coffee and tea" i had in the room turned out to be empty bags, i heard a cleaning lady outside my door, so i asked her for some so I could have in the morning... also, no free internet- the last 3 hotels i stayed in, in town offered free wifi---not at this hotel,you have to pay for it i really feel like i spent $225 for sub par service- i travel at least once a month, and I was not impressed with this hotel.....I have another upcoming business meeting next month in town- I think this time around i'll try another hotel

Reviews.Title: “I'd come back.”
Reviews.Author: strawblonde48
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel. We had a nice room on a high floor with a pretty good view to the North up Yonge st. The staff were very helpful and nice. I had the displeasure of the room deodorizer as well, but the front desk got a little maching that took the smell out, it worked along with having the window open for a while. The parking is awful, valet only and you have to leave your car on the street, which made me a bit nervous. Otherwise though, the room was comfortable, roomy enough and close to everything. If you don't want to go outside you have direct access to the underground path. the lobby bar was the best, always busy with people from all over the world. Had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: justme4844
Reviews.Content: Just the place to be, short walk to St Lawrence Market and not far from most theartres. Subway and Path access without going out in ihe elements.

Reviews.Title: “Better hotels nearby”
Reviews.Author: coreybiff
Reviews.Content: My wife and I received a stay in a Junior Suite for a wedding gift. We had to extend it past the expiry date as we could not get away. When we went to book the room for this past weekend, the person on the phone made a huge deal about and questioned why we were allowed to extend it through the expiry as if it was the worse possible crime or something. Parking overnight is $30, but it is only $16-24 if you park nearby underground. When we checked in the person at the checkin sent us to the wrong elevator. We have been to sevefal hotels in Toronto and have stayed in really poor and really good hotels for more and less what we would have paid. We walked into our room and it being a Junior Suite we were expecting more. I would have hated to see a regular room. The bed was comfortable, nice view from the 33rd floor and it had a small food prep area. So in that way the room was quite nice. I think we just thought it was going to be bigger. There is no pool, but a nice little gym. There are a couple of nice activities nearby and the hotel is by a subway stop. The Delta Chelsea is fairly close to thos hotel- That is a really great hotel. You need to go in the summer though for the rooftop pool/patio.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, great location, nice layout”
Reviews.Author: Mastersonthego
Reviews.Content: Very personal and friendly service! I really liked how the rooms didn't feel like a hotel, but more like a studio apt. Very nice linens and comfortable beds. Big windows. My room had a nice deep tub, with travertine tile surround. I love the fact that they have Bath & Body Works products, sooooo nice! And the chamomile tea was a nice touch as well. Fabulous location, walking distance to Union Station, Eaton Centre and loads of restaurants, Mirvish Theatres and more. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Security follows you and then managment wont even appologize.”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: Both me and my girlfriend chose to stay here based on previous stays, however we will not be staying here again. We spent Valentines night here looking for a special night only to have it soured by the terrible customer service. We arrived after a performance at the Royal Alex theatre and used the valet service (which was good though greatly overpriced) when the security man at the south door decided to follow us to our floor despite me already being checked in as i set the room up for my girlfriend earlier in the day. Now this would be ok if anyone that worked in the hotel would admit it. However every single person i spoke to basically denied it and offered no explanation short of he probably had something to do on that floor at that exact moment despite him not even using his radio as we entered the hotel. No apology and essentially called me and my girlfriend paranoid. Manager called (could not be bothered to meet me in person) only to argue with me and interrupted me at every opportunity. We will defiantly not be returning to this place if this is how you are welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Great View, Spacious Room but...”
Reviews.Author: ariesgirl00
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased being on the 47th floor. The view was great! Our Superior Suite was very spacious & comfortable. I agree with some reviews, the furniture in the living area is a bit outdated & stained. The carpet was old & it had a big stain. Bathroom was spacious. Kitchenette also came in handy. Although the location & set up of The Bistro is a little odd, the food is delicious! Really good portions & tasty. The service was great during the evening. Not so much when we went for The Buffet breakfast. Waitress wasn't attentive but the food was quite good. Valet desperately needs upgrading. Very complicated system and it takes forever to get your vehicle.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay in Toronto ever!”
Reviews.Author: gal_businesstraveler
Reviews.Content: Where do I start. I'll start with the plus - amazing room view, location and rate. However, there's other hotels with those perks. It truly was my worst stay at a Toronto hotel and I've had hundreds of stays over the years in this city. Here's a summation of my 6 days of utter disappointment in this hotel: - Room deodorizer nearly made me vomit. For four days I had the window open (freezing) to try and get the smell out and had to write a note every day for the cleaning staff not to use it. It wasn't just my room as I had a friend staying on the same floor with the same smell. - No tub and nearly killed myself in the shower. One TINY soap holder in the show and that's it. No rail to hold on to, no shelves. So I had to keep bending down to get my shampoo, etc. and just about fell countless times with nothing to grab on to. Serious safety issue. The shower head looked like it hadn't been replaced since the 70's or 80's. - The staff seemed to be the most apathetic bunch ever. And were just plain wrong and not helpful. I asked directions to use the PATH three times from the bellman's desk and was told that I couldn't get to my destination from PATH. I KNEW I could but couldn't quite remember as I hadn't used this section of PATH for some time. Each time, and with three different employees, they argued with me and just gave me instructions for using the street (which any idiot could figure out and plus it was freezing - thus my wanting to use PATH). Other employees gave me wrong locations of restaurants and assured me I didn't need a reservation to KI on a Sunday night - no kidding as KI was closed when I arrived. - Wake up calls were wrong two out of six nights - sort of important when on a business trip. And one night it took over 20 minutes to even get through for a wake-up call at all. - People calling the hotel trying to reach me told me that they gave up being on hold the hole time. Had to take all calls on my cell phone. - The internet was horrible and I needed a password everyday - not problem but I'd get put through to 4 different people, on hold and waiting at least 15 minutes every time I needed a code. - There is no way in the entire universe that this is a 4 star hotel. The "no biggies" but would have been nice were: - Towels were very small and old - No Housecoat - Bathroom with an actual door - not a sliding door - Cleaning service earlier - never say anyone on my floor before 1pm and even though I called many mornings to have my room cleaned, it was never done before mid-afternoon. - The full kitchen is nice if you're the type of traveler to cook (I'm not) but it wasn't at all equipped with anything to cook with. Typical type of lack of attention to detail of this hotel. - Rooms could have used a reno - carpet lifting and tired furniture. Even if I were paid, I would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the good and the sad”
Reviews.Author: Hoppy1971
Reviews.Content: Third place here, this time for Valentine's day and a concert...booked an extra special room for a 2 night stay...got 24th floor with great view of city. The previous two times here we had made use of the kitchenette and cooked dinner...so plan was to get food at st lawrence market and cook in our room. This time we could not get pots/pans from hotel (not a problem the last two times we were here)...this time, no go..they didn't tell us we could not get them and by 6 pm, no dinner and no dinner reservations...concert at 8 pm....not happy with this, if you are going to put kitchennette in room, equip it. Other than that stay was great, liked the little croissant place across the road, starbucks nearby for a fix, close to Massey Hall for concert. Not sure i would stay again if i was going to cook though, so don't count on that.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look anywhere else in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: David E
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a good few hotels in Toronto over the last year as I travel on business and I now make a point in booking in the One King West as well as the other guys who travel with me. When your away from home you try to find the place that feels a little like home and this can be said here. Steve the GM and all the staff from management through to the kitchen, bar, reception and the parking guys are helpful, friendly and professional. The food is really good, the rooms are more than big enough for a single business traveller as well as couples, super clean & the hotel couldn't be in a better location in downtown. On my last trip my wife came with me and she can't stop raving about One King West, and she's not easily pleased... The gym on the 17th floor is small, yes, but has everything you need and I've never been in and had too wait for equipment. Along with the hotel being within the PATH system and close to the main entertainment area it's position on King Street allows for a short walk to a multitude of top restaurants and bars honestly, you don't need to look anywhere else in Toronto downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent food...people friendly”
Reviews.Author: CoachTO
Reviews.Content: We have been regular customers of One King's lobby bar for the past four years. Although we haven't had the chance of visiting over the past few months, we finally had the opportunity to eat at the lobby bar this past weekend. You can count on the food to always be delicious, and we once again were not disappointed....YUM! More importantly, the friendly smiles of their dynamic duo, Junard and Melissa, were exceptionally welcoming. Nothing was too much for them. Any request we had was greeted with a smile, and delivered in a timely fashion. Thanks guys for yet another wonderful evening. We'll be back soon!! (Nonnie and Howard)

Reviews.Title: “Nice...but small”
Reviews.Author: Steve D
Reviews.Content: Rooms have a nice little kitchen along with the sleeping area and a small desk. Decor is modern. The location is great right on the corner of King and Yonge St. and there is a nice bar/restaurant in the lobby. My only complaint is that the place is tiny, in ever respect. The rooms are tiny, especially the bathroom where the sink, toilet and stand up shower are just crammed in there. The same goes with the gym, which needs double the space and equipment to handle the users. The elevators take forever too! All in all, a nice hotel for a single person traveling on business, but don't even think of having more than one person in the room...you'll be tripping all over each other.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Four Star”
Reviews.Author: GinandTonic99
Reviews.Content: Great location without a doubt but not a four star hotel. Lobby area is dark and depressing. This was a bank in a previous life ..... enough said. Hostess at the lobby bar during our visit needs to research available anti-depressants. Our room was very small but well equipped (i.e. microwave, fridge, washing machine & dryer. Carpet in the room needed serious cleaning (were the stains blood or red wine?). Valet parking staff were awesome! We will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Noise from cleaning staff”
Reviews.Author: H_John1
Reviews.Content: I've lived here for several months in an extended stay and I've encountered several things worth complaining about. But nothing compares to the frustration I've endured from the noise that the cleaning staff here produce during the day. Since this is a hotel, every suite is cleaned every day by a team of maids. They are extremely loud and inconsiderate people who act as though there are no other people within their earshot as they work. If you stay here during the day, you will regularly here banging, crashing, slamming, thudding mixed with shouting and even singing, every day continuously from about 8am till about 6pm. To put this in context, there have been on occasion what sounded like bachelor parties in the suites around me. From these kinds of affairs, I don't really hear anything in my room. But when the cleaners are working, it's louder than a bachelor party. I chose to live in this building because it was very close to the major banks and I operate a small business that provides consulting services to them. My job requires me to work at a mix between my client sites and my home. This building initially seemed like a perfect fit. Unfortunately the amount of noise I hear during the day from these people makes it almost impossible to focus on my work. Even when wearing earplugs these people are so noisy I can't even think. As I'm writing this, there are two cleaners having a shouting match outside my door. This is a regular a occurrence, sometimes it's just one of them yelling into a cell phone or someone with a walkie-talkie radio with the volume turned up full blast. Once a group of cleaners was having a heated conversation with someone who looked like a manager directly outside my door. Rather frustrated by their lack of consideration, I engaged the manager directly and asked him if they could continue their conversation inside one of the suites with the door closed. He responded with "we're not shouting. please just relax" This was someone wearing a tie, so I'm rather shocked by the lack of professionalism demonstrated here. Case in point: If you're looking for a place to have an extended stay in downtown Toronto and hope to have an environment that is even remotely appropriate for working, do not consider One King West for this reason alone.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: mike k
Reviews.Content: I'm not a terrible picky person as I've had my share of disappointments in selecting hotels.This is a gem of a place.Its beautiful, location is perfect and the staff were courteous and very helpful.Great underground access to Union Station and the Air Canada Centre.See you again.

Reviews.Title: “good room, good location. good 2 week stay”
Reviews.Author: Maurits_van_Eijck
Reviews.Content: from the outside, thebuilding could have done with a bit of an update. The entrance hardly looks the part of a decent place to stay. Not so inside. Nice lobby with a bar. room was made up and cleaner properly all the time. Not luxurious, but certainly comfortable. Equipped with washing machine, dryer, microwave, kettle etc

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kelly417
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was beautiful. The lobby is gorgeous and the location was perfect. I was a little disappointed with the room though because it was very dirty. There was a door that pulled out from the wall to the bathroom and it was just covered with dirty finger prints. The mini kitchen area was very dirty as well (but I wasn't planning to use it anyway, so I guess that doesn't matter). Was just expecting the room to be a little nicer and cleaner considering the price. I think I'll try another hotel next time I go to Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay when on business”
Reviews.Author: UKBen75
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at One King West on more than a dozen occasions over the last 12 months. Its efficient, well located and serviceable. I don't require much when I'm travelling on business - wifi, decent bed and shower and a gym. One King West meets these requirements. Some of the rooms also contain mini-kitchenettes, which come in handy if you're staying for more than a week and don't like to eat out every meal. The restaurant downstairs also provides an excellent cooked breakfast with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Meh....”
Reviews.Author: Mdot t
Reviews.Content: The location was amazing but the lobby is very awkwardly set up with a bar in the middle, a restaurant in front of it and washrooms by the kitchen and the business center. The entrance was not marked properly and the valet took around 30 min to get our car. The front desk was confused, there were only 2 towels in the room outlets were almost impossible to find. Washroom was a good size and clean. I didnt enjoy my stay as I have in the past at hotels in the same price range. Also, at around 3 in the mornining there were some party people returned to their room but were extremly loud, one phone call to front desk and it was resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you stay on one of the higher floors!”
Reviews.Author: lucyc2008
Reviews.Content: My husband was in Toronto for work recently and was booked here in two different rooms over the course of a week. The first couple nights were in a room on one of the lower floors which are apparently also rented out to people as live in suites. The carpets were disgusting- even my husband wouldn't take his shoes off, the smell of smoke was everywhere and on the Saturday night there was a domestic dispute in the suite next door and the police arrived at about 3 in the morning. My husband then had to spend the night in a different hotel ( for work reasons) but returned to King West a day later, this time on one of the higher floors ( there is a seperate elevator for these floors). Our new room was amazing, great view, clean and spacious. What a difference it felt like we were in a completely different hotel. The staff here are also quite friendly and helpful. There is free Internet in the room however you have to connect your computer to the outlet- its not wireless. If you are in the lobby it is wireless here which is also free.

Reviews.Title: “Improving but not all the way there yet..”
Reviews.Author: ladyaph
Reviews.Content: This is the second stay for business. The first was not good at all, surly front desk staff who were disorganized and a valet who could not have cared less. What did impress me was that after the fact I received a voicemail from the GM, I did not end up talking to him but that was due to my lack of effort not his. This time, I stayed for six days. The initial experience at the front desk was a significant improvement, I was welcomed back and the service was quick and efficient. Much improved over last time. The room was lovely and clean. Housekeeping is still a minor irritant, no recycling offered and items used were not replaced. I ended up going across the street to the Shoppers Drug Mart as the next time I went to the front desk (night shift) they were not quite as helpful. Two bartenders at the hotel bar, one who was very friendly and the other completely ignored me and the other patrons in favour of the very attractive girl at the end of the bar. The other was friendly and helpful, including wishing me Happy Holidays and a pleasant trip home. All in all, I would and will stay there again. Nothing was a deal breaker and in line with what you would expect of a hotel in this price range and I love the washer / drier, kitchenette in the rooms. Further, the location can't be beat and I would like to think each time I go it will improve..

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you are downtown for business or training!”
Reviews.Author: aclassyrebel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at One King West twice in the last month when in the City for training. This is the perfect hotel if you want a little more space and more than a bed and desk area. I had the "C" floorplan both times and found it to be perfect for one ... was on the 29th and 34th floors facing southwest - beautiful! The room was very clean, as was the rest of the hotel. The staff were wonderful, and took care of my every need - even a room change when they were fully booked so that I could have the amenities I wanted. My courses were at 1 Front St W., so depending on the weather I made the 5 minute walk either outside or down in the PATH. About the only crtiticism I would have is about the kitchen amenities: one of the main reasons I booked here was to have a kitchenette. I love shopping at the St Lawrence Market, so being able to cook in my unit was very important. The cooktop, microwave and frig were perfect, but there wasn't much cookware - the first room had a large pot with a lid, and the second room had a 10" frypan with no lid. So unless microwave cooking is your style, be prepared to improvise alot! The other thing is that a small sponge would be great to have supplied in the kitchen. I hope management reads this and takes measures to improve these two things - they are the only reason I didn't give the hotel a top rating.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle P
Reviews.Content: We have been staying here for about 4 years. I would have to say we are impressed everytime we come. We started out staying here because of not being able to get a room at an establishment we had been staying at for about 17 years due to the Grey Cup being in town. My husband found this hotel on the website and we booked not knowing what we were getting. The staff was and has always been very pleasant and welcoming to us. We have taken advantage of the breakfast and the staff that works with the breakfast, Lili and Arianne as well as a few others are always willing to take care of whatever you need and because of this you do not mind showing your appreciation by tipping them for their service. Catherine the night manager took very good care of us. We expressed what we were looking for during our 4 day 3 night stay and we were greatly impressed with our accomodations as well as the price for our stay. As of now, I would have to say that if it is willing, we plan to be back next year celebrating another Wedding Anniversary at the Suites at One King West.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room, great location, disappointing amenities”
Reviews.Author: GDP33
Reviews.Content: A truly spacious 'suite' style room in central Toronto with tasteful, if somewhat bland, decor. The ideal place for longer stays or business trips which will require time spent working in the room. One slight drawback is the lack of WiFi in the room (how is this sort of thing still possible in a city like Toronto?). During my stay construction work was being undertaken on the public areas of the hotel. This may well transform the 'look and feel' of the hotel which is currently a little tired when it comes to public areas. The same goes for the gym which appears to have a nice 'wet area' (sauna and whirlpool) but the work out room is a dated eye sore - a crowded graveyard for antique dumbbells and other 'hand-me-down' equipment (although the treadmills were fine). And while the restaurant staff and bell hop were friendly and helpful the lady who checked me in at reception was surly and gruff (the more surprising since, in my experience, Canadians are generally some of the most welcoming people in the world).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: acanadagal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and didn't want to leave. The room I stayed in was fresh, clean, and inviting. Bathroom had a nice ceramic tile throughout. My room was equipped with kitchen equipment - small fridge, stovetop, microwave - I guess because it is also a residence. The view out the large window was amazing. I could see down to the busy road but was high enough up not to hear it. Could see on top of some other buildings. Good location, pretty central.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend deal.”
Reviews.Author: ReddOak
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a converted bank building. Since it is designed for people who need to stay for several nights, the rooms are equiped with everything including a dishwasher, washer and dryer. On the weekend they often have a special rate that includes complimentary valet parking and breakfast for two adults. Children under six eat free. The staff are courteous, patient and friendly. We had our two tiny grandchildren with us who ran all over the room with their 'wheeled luggage'. The young man who helped us with our bags was so kind and patiently stepped over them any time they ran across his path! We have stayed here twice and plan to do so again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 10”
Reviews.Author: Tina254_11
Reviews.Content: What can I say, this was one of the best hotels I have stayed in. Not only did they help us book our evening activity before we arrived, they made sure we had everyhting we needed for our stay. The restauant was execellent. The food was so good and our server was amazing, very very friendly. The hotel was spotless and the room is the perfect size for either family or friends. I love the fact that there is a fridge in the room. I could only wish all hotels had this feature. The view from my room was amazing. The hotel is well situated in the heart of the entertainment district. One last thing the Valet and Bell Boys were very attentive. Job well done!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and luxury accommodations”
Reviews.Author: wakeboarders1573
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I chose to stay at One King West Hotel & residence to celebrate our Birthdays together, because of the hotel's proximity to the down-town area and were very pleased that we did! We had dinner in the restaurant on site and had a wonderful gentleman serve us, the food was great and arrive quickly. Our rooms were beautifully decorated with an amazing view of the city, they were very clean and functional. Every person on staff we came in contact with from the valet guys to the bell boys to the concierge and front desk, they were all professional and friendly! I would highly recommend staying at this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Hookers galore”
Reviews.Author: gilvs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a saturday night at the end of November. Our room was in the older part of the hotel, view was just of the balconies opposite. It was very clean and I liked the kitchen area and washer and dryer - very useful for longer stays though we didn't need to use them. The bed was extremely comfortable. I would have preferred to have had a bath in the bathroom instead of just a shower. Toiletries were from Bath and Body Works. We went out for dinner and to the 3 Brewers for drinks, then decided to go to the hotel bar before going up to our room. We very quickly realised that the other women in the bar were hookers and spent a fascinating hour watching them ply their trade. I think the layout of the lobby is unfortunate because it is a huge open area and the bar is by the entrance to the hotel rooms so you can see everyone coming and going. I am aware that all the hotels have hookers hanging out in them but it was a lot more obvious here because of the layout. The barman wasn't particularly friendly, he seemed more interested in serving shots to one of the hookers (I can understand why she needed them when I saw the client), and serving more drinks to a man who had already had far too many and could hardly stand up. Hookers were also coming in via the back door, being let into the elevator area by the hotel employees and then leaving after 10 minutes or so via the back door again. Our booking included parking in the price but we got a bill for $20 that said it was for parking. The parking is actually $30 so not sure why they tried to charge us, when I queried it the guy at the desk apologised and removed the charge. I would summarise the hotel as average and living on the name and reputation that it had when it first opened, it would be ok for a longer stay because of the facilities in the room. The location is good, though Yonge Street was filthy with garbage everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: marylandtravel007
Reviews.Content: This is an unusual hotel. For one thing, it used to be a bank, and some of the rooms are carved out of the original bank building. Other rooms are in a new steel and glass high-rise tower. The hotel is designed for long-term stays -- rooms have washing machines and dryers, cook tops, microwaves, fridges, pots, pans, plates, flatware, etc. There are several grades of rooms at different price points. We reserved one of the lower-priced rooms. It turned out to be in the tower, so it had a nice view from the 19th floor, but it was very very cramped. So we asked for another room in that category and were show an identical room on a different floor. Finally they offered us a room in the "heritage" part of the building, in the same price category but roomier -- at least its square shape made it seem roomer. Staff was always friendly and helpful. Room was very clean. And the location at King and Yonge puts it dead center in the heart of downtown. We spent a four-day weekend without taking a streetcar, a subway or a taxi. We could walk everywhere we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury comfort in heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Anne G
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the heart of entertainment district, shopping, close to major transportation hubs and easy to get to via highway or public transit. Rooms are quiet, despite location you could not hear anything from the street. Rooms are an excellent choice for people travelling and requiring more than 1 night stay as the kitchenettes were both versatile and easy to use. Beds were comfortable. Unique transformation of and old bank building into modern suites. Stylish lobby with courtesy staff, we would return anytime to stay at One King West!

Reviews.Title: “One King West delivers excellent service and value”
Reviews.Author: Sharon H
Reviews.Content: I have had the opportunity to stay at One King West a number of times. Each time I have been given a beautiful unique room with all the amedities and comfort of home. The staff and service set the bar at a 5 star level. It is the best place to stay when visiting Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “One King West is the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: Laur3131
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at One King West hotel many times while staying downtown Toronto and I have had an amazing stay every time. From the inviting nature of the Valet staff upon arrival to the friendly smile I received at front desk every time I passed. This hotel made me feel right at home. I would recommend One King West to anyone staying in downtown Toronto. The Location is amazing with everything you would need right at your fingertips.

Reviews.Title: “Fiasco”
Reviews.Author: HungryPeople
Reviews.Content: Decided to try this hotel afer good reviews from colleagues. Arrived after a long day and even though my room was paid up, was told they were overbooked. Then sent to the Delta Chelsea and a room that was nowhere near the level I paid for, across a construction zone, broken tv, and far from where I needed to be. Decided to write this review while my room rattled early in the morning from the trucks rolling into the construction site. The beauty of the Internet is that I can share this experience with more than just my colleagues and my company, which had just begun to use this hotel as a preferred supplier. If you can't show up at your hotel and know that your room will be waiting for you, why bother.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: Matt H
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest surprises of all of the hotels in Toronto. The hotel is beautiful, staff is friendly, rooms are clean with great views. Location is absolutely perfect. Washer/Dryer in each room, perfect for the business traveler. I would highly recommend this hotel (and I do) to anyone looking for a fantastic stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “My first choice in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: Noose_11
Reviews.Content: My first choice for accomodations in Toronto is The Suites at One King West. The location is unbeatable, walking distance to anything and everything. Beautiful lobby and rooms, this old building has been remodelled and combines character and modern hospitality. Staff are welcoming and friendly, rooms comfortable and clean. I have recommended the Suites at One King West to many friends and they have all raved of the experience as well. I am looking forward to my next visit to Toronto and my next stay at this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “unique”
Reviews.Author: MattHamiltonontario
Reviews.Content: "Unique" is an overused word today and is rarely used appropriately. In the case of One King West however this word most defintely applies. The hotel itself was a bank and a very grand bank with marble everywhere and cast brass accents. From my seat in the bar I could look down to the vault all left as it would been in its past life. Up wide sweeping stairs, what is now a banquet hall was where all the tellers would have been, a very formidable room. The trek to our room took us down a maze of hallways puctuated with plaques showing old Toronto landmarks and giving a brief historical account of them. The rooms were modest in size, clean,well appointed, with a kitchen area. If not truly unique, it is rare to find a hotel so well situated at an affordable price. I found the rates to be quite reasonable (I booked my room on-line and pre-paid) considering the location, right on Younge Street the heart of the city! All in all a great stay and...I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Charm, comfort and convenience in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: mattandy
Reviews.Content: The old Toronto Dominion Bank building has been beautifully and masterfully converted into a delightful and convenient spot to enjoy what downtown Toronto has to offer. Walk out the door, go east and you can visit the St. Lawrence market area, go south for the Harbourfront and walk north to the main downtown business and shopping area. From the basement you can access the miles and miles of underground PATH walkways with shops and eating places galore. The fully equipped rooms will appeal to those who want to stay longer and want to prepare the odd meal using the hotplates and microwave, with the added convenience of a dishwasher, washer and dryer. The staff are helpful and friendly. Tip: check out the massive vault in the basement and the beautiful old banking hall on the 2nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous views of the City!”
Reviews.Author: musicmankissimmee
Reviews.Content: Helpful friendly staff. My husband and I have stayed here at least 10 times and we are always welcomed back. Well appointed rooms. Every room is a suite. Feels like home away from home. A short walk, cab ride, or take the subway which is right outside the front door, to many excellent restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and Grace”
Reviews.Author: chippyandbugs
Reviews.Content: This beautifully renovated historical building has been transformed into an upscale but affordable hotel. Close to excellent restaurants, and an easy walk to the theatre, One King Street provided a beautiful and relaxing one night stay for my husband and I. The views over Toronto are fun and you can enjoy the unique architecture and gargoyles on the building just south of it. The bed was comfortable, the staff porfessional and the old back vault in the basement of the hotel is a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel. My absolute favourite!”
Reviews.Author: Erin O
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this hotel. The service is incredible, the hotel is absolutely beautiful. It is very clean and updated and modern, and the staff are terrific. The sleep quality is the best I have experienced at any hotel....the beds are the most comfortable hotel beds in the world. The location is perfect, everything is a short walking distance including great restaurants. I would recommend, and do recommend, this hotel to anyone and everyone. It is beautiful and classy and comfortable and the staff are all very friendly and incredibly helpful. My favourite hotel in the world by far!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave D
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to see a hockey game at the Air Canada Centre. Hotel is attached to the underground mall so getting to the game was very easy. The room we had was clean and spacious. We were trying to decide what we were going to do until the game and the staff was very helpful in giving us some ideas. We will definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Numerous Stays at the Beautiful One King West”
Reviews.Author: Ed L
Reviews.Content: I have had numerous opportunities to stay in Toronto whether with my wife or friends, and once we found One King West, we have never looked back. From the beautiful views to the exceptional treatment by all staff, this is the place we want to go to when we are finished a night on the town. Can't say enough great things about your establishment. I have referred many friends and have never heard anything but rave reviews. Keep up the good work!!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the Heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Stone C
Reviews.Content: The convience is only surpassed by the kind and courteous staff. I will return whenever I am in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay”
Reviews.Author: TorontoSpagirl
Reviews.Content: My husband had bid on a certificate at work for charity from One King West. The web site made this hotel look very modern and like a really nice boutique hotel. To me it was like a run down condo. If you want a really basic room maybe a 2 star. The bathroom was old the room was worn. There was a long hair in my bed which grossed me out. I slept with my clothes on. I did not have bad service but would rather spend the money to stay at the Ritz or the Hazelton More money but worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “I was very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: DLCAlberta
Reviews.Content: My annual conference chose One King West this year for our venue. As it is in Toronto's financial district, I was a bit concerned. At the end of it all (my two-night stay), however, One King West had a new convert! Located in an historic renovated TD bank building, the hotel is classically striking in appearance, lots of marble. I was on a lower floor, NOT in the high tower that has at least 45 floors. there are two elevator banks, one for each, and mine was very fast, no waiting. I have never had such a quiet room. There was no noise from above, from the next rooms, from the hall, and very little from outside. The room was elegant, big, comfy; bed was comfy with great linens. Towels were plentiful and good. Internet connection was with Ethernet, not wireless, which the front desk did not tell me initially, so hook-up took a bit of time and a telephone call. Here were the not-so-good things: small bathroom shelf and small vanity made it a bit crowded in there; low wattage light bulb in my floor lamp; front desk didn't tell me i could get a newspaper delivered in the morning; my windows didn't open although it looked as though they would and I wanted them to; TV was not flat screen nor as big as some. Good things: I had a separate shower stall and tub; front desk staff were obliging; admin was good (I had had to change my reservation details a couple of times); bar set-up was nice; valet service good. My heating system was very quiet, much quieter than many I've had, although a friend's in another room was very noisy, she reported. The room also had kitchen equipment in it. It all looked very attractive although i didn't use any of it. There are lots of good restaurants just minutes away on King Street and Wellington. This hotel is easily accessible from the Gardiner. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The quirks outnumber the perks”
Reviews.Author: Gemutlichkeit
Reviews.Content: I'm visiting Toronto from the states for a conference, and this was the conference hotel. So I can't say that I have shopped around for comparable rooms in the downtown Toronto area. To me, the room rate seems reasonable. BUT, there are so many inconveniences or oddities that make me think that staying somewhere else would have been a good choice. THE ROOM - the room is very oddly shaped -- extremely long, and very narrow. I actually ran laps in it my first night, since I couldn't go walking outside due to the rain. OK - not a big deal. THE INTERNET, part one - Like others had commented, only the lobby area is wi-fi; the rooms are hard wired. There is a small desk in the room where the ethernet cable clearly should be, since there is a port for it in the lamp. I look all over the desk area (which takes 2 seconds, because it's quite small) and then call down to the front desk. They then treated me like an idiot, as if I didn't know what an ethernet cable was. They sent their "Tech Support" up -- dude, I don't need tech support to find an ethernet cable. Anyway, it's the hotel maintenance guy who shows up. He doesn't see the cable, and then remembers that it's tucked away....behind the bed. He has to pull the bed out from the wall (crawling all over my sheets to do so) and he says I can use the internet from in bed. I ask for a longer cable, so he proceeds to crawl all over my sheets again in order to wind the cable across the room. I spend all of my trip with an ethernet cable draped across the room, as I sit in one of their uncomfortable chairs, with the laptop on my lap. Stupid. THE INTERNET, part two: connection speed - Terrible. TERRIBLE! And spotty. I don't know if this is an issue of #FirstWorldProblems or what, but it's not like I'm visiting a developing nation. C'mon, Canada! IN-ROOM AMENITIES - very plain. It was a pleasant surprise to find a washer / dryer in the room, not that I was staying long enough to use that. But were I staying longer, that could have been a great asset in terms of reducing the number of clothes I brought. The in-room coffee / tea service is cheap, cheap, cheap. I drank one of my bags of tea one morning (the caffeinated one, and opened the fixers packet to access the tea. I noticed that room service had set an extra bag of tea down for me, and I thought that was sweet of them -- giving me an extra bag of tea for the morning. In the morning, I then realized that the extra bag was the one tea I HADN'T had. And, the fixings bag was simply replaced as is -- torn open, and with the sugar missing. RIDICULOUS. KEYS - My keys stopped working after just a few hours. I'm not the only conference attendee to whom that happened. CONFERENCE SPACES - the plenary session is in a beautiful great hall, but the sound is also ridiculous. You couldn't hear a thing that the speaker said due to the echo. And the microphone and PA system (operated by 2 people?) was so cheap that it was heavy on the mids, making it blurry very difficult to understand. Cheap, cheap, cheap. TOWELS - cheap and over-used. Thin. But, you know, they get you dry, so, whatever. LOCATION - really good! Nice location, between lots of lively neighborhoods. Safe. Directly in front of a subway stop, on the street car lines. Really good location. THE PHONE - staticky. Poor connections, even within the hotel. And, the buttons don't connect you with the folks you are requesting. For example, the front desk button actually takes you to a switchboard for the wakeup call service. THE SERVICE - kind of grumpy, though the behind the scenes people were exceptionally friendly. It's the folks at the front desk who acted kind of snooty. THE SLEEPING - Very quiet rooms. You will have the hum from all the appliances in the room. The only odd thing is that my room overlooked a plaza with a fountain, and I think they are doing construction on the plaza. There were super-bright krieg lights down there that kept the room fairly illuminated, even with the curtains drawn. In all, I guess for the price, it was fine. But I'll bet there are much more convenient options around. I was not impressed and would NOT recommend to others. But if you are staying here, it's not the worst place I've ever stayed; it just has issues.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty - stay away”
Reviews.Author: HankF99
Reviews.Content: Great location, outstanding service, very good beds and pillows. HUGE room. Fantastic breakfast buffet in the lobby. There is a lot that is very very good! But . . . The shower situation sucks. Separate bath and shower, and shower stall terrible. It is cramped, and the curtain rod is straight so the curtain is clinging to you the whole time. And the curtain isn't brand new, either, its old and ratty. The whole bathroom is stupid, just take out the old dumb tub and open up the space for a real shower. Indeed, the place is dirty. The carpets are disgusting. They look 20 years old. Outside elevators, stains galore. In my suite (725) it looks like someone threw up on the carpet the night before. The desk was sticky and smudgy, like someone spilled juice on it and not cleaned properly. I did not use any of the appliances but they all looked old and shaky. The wifi sucks too. The lobby has free wifi, but it sucks. The rooms have wired internet only.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Brichana
Reviews.Content: I've been to hotels and motels that were known to be much more "lower-class" than this one, but I have never experienced such bad treatment as I have in this one---the others don't even compare to this one on that level. Granted, we did show up early, so it wasn't a surprise that our room wasn't ready yet. We went out and called a few hours later and were told that our room was ready. It wasn't ready and we were asked if we could wait another half and hour. We did and the room still wasn't ready. One of the front desk girls asked if I wanted a room on a lower floor and didn't understand what I meant when I asked if I would still get the "guaranteed view" I had paid extra for. She finally got it when she noticed that the ones who had taken my reservation had not made the proper changes. We still had to wait, finally getting the keys to our room past the 3 o'clock waiting time (their last excuse was that housekeeping couldn't find a mop---this was funny to hear as I watched one of the staff from the open-concept restaurant walking by with a mop while I was waiting). The room was nice but definitely not as big as the picture on their website led you to believe (although, beside the vase with flowers, it was accurate---it's just the way they took the picture---it seems like your room will be quite bigger). The worse of it all was when we went to check out. When it came time to giving us back the money the hold for cases of damages and the like, they accused us of smoking---NEITHER my husband or I smoke. What's funny is that my husband had noticed a can that said when we came back to our room after breakfast. He asked me if it was mine to which I said "No". When I noticed it said "Smoke" and something, I said maybe housekeeping uses it for the smoke on stuff or something. I also noticed the top of one (maybe even two) was opened (I think I would have noticed this before as I spend a lot of time looking out at the great views). Anyways, the front desk girl ended up giving us back the money. Then, another person from the front desk (maybe even a manager), comes back to see us and says that I told a front desk girl the day before that my husband was outside smoking, to which I replied that I wouldn't say that as my husband doesn't even smoke. They let us go again and as we are putting our stuff in the car, the same guy comes out again, now saying that someone saw the both of us smoking outside and that the valet said our car was "reeking of cigarette smoke"---which was funny because we told the first valet that we didn't want our car 'til we left---so the car would obviously have the odour of cigarettes if what they were saying was true. Of course, the guy refused to smell the car or any of the belongings we had. My husband even showed the tray from our car which was filled with change. We finally left. I considered contacting the General Manager of this Hotel, but after going thorough so much humiliation and dishonesty, I really don't think that the General Manager and the staff care about anyone else than their high-class clientele. If you are one of us "average joes" I strongly suggest you go elsewhere---I really wouldn't want to see anyone else go through the nightmare we went through at One King West.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Reasonable Price Down Town Toronto Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Enrico K
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel from a travel site that did not show the hotel name. It was the most reasonable price we could find in the downtown Toronto. The hotel was originally a bank that has been converted. They did a good job in modernizing the room and at the same time preserving the historic value of the building. Hotel room was the smallest I've ever been in. The room that we got has no tub, only showers but clean. If you are renting/ driving a car, finding the hotel is not difficult but finding the entrance to the hotel is another thing. We have to circle the hotel 2 times before we realize that the entrance was hidden in an alley that looks like a dead end alley. Front desk and valet service were courteous and professional. The nice surprise with this hotel was finding a washer/ dryer inside the room. However, you have to bring/ ask for detergent yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelskg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the end of our holiday and were absolutely thrilled with our room. It was clean, tastefully furnished and the bed was really comfortable. We were on the 29th floor and we had a superb view of Lake Ontario, Toronto Downtown and a glimpse of the Tower. Everyone at this hotel was extremely hospitable and respectful towards us from the moment we arrived until we left. Being able to enter our hotel downstairs directly from the subway was a bonus after a lot of shopping at Eaton Centre which is close by. We hired a car from the concierge desk to visit Niagara Falls for the day and they arranged everything for us perfectly. I would highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel with some issues”
Reviews.Author: musicmansimpson
Reviews.Content: I'm starwood platinum, but having fulfilled my minimum quota to renew my status for this year, I decided to give this hotel a try since I was heading to an early morning meeting across the street. The public areas of the hotel are beautiful, if not a little hodge podge. They're constrained by a very narrow plot of land on which the hotel sits, and so it seems the lobby bar is sort of in the way, and everything seems like it's just jammed in there. I received a premium view room with a nice view south and east. It was a spectacular view. However, while the front desk clerk said I would like the room more than my standard fare in Toronto, I think I'd disagree. It was probably modern in its day, but looking a little worn. Also, housekeeping wasn't as good as one would hope -- the glasses in the room had some crusty bits, hairs from previous guests on the bathroom toilet and in the sink, a bed that was made but not very carefully. Things you generally don't like to see in this kind of hotel. I think one of my biggest complaints would be that the air vent system, which seemed to be funnelled through one of the cupboards above the microwave, was very noisy. And it would run (perhaps for the hallway or other rooms?) even when my individual heating and cooling unit in the room was turned off. So it wasn't a very quiet room -- coupled with some car, street, and siren noise coming from 29 floors down on Yonge Street. Also, only wired internet in the room. And the desk is nowhere near the (tube) TV, so good luck working and having the TV on at the same time. It was a large room, but somewhat awkwardly laid out. Given the option to pay less, receive more and be treated like a VIP at my usual haunts a few blocks away, I don't think I'll return. Is it a bad hotel? Absolutely not. But they certainly miss the mark in certain areas, and there are other, better options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: DeirdreWade
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions for both business and pleasure. The location on the Yonge subway line and the connection to the PATH are ideal. No need to even go outside. Particularly relevant on cold wintery days. Drinks at the Bar are fun. Great place to people watch. The Front Desk and Bell staff are always help. I like that the rooms are consistent and that I always know in advance what my room will look like and the amenities that will be available. Security is good. My only complaints this time were that the vanity in my room was a little beat up and that the towels seemed a little thin. Both of which I was able to overlook for the convenience of the location.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarahwinter_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 5 nights while attending a convention at Toronto Metro Convention Center. It was an easy 15-20 minute walk to the convention center. As downtown is very busy with people walking, I ( female) felt safe at all times walking on my own. You will come across a few homeless people sleeping on the street in the evening or early morning. The room I had was a studio suite: a king bed, sitting area, 2 tv's, bar fridge, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, dishwasher (!), washer and dryer(!) plus cutlery. I did not use dishwasher or washing machine but I think you have to buy detergent for same or bring your own from home. The room had ample space and was extremely nice. However, if a view is important ask for that when you book. My room did not have an outside view/window ie my view was to the 'inside' of the hotel. This did not bother me in the least because I was only there to sleep. I took a cab from airport for approx $60.00 but on the way back to airport I walked with luggage to the Fairmont York Hotel to catch the Airport Express bus for $23.95. It was an easy 10-15 min walk. If rush hour traffic is not a problem, the bus to airport was 25 minutes. The express bus runs every 30 minutes but check schedule. I would stay at this hotel again if I was looking for a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good Service, noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Gerry V
Reviews.Content: I was lookiing forward to staying in this hotel since it was rated pretty highly. This was orginally a bank building that has been converted to a hotel. As you enter you feel like you have come to an upscale place. From the concierge to the front desk staff they provided very good service. This was very promising. We had a suite so we found the room reasonably large and it included a mini kitchen, although you felt like you were in a backelor apartment suite. The TV was an old tube style, the carpets looked like they had seen better days. The sound insulation was poor, we could hear the TV next door and late in the night as people were returning it was very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you get a renovated room”
Reviews.Author: Pinpollito
Reviews.Content: The common areas of this hotel look a little worn, and it does take a while to get to your floor with the elevator system. I was lucky to be allocated a renovated room, with a good kitchen areaÂ (including brand-new dishwasher and washing machine!). My colleague had similar facilities but said his room was shabby, with very little natural light. The free wifi worked well, and the hotel was convenient for the meeting I attended. I didnâ€™t use any of the other facilities.Â

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: mx3man123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at One King West on September 18th 2011 for the Toronto International Film Festival. It's a little hard to drive there as there valet is on a small side street that wasn't the easiest to get too. Check in was a breeze and the lobby was very clean and looked very inviting. We stayed on the 34th floor in a one bedroom suite. Very nice room, you could tell the hotel is a little older. Some things in the room that made it look dated is Picture tube TV's, stains on the curtains, stains on the carpets, scrapes in the bathtub, missing caulking etc.... this is all to be expected when the hotel isn't new. You cannot beat the location of this hotel though, you are steps away from Eaton Center, a couple of blocks away from most theatres in the city and very close to a zillion great restaurants. One thing that did annoy me was I had asked for some chocolate covered strawberries to be in the room when we checked in and I told them exactly when we were checking in. They did not arrive, we were in the room for 2 hours before going out for dinner, upon our return from dinner and a movie at 11:30pm they were there and the chocolate was melted off them even though there was a fridge for them to put them in so I found this annoying. Other then that the hotel is very nice but the best attribute of this place is the location, you cannot beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, great location”
Reviews.Author: Robyn L
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Toronto on the Thursday before Thanksgiving in the middle of rush hour(we are British, so had no idea this was happening!), but One King West was very easy to find, thank God! It's location is great, right in the middle of the financial district, close to the theatre district. A short 5 / 10 minute stroll takes you to the theatres and where a lot of the eateries are. The room itself was nice, clean and quite spacious. We had a kitchenette in ours, with a washer and dryer we were very thankful for as we were doing a lengthy drive around the US and Canada, so as you can imagine we had a big pants and socks wash to do! The only thing that I wasn't keen on was being on the 36th floor, the lift was quick, but I personally am not very good with heights. Ask for a room on one of the lower floors of you are the same. Overall a very good hotel, they have a nice bar (it's a little pricey) and the staff are very customer focused.

Reviews.Title: “seen its best days”
Reviews.Author: HoganMalmo
Reviews.Content: I went for a convention in Toronto and stayed nearly a week at One King West. The hotel has a good location in the centre. Got a room at the 13th floor (a bit unusual to find floor no 13:-)). IÂ´m sure the room was really nice 10 years ago but today it came across at slightly old and oldfashioned. The breakfast was nice but for the price (over 30 dollar) I expect more. A very average hotel thats a little bit boring. The aircondition in the room started every hour and sounded like a truck next to the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Classic business hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicMTL
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights at the One King West. Great rooms with complete kitchenettes, washing machine, etc. Wonderful shower. No free wifi... Kinda lame for a business hotel. Check in / check out very smooth. Hotel had a power failure for more than half a day and the better part of an evening but only provided free lemonade to guests as a compensation... No comments. This is a conveniently located business hotel but nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Good Room but Disappointing People Service”
Reviews.Author: BiBiMami
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in September 2011. We made the booking by phone after we found it on the internet. The room was in the old part of the building, spacious with a kitchen area. We were happy with the room. If we gave the room a 10, we would give 0 to the people service. We stayed at Le Meridien the night before because One King West was full. We walked with 2 heavy luggages on foot to the hotel the next day. When we arrived, 2 bell service staff were outside, none of them came to help. They just waved their arms saying " in there"...pointing us the direction of the check in counter. When I was waiting for my husband during the check-in, none of the bell service staff inside the hotel looked my way. I was soaking wet (due to the rain) and had 2 luggages...standing beside the main entrance. They seemed to be so busy with whatever they were doing that they totally ignored me. It's a very small area...I don't think they didn't see me. We got the luggage up to the room ourselves. On Day 2, I asked the bell service to book a taxi to take us to a far away area that evening...the young man said it's taken care of...and I assumed it was. When we went to the bell service, they said there's no record showing that we had asked for a taxi. The young man we talked to simply said "I was not here when you called, it was somebody else." What kind of attitude is this? No apology and apparently no training at all. When we came back later that evening, we got off the taxi and walked on the entry carpet that led to the front entrance...2 bell service staff were standing right in the middle of the carpet, facing our side, chatting to each other. None of them gave us a look. None of them had the courtesy of moving aside to let us pass. We had to "detour" to avoid walking into them. During the 3 days we stayed, I didn't see any one at the front desk greet us whenever we passed by....no eye contact....cold and stone faced. I guess it's like what my local friend in Toronto said " it's majorly a residence hotel for long and short term stay, the service can be lukewarm." Honestly, it's colder than lukewarm to me. My comment is: the room was good and clean. But the staff was, at least in our case, unwelcoming, indifferent and, perhaps, not fit for hospitality industry.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: TOCDNTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a long holiday weekend. I had a premium room in the new tower, which was spacious, very well equipped, and had a spectacular view over the city, harbour and lake. The bathroom was functional, but a bit small. Both the room and bathroom were spotless. The bed was very comfortable. There is a small gym with treadmills, dumbbells, and two perpetual pools. The hotel is right in the cityâ€™s financial district and close to the theatre district and the Eaton Centre too. There are lots of restaurants nearby, and a subway entrance outside the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but lacking in some key areas”
Reviews.Author: mistershrewd
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice, though what had been advised as a "suite" was really nothing more than a hotel room with high ceilings and a bunch of appliances. A couple of things bothered me abut the place: - the $12 Stella in the lobby bar was a little ripe. I understand Toronto pricing, and I understand hotel pricing, but twelve bucks seemed a little excessive - the room service food was prety awful and pretty expensive; at least the night menu. The thing that really cheesed me abut it however was that they included a tip in the delivery price, but then left a spot for me to write in a tip only credit card slip. Which I did, because it was late and I was not paying attention, so I essentially tipped them twice. It seemed rather disingenuous to do this...almost like duping a tip out of someone. Well, consider myself duped. - the two times I asked the valet service to have my car ready at a certain hour, it seemed like a complete shock to the people working there that I showed up looking for my car at that time. Kind of defeats the purpose of booking a time. Other than that, it was nice. Seemed clean enough and the staff were nice enough to make up for whatever inadequacies the hotel suffers from. I think if I was a rich tourist rather than a business visitor I would have liked it better.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away if you would like to sleep”
Reviews.Author: MrJD1
Reviews.Content: On September 30, my partner and I were excited about trying a new hotel. Our excitement diminished rather quickly after checking in.
