The reservation was for a superior room with a king size bed. The first room had a double bed. The second room did indeed have a king size bed but our superior room was now a little box of a room. When we asked for our superior room, the front desk was curt and somewhat rude informing us that there was nothing that could be done. The room itself was extremely small and had seen better days. The side chair was extremely dirty and the bath towels worn and should have been used as cleaning rags. Not to be discouraged and still wanting to enjoy our stay we decided to put it behind us. BUT the worst thing about this hotel was that we had 4 fire alarms - one at 3 am. Every time, we walked down the 28 flights of stairs, just in case. It seems that because the rooms have kitchens that the people staying would regularly burn something in their room setting of the fire alarms. After the fire department came and gave the all clear, we would wait for the one elevator working (there was never more than one elevator working at any one time). Before check out we requested a late check out and again the front desk was rude and dismissive. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THAT YOU STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: EarthlyPowers
Reviews.Content: This apartment/suite hotel appears to be owned and managed by a bunch of enthusiastic but bumbling amateurs. It took 2 hours from the time we arrived at reception to the time we could finally enter our room: 3 sets of keys which did not work, 3 of 4 elevators out of order, disappearing maintenance workers to fix the keys etc. etc.. On top of that we had to endure 3 false fire alarms including one at 2 a.m. which went on for 20 minutes, and then a disgusting lukewarm breakfast with dishwater coffee and disdainful service to cap off the experience. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel gets worse every time we stay.”
Reviews.Author: ashsem
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at 1 King West for several years--we love the location, and the kitchen and laundry in the rooms. This year we stayed for a week in July and it was a DISASTER. Our room was filthy--cobwebs hanging off of every surface, hair in the bathroom, dirty underwear behind the chair cushion, chair itself needed a good scrubbing. Also, throughout the week, maintenance was being performed on the a/c and heat, but we had no notice, so came back in need of a pre-theater shower only to find our door propped open (!!!!) and various equipment scattered on the bed. Also, the workers used our bathroom towels to mop up their mess, so we had no towels. This happened three days out of the seven we were there. The day after the first intrusion, we did get a letter from management stating they would be coming on a day that no one actually showed up. As we were leaving the hotel, we requested a taxi and they tried to put us in one of the hotel cars that charges 3x more than a taxi (which is why we had specifically requested a taxi). Beware of this scam. On a side note, this hotel holds lots of conferences and every time we have stayed this phenomenon has gotten significantly worse--prostitutes. CLEARLY Toronto prostitutes are aware of the lonely businessmen in this place and they spend an inordinate amount of time in the lobby bar and spill drunkenly out of the elevators at all hours. No one wears underwear, so if you bring kids, prepare for a lengthy life lesson. As much as I like the location and amenities of this hotel, I think it's time to find another.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: swfguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in June and liked it very much. The hotel is in an old bank building and the rooms are larger suites equipped with a small kitchen and even a washer and dryer. The rooms are updated, fresh, clean and comfortable. There is a small restaurant and bar but the prices seemed high. Since this is in the Financial District of downtown Toronto it is quite easy to find a large selection of restaurants and bars to enjoy that meet your tastes and budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in downtown core”
Reviews.Author: jkkras
Reviews.Content: Second trip to Toronto and the hotel, and an excellent stay. Best to have a room in the tower as high as possible - get great views and peace and quiet while in the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: vjktrinidad
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a fabulous location in the heart of toronto. king West offers complete suites with kitchenette and laundry in a comfortable room. Fab views from higher floors. recommend staying in the tower.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: ilykefood
Reviews.Content: Buddy golf trip to Toronto. Located on the corner of Yonge and King Street. The hotel is in the Entertainment District, couple of blocks from the CN Tower, NHL HOF, restaurants, bars and shopping. We could not ask for a better location. Hotel is nice, clean and staff very helpful but the location was perfect. It was also close to the Expressway. We played golf at Glen Abbey, Lionhead and Osprey Resort. The Canadian Hockey HOF is at Glen Abbey. Very diverse city and lots of places to eat, hang out, see and be seen. Will be going back soon!

Reviews.Title: “nice and useful”
Reviews.Author: Alebello
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 nights and we think is a very useful hotel with a nice location in downtown we also think that the price per night was really convenient a good choice if you don't want a five star hotel the room was really big, maybe too much in comparison with the bathroom..is like a little apartment with all you need to cook and to clean your clothes

Reviews.Title: “The best downtown Toronto hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne G
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine had her wedding at the hotel so rather then go to where I would normally stay downtown, I stayed at the One King West Hotel for 4 nights in April/May 2011. I have found a new favourite hotel in downtown Toronto! The rooms and suites are decorated with understated elegance, the hotel staff (valet, front desk, bar/wait staff) were, without exception, professional, efficient and courteous. I had a few unusual requests for Catherine, the night manager, during my 4 night stay but she easily made everything happen. The location @ King/Yonge is perfect for shopping, dining and bar hopping.

Reviews.Title: “Wow such a classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: redhead01
Reviews.Content: This was a such a nice hotel with a modern feel....washer and dryer right in the room. Great place for a couple getting away from it all. Good location. Eaton center short walk. Steps to subway....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: harvey s
Reviews.Content: Labour Day weekend. The Hotel was historic but up to date. The rooms and facilities were very good. One of the best loacations in town. Didn't need our car. Close to retaurants, theatre district and public transit etc.. Plus if the weather is inclement it's funt to explore a series of undrground passage ways going all around downtown Toronto filled with restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place in a good location but overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: wodaabe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location with the metro right outside as well as a Starbucks, a bakery, etc. The hotel itself feels like it isn't a hotel and for good reason because apparently it doubles as an apartment complex. Unfortunately there are not automatic doors at every entrance which would make it a bad choice for someone who is handicapped. The room was equipped with dishwasher, washer and dryer, and mini-kitchen which would make it an excellent choice for a long-term stay, but overall it was just average and not worth the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: coxman343
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at One King West Hotel and Residence. The hotel is in a great location in the heart of downtown Toronto. Lots of great restaurants, shopping and attractions nearby. The hotel staff were friendly and courteous. The room had high ceilings, a kitchenette, washer and dryer and to our surprise a balcony overlooking King Street. The rooms are clean and spacious. I will definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great location, valet parking an issue.”
Reviews.Author: Bayfieldbunch
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in rooms from hotwire.com. We were surprised at the size of the room, very comfortable and fully equipped. Our only complaint was the wait for valet parking. I understand it's busy on a Sunday morning but an hour wait was a bit much. Would happily stay again but would make sure to call down early for the car.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Davida H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 6 year old daughter. We stayed in the one bedroom suite. It was a surprise for my husband's birthday. I called weeks in advance and had the chef make him his favorite cake. On the night of my husband's birthday dinner, they had a table reserved just for us and the cake was so delicious. To top it all off, they didn't even charge us for the specially made cake! The breakfast was delicious and very filling. The suite was very spacious and we had a nice city view. Everyone was really nice. I don't have any complaints and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LING-LING21
Reviews.Content: *** Receptionist was nice and friendly. *** The room was bigger than I expected which is good. The bathroom (no bathtub) though is a little tight. A great ameneties in the room are the kitchen appliances, specially if you are staying longer than a weekend. *** Location is really close the the main attractions like CN Tower and Harbour. Outside the hotel they have city bike rentals you can use to go around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the junior suite!”
Reviews.Author: sw224
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. The service was polite and professional, and ensured everything about the room was great. Stayed in the junior suite which has no view (so if you want a room with a view then skip this room and go for another) however this did not matter to much to us. The room was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. The room came with a dishwasher, microwave and laundry machine which was great. I honestly can not recommend this hotel highly enough. It can be a bit noisy due to the location (the subway runs underneath) however this was also a plus since it was convenient for getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding reception woes”
Reviews.Author: Dan G
Reviews.Content: If you're vegan, have friends who are vegan... even if you know what vegan means this is not the venue for your reception. The banquet staff DID correctly spell vegan, then proceeded to set a salad with cheese in front the card they wrote it on. Before the next course arrived I was told I could choose from mozzarella croquettes, risotto prepared with butter, skip this part of the meal altogether or have another salad. Given these generous options I stated I would take another salad, "this time without the cheese," to which the server sneered that I should have sent back the first salad. In fact, I would have, just as I would have asked more quickly for a bread basket like every other table at the reception received... if the staff hadn't neglected our table for 30+ minutes (in the end we got a cold plate of naan bread just before the main course arrived, but not before we were again ridiculed for not speaking up sooner). The main portion of the meal consisted of three sides - all of which WERE vegan - set in the center of the table. Everyone else at the table also got a plate with food corresponding to their own requests, and in fairness to the staff we had a pescatarian, a nut allergy and two Kosher-abiding Jews (no shellfish, etc). All of their orders came correctly. I was told I would also be brought a plate with vegan-friendly food, but several minutes later the server came back with an empty plate saying only the sides brought earlier were suitable for me. Of course, those were already well picked over by the guests that had their plates earlier. Mmmmm.... dregs! "Vegan desert" was a plate with a selection of fruit (melon, grapes, berries) much as you would find at a motel's continental breakfast. Getting wine glasses refilled for the ceremonial toasts required chasing attendants serving other tables, but the Montepulciano was good... certainly preferable to ordering drinks from the gentleman that appeared to have pink eye, working the bar.

Reviews.Title: “GORGEOUS GORGEOUS HOTEL with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LynneKnowlts
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at One King West, and although I am a fussy traveller, I had NOT ONE complaint. We had an upgrade to the superior suite. It had stunning views of Toronto. The room was well laid out with a well equipped kitchenette . The room itself felt HUGE compared to most hotel rooms. The staff were very attentive. The front lobby was pretty and also a very social place for others to meet and have a drink at the end of their day. The breakfast was plentiful and fresh ~ quite delicious. I really felt like the staff went over and above to really make their customers feel " at home". We hope to return, time and time again. SPECTACULAR experience !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jayno19
Reviews.Content: Great location. Rooms are large and clean with great views. Many have small kitchens and a washer/dryer in them. Parking is very expensive ($41 a night). The staff are kind, but not overly friendly. The lobby is stunning. Close to Eaton Centre, and great shopping. Tricky to get to if driving.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Moggsie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at One King West in one of their suite rooms in the 'new' tower part of the hotel. The first room we were given was quite noisey from either the air con unit or the elevator shaft - but after one unsuccessful night's sleep, they kindly moved us away from the lift area, and to a lovely room at the corner of the building, with fantastic views. It is basically a 'studio' but enough space to sleep, eat, cook. The bonus of these rooms is the small cooking facility, and also the washing machine - great for longer stays. Good location for getting around Toronto, subway station 'King' right outside, easy walk up or down Yonge Street, and direct access to PATH. Great supermarket about 5 minute walk away where you can stock up. Staff always helpful and pleasant, and good standard of cleanliness. Interesting feature is the old bank vaults. If we are ever in Toronto again we would probably stay here. Tip when travelling from the Airport - use the public transport bus and subway - it is easy, and far cheaper than a taxi. Rocket Bus to Kipling Station, then jump on the train to King Station.

Reviews.Title: “diamonds have flaws as well”
Reviews.Author: onicamorely
Reviews.Content: everything seemed first rate ...until i had to deal with the concierge...i think her name was christine... maybe she should work by herself...she seemed upset when my family requested reservations were asked to be made... but the rest of the property was outstanding... will stay again..just wouldnt use the conceirge again...

Reviews.Title: “They made a bad day better”
Reviews.Author: Canama
Reviews.Content: On a hot Canada Day, my partner and I were supposed to move in to one of the condos in this building for a few months (the condos are NOT owned by the hotel.) We were relocating from far away, and hadn't seen the condo (having made arrangements online.) We found the unit filthy -- complete with dirty shot glasses, empty booze bottles and garbage. It had no AC and in no way met the description the landlord had provided. Again, this part was NOT the hotel's fault... But it is where they came in to save the day! This was a stressful experience for us, being in a new city, and suddenly having to find a new place to live (on a stat holiday) and knowing we'd lose our rental deposit... But, of course, none of this was the hotel's problem, which is why we decided to check in to one of their rooms so we could cool off, not have to move all of our luggage too far, and think about what to do. When I was talking to the young woman at the front desk, Karla, I mentioned our situation in passing, and she was so commiserative and helpful, I felt so much better, even though I was still in a tough place. I so appreciated her patient ear and outstanding service. She gave us an excellent rate as well, which I think was especially kind given that this was last minute on a holiday long weekend. She also wordlessly upgraded us to a larger room (ironically, the suite we walked into looked exactly like the pictures we'd seen of our supposed condo.) Over the next few days, all the little things were done well, like recognizing us in the evenings, nodding hellp and opening the automatic doors to the elevator bank so we didn't have to fish out our keys. Bringing us up extra shampoo within 5 minutes of us requesting it, and so on... Anyway, the hotel room was great; being new to Toronto, the location was also excellent for wandering around (in our case, wandering around looking for place.) Above alI, we just really appreciated the patience and service of Karla and the other staff at this hotel. We somehow managed to enjoy stay over the next few days... (And we ended up finding a great place to live more permanently.)

Reviews.Title: “king west”
Reviews.Author: jan100
Reviews.Content: We initially had a small suite - bed, small kitchenette & bathroom. this room, for the small amount of time we were in it, was very clean & well kept - When we arrived, our room was obviously still in the middle of having some minor shower repair - as the maintenance man had left a hairdryer in the stall, trying to dry the repair - we rang down to reception the inform them - much appologizing ensued & we were immediately upgraded to a larger suite (not why we'd rung down, but a result none the less)- again room very nice - kitchenette, very comfortable bed & good size bathroom. Think their customer service speaks for itself - excellent. really nice place with a good location - only a couple of blocks from the eaton centre etc.

Reviews.Title: “We Were Wowed!”
Reviews.Author: OttawaTraveler2
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at One King West and must say that we were wowed by everything about this place! The rooms are beautiful - so many more amenities than we expected. Especially great if you are staying longer term as the kitchen area has a half size fridge, microwave, 2 burner stove, dishwasher drawer - even a washer & dryer. And the space is so well used - as you can see by the picture attached. The beds are comfortable - check-in was quick and efficient. We took the opportunity to enjoy the Sunday brunch - what a pleasure! You won't be disappointed. And while there, don't miss walking down the stairs into the 'vault'. Quite the history with this gem of a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it dispite mishaps.”
Reviews.Author: Chrisfoster2011
Reviews.Content: Firstly let me say that when i arrived at the outside of the property, i asked the taxi Driver if this was the place, and he said yes then i asked him if this place was a good place, and he said yes. I was a little unsure as in what to expect. I arrived their straight from a delayed flight from Barbados and went straight to the checking. I was checked into an interior room which by all means was very nice, well kept, clean, tidy and very spacious. But my gosh, that room was the most depressing and creepy room I've ever been in. Its kinda strange because you have a window to look out but its the shaft between the new and the old building so its kinda done to make it look like the outdoors. But being reasonable, i guess it was dissapointing to me because i live in Barbados with beautiful beaches, sunshine, and easy living so when i come to a big city i want to open the window and see Buildings! People! Pollution! Cars! Traffic! Lights! i want to see all of that!!!. The interior rooms will suit someone their on business or someone not in their room often because i would go into serious depression. The following day i did asked to be moved to a room of more substance and they weren't any rooms available so the front desk manager did tell me to check back a little later which i did and i didn't mind because i mean... he cant kick people out and he still wanted to accommodate me. So back from shopping i did go back to front desk and from the time i said my room number to a front desk agent they said my room is ready, which to me means that the front desk manager kept his word. The following room i went into was beautiful, but after 10 mins being settled front desk called and apologized for the air conditioning in the room that wasn't working and told me they can relocate me. #1 their was a problem with the room which is 'ok' because no one or nothing is prefect #2 he offered to send up the key and send someone up to transfer my luggage. That is what i mean by service unlike other Hotels that would tell me to go back to the front desk, so although it was an inconvenience, they did offer assistance in moving me and were extremely polite. Finally i got to my room and it was Fantastic! A high floor, Great views, Beautiful buildings, everything i wanted. Their was even a washer, dryer, dishwasher, sink, microwave, fridge.. was like a condo. Overall hotel is in good condition, although they were problems they were very accommodating and the final conclusion resulted in me leaving as a happy customer who will recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service - Watch out for interior rooms”
Reviews.Author: DavidK_SF
Reviews.Content: One King West is the preferred hotel for my new employer. I'm in the midst of my first stay. I like the property and the location. Rooms are clean well furnished. I love having a fridge sink etc. My problem is service and "interior" facing rooms. When I arrived I was given a room overlooking the roof of an adjacent property (or another wing of the hotel). On this roof was a huge ventilation fan that sounded like a jet engine. Loud enough that it kept me awake for a while. The next morning I asked to be moved, the front desk agreed and moved me while I was out in business meetings during the day. Great...except they solved the problem by moving me to an interior room with a window facing an internal air shaft. Noise problem solved, but really that is how you treat a guest? Move and already disappointed guest to a room with no window without telling them ahead of time? Oh well. I'll likely be back as this is my company standard, I hope I have a better experience next time.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable night for our Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Carmenmessam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spend a night at One King West Hotel in Toronto on July 16, 2011. We were celebrating our 1 Year Wedding Anniversary. I contacted the General Manager directly, and asked if there was anything extra he could do to accomodate us. He provided a room upgrade for us, chocolate covered fruit, a card, and a bottle of wine! The staff were friendly, the room was very clean and spacious, the valet attendants were exceptional, and overall we had a great time! If we decide to stay in Toronto again, we will consider staying at the One King West!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Affordable Downtown Toronto Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elaine B
Reviews.Content: Pros: Within walking distance or subway ride to all major attractions. Friendly staff. Room was clean and well equipped - fridge, microwave, coffee maker, washer, dryer, dishwasher, stovetop - ideal for an extended stay. Wall to wall window offering wonderful view of the harbour (18th floor facing Yonge Street). Cons: Parking is expensive ($30 per night) so we parked at St. Lawrence parking garage which is within 10 minute walk of hotel. Extra charge for internet in room, but available in lobby at no charge. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “1st time was great, 2nd time as great! Love the location!!”
Reviews.Author: ryelex
Reviews.Content: We stayed at One King West for the first time back in 2009. The hotel is in a great location--in the middle of everything. The subway is just across the street, shopping, restaurants are all in walking distance. My partner and I decided to visit Toronto again last month to celebrate our birthdays and didn't hesitate to book our hotel at One King West. The value you get for the location and their excellent/clean suites doesn't compare to others, at least based on our research. We had a rental car because we thought we'd be driving to Niagra, but didn't get a chance to. The valet, which allows for in-and-out, is $30/night, but that's standard in the area, even the public garage nearby, that doesn't have in-and-out privileges (they charge $29 overnight). The staff is helpful and friendly. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dissaponted”
Reviews.Author: DorisLei
Reviews.Content: Service is poor & unfriendly. The hotel is not as good as expected n described online. Can't find a reason to go back. unless is free!

Reviews.Title: “Most amazing experience, fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: LisaL41
Reviews.Content: I attended one of my closest friends wedding at this hotel and it was an amazing experience. The facilities were very impressive, the food was scrumptious, venue was fantastic. The hotel accomodations were beyond superb, huge suite, plush king bed, huge bathroom, two televisions and an ensuite kitchen. The service was absolutely fantastic, upon arriving at the valet to reception, everyone was warm and friendly. The service I received was the absolute best I have ever experienced. The hotel is situated in an excellent area for entertainment, foodies, travellers etc. I will definitely be back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed my expecation.... every time!”
Reviews.Author: JeffSadrian
Reviews.Content: Aside from the unbeatable location in the heart of business, shopping and pleasure in downtown Toronto, this is one of the best accommodations I've had in my recent experience. Not only the rooms are superbly decorated and equipped with all amenities a guest might wish for (6 appliances in a regular hotel room!), the cleanliness, professional appointments and the overall quality of the room and comfort of the bed go a long way in guaranteeing you a pleasant and carefree stay. What impressed me the most all three times I've stayed at this hotel over the past few months, is the special attention and courteous and prompt service you receive from the hotel staff and management, and in particular, the hands-on General Manager, Steve O'Brien, on all your requests and enquiries. I highly recommend this hotel for both business and pleasure stays in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: CardiffTilly
Reviews.Content: Fabulous few days in Toronto!! Hotel is in a fab location to walk to the main shopping mall and the heart of Downtown. Hotel is very clean and the staff were lovely, very helpful and pleasant . The rooms were very clean and comfortable, and just right for a short city break, as we didn't spend much time in the room. The parking in the hotel was very very expensive $30 per night!!!!!! We had a car for 4 nights so worked out very expensive. Lovely breakfast though but again a little overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “What a Fab Place!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller3011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights whilst exploring toronto, very funky place, just been updated, good area, walking distance from everywhere. shame that the internet wasn't wirelessly available in room, however, wired internet was free in room and i found this little bit of software that made your laptop a wireless access point so i could use my ipad and my blackberry wirelessly...NICE!!

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit Even Better Than First”
Reviews.Author: backspace1952
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned home from a weekend in Toronto. We stayed at One King West for the second time. Our stay was great as was our first stay. All staff are friendly and always willing to help. The suite was very nice with a great view. We arrived early and our room was not yet ready. The front desk was very pleasant and got the valet to take our bags so we could go for lunch,when we returned the suite was ready. Everyone is really on top of their game. The downtown location is also great. We usually fly Porter and this location works well for us. The rates are also good. We will definitely book again in August/Sept our next trip to TO. A. Brooks

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: stuart316
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in the week prior to Easter. This was my second stay - first in Aug 09 on vacation and this time on business. Staff friendly and helpful. No trouble for them to book a chauffer driven car for me to go to a business appointment rather than using a cab. Handy to downtown Toronto, Union Station, Rogers Center & CN Tower. Rooms well appointed for both business & leisure travel...nice work desk, well equipped kitchen and decent sized bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Our home away from home”
Reviews.Author: RadarOntario
Reviews.Content: We always stay at One King West whenever we are in Toronto, be it for business or pleasure. The location is perfect and is within walking distance or public transportation to everything Toronto has to offer. The staff are excellent and always go out of their way to make us feel comfortable and at home. We love staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Catgirl21
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while in Toronto for business, and loved it! The rooms were so quiet, and the view was breathtaking! I was up on the 44th floor, and could see all of the harbour. The room was large, and had a firdge, microwave, hotplates, dishes, washer and dryer, everything you cuold want! I loved that the room had a safe, perfect for leaving camera, etc in during the day. They also offered dish and laundry soap (at a fee) should I need to do laundry. The only thing I was not particular on was the soap in the bathroom. It was a Bath and Body Works product (rain leaves or something like that) and I had problems with the smell. The hotel was under renovations, but aside from the walls, you would never know. Parking was very costly, but I guess that's downtown Toronto. The Front Desk were able to print things out for me, even though it was something that wasn't normally offered, and the bar service was great! Staff really went out of their way to make me feel comfortable and at ease.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most enjoyable business trips. Great for extended stays and a seasoned traveller”
Reviews.Author: divingtraveller14
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at One King West Hotel & Residence and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who plans on visiting Toronto. I frequently travel for work and was in town for a business trip last week. the location of the hotel is superb, close to the theatre district on King, St Lawrence Market, and downtown shopping at the Eaton Centre as well as Queen West. I had a superior room in the tower side of the hotel. The room was very clean and fully equipped with a kitchenette, dishwasher, washer, and dryer (I did not use these appliances as I had no need, but my colleagues who had been on the road for over a week certainly appreciated the latter two). Since I travel on business, I have grown very tired of eating out for every meal. The kitchenette allowed me to purchase healthier options as well as take leftovers back for the next day. The bed was firm (which I prefer over plush) so sleep quality was quite good. The bar is in the lobby but I did not mind. The gym was well equipped and the hot tub was very enjoyable. The resistance pool, however, did not provide sufficient resistance to allow for a meaningful swim. The air conditioner was not working when I arrived but it was fixed within 20 minutes of my call to guest services. It also stopped working on the third morning of my stay and I had to call to have the technician reset the unit. It did not take long but I would have preferred not having to have the unit reset twice over 4 days. The in-room wired internet was not reliable. First, work computers that require VPN log in are not accommodated. It was outlined on the FAQ/internet guide in the room but this information was not available on the website. When I hooked up my personal computer, the internet was unreliable and I had to contact the internet help desk on several occasions. The solution was to shut down and start up the computer. If it worked, great. If not, repeat until it worked. My computer rarely has any problems connecting at other hotels, at hot spots, etc. The free wireless internet in the lobby, however, worked when I tried. Not withstanding the issues related to the AC and internet, I still had a great stay and would recommend the hotel to my friends and co-workers, though I would caution about spending money on the in-room internet service.

Reviews.Title: “I used to like this hotel, but had issues this time”
Reviews.Author: db0001
Reviews.Content: I stayed there many times before when I came to Toronto for business. I was always happy the hotel. This time I brought my family for the long week-end. Unfortunately, the experience was far less than perfect. 1. Check-in We arrived on late night on May 27th. Our flight was 4 hours delayed and we got to the hotel past midnight. My kids, ages 3 and 1 were exhausted and extremely fussy. This is when all you wish is to get the room and crash. No such luck! Turned out the hotel had a false fire alarm. We were told they would be unable to check us in for at least another half an hour! Ok, I understand these things happen, but I don't understand why they couldn't give us a room once they established the alarm was false. We waited half an hour, they checked us in, but then - guess what - the elevators didn't work for another 40 min or so. I guess this is fine for adults that can just go have a beer. However, for small kids who just went through an 8-hour trip, this is not good at all. We got to our room well past 1am. In fairness, I will mention the hotel refunded our first night. At that point, however, we really needed a place to sleep, not the money. 2) No wi-fi in rooms. You have to show me another four-star hotel in financial district of a big city that doesn't have Wi-Fi in the rooms. There is cable connection... Too bad for ipad users... 3) The ventilation in our room was extremely loud and woke us up during the nights. Front desk told us there is nothing they could do because our suite was in the old part of the building. 4) Valet parking. The only parking option at the hotel, costs $30 per day and sometimes if it's busy you have to wait 30 min for them to get your car. I used to like this hotel, but next time I come to Toronto with the family, we'll probably stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: martard23
Reviews.Content: The decor and customer service is outstanding. Rooms are beautiful and the views of the city are superb. Whenever I need to stay in downtown Toronto, the convenience of this hotel with all the local ammenities makes it a wonderful choice. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “My Hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: OhioTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: One King West has become my Toronto Hotel. After a few stays there you will begin to feel like they have adopted you. There is a very friendly bar in the lobby. You will not sit there long before you are in a converstation with somebody. The King St. Subway station is just down a few steps from the lobby. It is walking distance to Front St. The kitchenette in each condo type suite has a nice refrigerator, microwave, stove and washer and dryer. I frequently use the dryer to quickly take wrinkles out of shirts and pants. The thermostat is actually connected to something and heat and air can be well controlled. i would like to find out where I can get pillows exactly like they have. After staying in a fully equiped condo type room I find it hard to go back to the old style rooms with few ensuite amenities. Room service from a full service luxury hotel is still there if you want it. If you stay there be sure to be aware of where to turn onto Jordan Street to arrive at the actual entrance to the hotel on the south side. I have stayed at one King West for business and just for fun. My guests have also enjoyed the hotel. From the car parkers to the bartenders to the managers, I have always been treated with helpful friendliness. You can tell when there is a company culture where the staff is treated well and this is reflected by the way they treat their guests. Perhaps a different vibe occurs when many of the condos on the upper floors are owned by the residents.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at One King West”
Reviews.Author: rclptbo
Reviews.Content: During our stay at One King West we were very impressed with the level of service provided by the staff. They went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable. The room was very nice and equipped with a kitchenette that included a small dishwasher and all the neccessities for a long or short term stay. The location was great for walking to shopping, dining and theatres. The breakfast that was provided was definately more than a contental breakfast and really enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Every Minute Of It”
Reviews.Author: TeamSS
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travelling on a budget so when we found such a great deal for One King West we scooped it up thinking there would be at least one downfall. I am happy to say we experienced no such downfall, everything was excellent and far exceeded our expectations. The staff were tentative and the rooms modern with a touch of homeliness. The rooms had every amenity we needed with a great view, so it was hard to leave to go sightseeing but either way it was one of our highlights when visiting Toronto. Plus to add to the charm the building is the original sight for a bank so the old vault is visible through a set of stairs in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: mrsdd1
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed at One King West before, and was quite pleasantly surprised. Staff was excellent, and I felt they were genuinely looking after me. The room was small, but had a kitchenette and washer/dryer in the room! Location was perfect, and I would definitely stay there again! Also, transportation to the airport was coordinated though their own car service, which I thought was a great touch.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Hotel Booking”
Reviews.Author: DCavidtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel this past weekend and I must say it was a mixed experience. On one hand the service was amazing in allowing my wife and I to take photos in the building last minute. On the other hand service was horrible by saying one of my bags were lost when in fact it was never delivered to my room. I had to go back the next day after calling the hotel asking for the bag. This was clearly a breakdown of communication and someone should be disciplined for the lack of care. However it was through the concierge Marim (I think that was his name) who helped find the bag and held onto it for safe keeping while making the trek down to pick it up. There were other items that went missing but what can you do? The room we had was their best room but it was one of the worst in terms of sleep. We staying on the 43rd floor and there was no central thermostat. Every hour a loud fan would would vent in air to warm up the room. I would never recommend this room. They gave us a couple dollars off the room which was a nice gesture. We also booked two rooms on the 8th floor which were much better and provided a thermostat to control the temperature. Those rooms were fine. I would recommend those. This place is really hit or miss. If you plan on staying here, book a lower floor room or one of their general rooms and don't have things delivered to your room. This place has potential but it really has some gaps in service that needs to be addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clecl
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto for a week on a business course and was looking for a comfortable place to stay that was also close to the location of my course. One King West was ideal in all regards as it turned out. The service on check-in (and check-out) was very fast. In no time at all, I was equipped with my room cards, had a summary of where to find what I was looking for and was on my way up to my room. The staff were polite, friendly and informative. The hotel bar/restaurant caught me a bit by surprise, being that it forms a part of the hotel's lobby. In the end, this didn't cause me any grief at all and I actually enjoyed the central location. The food was good, the service was exceptional and the prices were right about on par with what I would expect in downtown Toronto. My room was not entirely what I expected (the view was non-existent) but I was in the historical part of the hotel and looking (I think!) across at the side of the new building that is attached. I wasn't there to spend my entire time looking out the window, so it didn't matter, but if I were going for pleasure and not business I would be sure to ask for a room with a view. Beyond that I can't complain about the room. The furnishings were comfortable, clean and not worn down. I had everything I needed for a week's stay, and then some. The room had a mysterious aroma of cooked beef at some times during the day, but I came to realize that much of the area around the hotel (including my course building) had the same thing. Cleaning of the room was prompt and effective. No complaints there! The staff have to be this hotel's single, biggest asset. I was called by name by any staff members who could have known my name. The bar/restaurant staff remembered my drink preference after one evening. Given that I only had two beers the night I checked in, I thought it was pretty impressive that they would remember which beer I like the next day. Every single staff member I encountered in the halls, in the elevator, etc, politely wished me a good day, evening, etc. Whoever trains these people on customer focus is doing a great job. Location is perfect. You are right smack in the middle of downtown and close to just about anything you could wish for. Overall, I highly recommend One King West and will definitely go back there for future trips. Thank you for a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, quiet, with amazing view of Lake Ontario”
Reviews.Author: Dianevee
Reviews.Content: My first stay at One King West did not disappoint. The room was spacious, clean and quiet. My room, on the 28th floor, had an amazing view - south and east - of Lake Ontario. I was leery of the location (close to the elevator) but was not disturbed by hallway noise at all. I made good use of the fridge, microwave and kettle. I had no need of the washer, dryer or dishwasher, but they are certainly nice to have. Being connected to the PATH, and only a few steps to the King subway, is extremely convenient. I'm in Toronto frequently and this establishment is now my first choice for accommodation. I wish I had discovered it sooner!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, well worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: chelij
Reviews.Content: We were in Toronto for a recent concert at the Air Canada Center (which is only a 10 minute walk away!) and we booked One King West through Hotwire. While hotwire can be a gamble, we definitely won! We were not told what style of room we were going to be given but assumed the small studio suite, which was fine for our stay. When we first arrived at the hotel we were amazed by the beautiful lobby. Modern and antique details make this place really unique. Our room was on the 32nd floor and we had a LAKE view, corner room at the end of the hall (which we were really happy with!). The room was very small, but no bigger than it really needed to be. There was room to walk around without banging into anything, and just big enough to not feel cramped (except for the bathroom, that did feel a bit cramped). We were surprised by the kitchenette that had not only a dishwasher, but also a clothes washer and dryer. We've stayed in suites before, but none that gave you your own laundry facilities. The room was VERY clean and comfortable. Like other reviewers have said, the television was old (flat screen, but not an LED/LCD/Plasma) but honestly, I didn't even notice until I remembered reading that detail in a review. It worked though! Plus, even though we did watch some TV during our downtime, we weren't there to watch tv! The only downfall to our room was that there was no long hallway from the door to the bed area (there is a separate room, but it's all open) and we were able to hear people entering and leaving other rooms very clearly. No one made any excessive noise so it wasn't an issue. Overall, we were very pleased with the hotel and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money, did not live up to it's hype, definitely not a five star.”
Reviews.Author: Hackster57
Reviews.Content: Not worth the money, did not live up to it's hype, definitely not a five star, barely a four star. . After reading the reviews, we were expecting an unbelievable hotel filled with tradition but retrofitted for modern convieniences. We were deeply disappointed. The hotel lobby is extremly disappointing , and seems almost like your checking into a parking garage. it's very drafty, cold, and extremely lacking in common furnishings and standard amenities. The historic setting that could be an intregral part of this hotel is completely lost and the two architectural types that this buidling has, go against each other at every oppurtunity. The dinning area (not a seperate room) sits smack dap in the lobby entrance and is nothing more than 4-5 small table scattered in one corner. The dinning room is about 30 feet from the drafty front doors and main lobby desk. We had an upper room and while the views were fabulous the room was anything but. satisfiying. The TV was a small 24" monitor that was posiitoned in an obsure corner that no actual person could even watch it. The room was extremly drafty and cold. The drapes moved on windy nights so much so that the effect was somewhat scary ,e specially being so high up. the wind whistled throught the cracks and windows which did not help matters. The carpet and overall furnishign are somewhat dated with nicked corners and stains throughout the room. We only had one chair in the entire suite, which was odd givent he room was considered a suite capable of sleeping four. The HVAC cojntrols were programmed, however the room was always cold and you couldn't adjust the controls as no maual was provided and the unit was definitely not user friendly. Bottom line with One King West is that it might be okay if your traveling for anight on business it might be okay but for families or just the two of you, dont' waste your money on this one. There are better places in Toronto that offer a sense of history at the same time offering a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Another Place To Call Home!”
Reviews.Author: WorldsTraveler99
Reviews.Content: I must admit I feel like a fool. I've never booked or heard of Tripadviser until a good friend mentioned it to me today. I find the need to share my experience with the entire world about..."One King West"! This marks the second time I've stayed at "One King West" and truthfully it won't be my last. I was searching for a place that offered a great location, spectacular views, a friendly staff, and all the things that would make me feel like home. Boy did they get it right! The first time around was a place that I wasn't really appreciating the fact that the staff is more than staff, they are family. Under the worst circumstances(seperation), I need to call and make myself a reservation not knowing whether or not they would have room. Once the operator transferred me to the reservation desk, my heart dropped out of my chest. Not only did this woman remember my voice, but she remembered my name. I began to tell her the story of what was going on in my life, she cut me off and said, "Yes ma'am, I will see to it that everything is taken care of to the best of 'my' ability and you have nothing to worry about". As I arrived to the hotel, the valet attendant approches the car and calls me by name, grabs my bags, and leads me to the front desk, where everyone has been waiting my arrival. The front desk manager at the time was already prepped for what has happened and handed me my keys letting me know that when you are ready, we will are here for you. During the course of my stay, each and every person, from the Housekeepers to the General Manager, were there to make me feel like this was my home. I've never been one to be rude to anyone in my life, but told each and everyone of them while I was there, that the job they do, the smiles they wear, the joy they bring means more to me than anything in the world. If you are every in Toronto and looking for a place that the people don't treat you like just another dollar, but as someone that they've known for a lifetime. "ONE KING WEST" is the next best place! Sincerely, A Faithful Guest

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond compare.”
Reviews.Author: DanielDPratt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel a great deal in our work. This trip, however, was a combination of business and pleasure. My sister joined us from Dallas to mark a turning point in her health. She is a survivor of multiple battles with cancer and had never been to Toronto. We were, understandably, anxious to show her the best of this fair city. My wife and I were in room 702; my sister was in room 703. Both are fine rooms, but neither room has a view of the CN Tower or the Lake, which my sister had hoped to see. When Mr. Johnson heard of our situation, he took the initiative to find an empty suite in the Tower from which my sister could see the signature buildings and views of Toronto. We were all impressed with the suites in the higher reaches of the tower and the marvelous view. But what left the most lasting impression was the generosity and thoughtfulness of Mr. Johnson. Weâ€™ve had nothing but good service at One King West, but Rean Johnson put a personal touch on it all, showing us aspects of the hotel that we would not have otherwise seen. We have booked ourselves into One King West in early May and look forward to staying at this â€˜home-away-from-homeâ€™ another time. You are fortunate to have people like Mr. Johnson on your staff. Oh yes â€“ one final note. When I offered Mr. Johnson $10.00 for his kindness, he was adamant in refusing it, saying it was his pleasure. Nor did he offer his name, as if that would be an invitation for such a letter as this. How rare is that!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but disappointing service...not good value for your money...”
Reviews.Author: traveller0808
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights for business in April. Thums Up: -Great location: close to the heart of downtown Toronto and the subway station -Was given vouchers for free breakfast -The room is clean -The room is spacious (don't really care much about this. Who stayed in the room all day when travelling for leisure or business anyway) -Free in-room high speed Internet -Complementary team and coffee -They have a dish washing maching, a washer, and a dryer in the room (which are of no use to me) -Have both a bath tub and shower -Overnight parking is $20 per night for guests, not bad for a downtown Toronto location Thumbs Down: -Extremely slow service during check-in and check-out -Staff are in general unfriendly. Some of them are even grumpy -Small bar and breakfast area in the lobby -2 set of elevators - if you have to go to a different floor, you may have to go all the way down to the lobby and then go up again (e.g. going to the fitness centre) -Ice machine is only on one floor -Only have one tea bag and the taste is not great -Typical of most hotels, even 5-stars ones, they have a small, whimpy hair dryer -The Internet was intermittently disconnected, have to reboot the computer all the time -When they gave me the vouchers for breakfast, they said it was because my company has a preferred status with them. Great! But then some of my colleagues didn't get one. Strange, inconsistent service Overall great hotel but not good value for your money. There are many great hotels in the area and I would suggest checking out the others first.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Weerobbie
Reviews.Content: Located a few blocks from the train station and Theatre District, the location is superb for a tourist. The Front Desk is efficient but not all the staff at the desk are as welcoming as one might hope. The room is spacious with a very comfortable bed and clean, efficient bathroom. The lobby is under renovation so the lobby bar was not the most pleasant place to have a drink. The bar staff were friendly and efficient. In-room internet is $9/day however there is free wireless in the lobby area. Overall, good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “No running water”
Reviews.Author: michaelsmith1974
Reviews.Content: My suite had no running water the Day of April 20 2011. The clerk was very rude when I demanded an explanation. I was forced to use a public washroom downstairs that was in nothing less than disgusting shape. There was urine on the toilet seat and toilet paper all over the floor. In general staff were very inconsiderate to this problem and declined my demand for a full refund.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: DB19
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I had a wonderful stay at One King West. It's a beautiful hotel with a lot of history, it's location is great in the downtown area, and we walked or took the subway to everything. One thing I will not forget to say is that the staff is what makes the hotel exceptional. They are awesome, very friendly, nice, professional, and show they care about their guests' experience. Overall, nothing but good things to say. A special thanks to the manager and his staff that went out of their way to help out with a special request, will never forget it. Next time I'm in Toronto I know where to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Found my watched and sent it to me!”
Reviews.Author: calerou
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at the hotel and the service was wonderful! Once I got back, I realized I had left a GPS watch at the hotel. I went onto to the website and clicked on "contact" and the only email address was to Steve, the GM of the hotel. I thought I would never get a response or see the watch. Within a few minutes, I got a reply and within the hour, the staff called to ask where they could ship the watch to! AMAZING service! I will never stay at another hotel in Toronto. This place is perfect for business or pleasire and the service is among the best!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury & Location”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller00701
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Suites at One King West for a "night out on the town" on my 50th birthday. Friends joined us at the hotel. We had a relaxing drink & snacks in the hotel lobby bar and then walked down to one of Toronto's many restaurant areas to enjoy a great meal. The room was superb! Spacious, clean and plenty of amenities. The staff was friendly and very helpful. I recommended the hotel to a relative coming in from out of town and they loved it! I would highly recommend The Suites at One King West for your next stay in Toronto!!!

Reviews.Title: “spectacular”
Reviews.Author: johnnyboy2000
Reviews.Content: within minutes of getting to my room the guy at the front desk called to make sure everything was okay. "not just okay, great" was my reply. dishwasher, washer&dryer and a stove in the room? chyesss. location was perfect, right near the hockey hall of fame, major shopping, and other points of interest. terrific old bank building with plenty of food options within steps of the hotel. when i needed a cab there was a private black cab that the valet directed me to which cost LESS than a normal cab and accepted credit card payment. the tv in the room had like 50 channels and a dvd player! the view was dead-on of the toronto tower. the bed was relatively comfortable- as comfortable as they get aside from the priciest hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The best deal in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: sollowsc
Reviews.Content: Whenever we come to Toronto this is our home away from home. Their Play, Stay and Park package is the best value. The package includes a wonderful breakfast and valet parking - the best deal in town. The staff is very friendly and we have never had any disappointments in any of our stays. We would highly recommend this as the place to stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, well above average value for money.”
Reviews.Author: tjbimson
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and very comfortable. Staff were very pleasant and acommodating throughout and I had no difficulties with odours or noise. I got my room for 135$ and for a room of this quality in downtown Toronto I would say I underpaid by at least $50. Only complaints -- and they are very minor -- are that the room was advertised as including a DVD player and kettle. These were missing. In addition, the TV was a little long in the tooth (still a CRT rather than a flats screen). Service and comfort more than made up for these minor deficiencies.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: knml911
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I stayed at this hotel from March 21st to March 25th and we have nothing to rant about except for certain little things. The pros : - Great central location at walking distance of many attractions - Has fridge, washer/dryer and dishwasher, microwave and a kitchenette so for longer stays such as ours, they proved to be very useful and saved us a little money to spend elsewhere - We arrived at 9:30 AM and though check-in is later, our rooms were ready and reception had no problem to let us in - The views from our rooms were fantastic, we stayed on the 41st floor - Overall, everything was great there and thumbs up to the General Manager, Steve O'Brien, for taking the time to personally thank me to take the time to fill out their survey questionnaire on their website after my stay The rants: - Wi-fi internet connection at $9.95 a day, I just can't understand why hotels that aim at business clientele can not provide free access - Local calls or to 1-800's are charged at $0.75 per call. Once again, why don't they let us call for free? There must be a reason but I have yet to find it! - The carpet : if my memory serves me well, I did not see any of it at the Intercontinental and I felt it was more modern without the carpets Finally, I would recommend this hotel anytime.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we've stayed in. Easy walking distance to hockey arena. Everything you could want in a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wmccann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Toronto to see the Toronto Maple Leaf vs. Pittsburgh Penquins hockey game and stayed, with another couple, at One King West hotel. The hotel was very accommodating in giving us two rooms right next to each other. The hotel was full that night but it was very quiet in our room. The rooms were spacious and had every convenience you could ever want. Too bad we weren't staying for a few days so we could take advantage of all the conveniences, such as the microwave, dishwasher, and washer and dryer. Staff were very friendly and our vehicle was ready within five minutes of our checking out. Would go back in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Becksman
Reviews.Content: Location wise, it's right in the heart of downtown Toronto and excellent for business purpose. My room also equipped with washing machine and dryer so it is good for long term stay. It also has small kitchen but the cooking utensils are very beaten up. Bathroom fixtures and cabinets are also wearing out. Staff was rather indifferent and aloof. Though a bit out of the way, my experience at Cambridge Suites has been a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “A dream!”
Reviews.Author: edmontongal69
Reviews.Content: My now fiance and I met on an online dating site, and stayed at One King West during our first weekend getaway. It was late November, and the lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas... so festive! Room service was wonderful- food was delicious. The view from our room (41st floor) was AMAZING!!! We plan to return each year on our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite hotel in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: 154992Paul
Reviews.Content: One King West combines excellent service with great rooms and reasonable costs. I am a fan, and stay here whenever I can.

Reviews.Title: “Good standards, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: FredSmeggins
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the One King West for three nights in March. It is a good standard hotel, rooms have kitchenette facilities which is very handy especially if you don't fancy eating out all the time or you are staying long term on business. Location is excellent, right outside King tube station, trolley cars also stop right outside the hotel, plus St Lawrence market is just a few minutes walk away. Plus there is direct access to the PATH system which is brilliant during cold weather - it was very cold during my stay in Toronto. I would also recommend the Irish Embassy pub just down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: lemontang3
Reviews.Content: There were a couple of very minor complaints that I have about the hotel, but overall I was very pleased, especially with the customer service that I received, and I would definitely stay here again! I was at the hotel for only 1 night, in town on business. I had not been informed that the hotel was under renovations, which was unfortunate. It did make the lobby a little less relaxing and comfortable than I had hoped - as did the extremely loud tv for a hockey game on Thursday night. But in general, these were minor complaints. The bathroom was slightly small - the door needed to be closed for you to use the room well, but it was very functional and I actually quite enjoyed it! There was lots of counter space, which is always appreciated at a hotel, and an extra little shelf above the toilet and near the shower where I found it very handy to store items. The shower itself was GREAT! I loved the shower head and had excellent water pressure on the 30th floor. I wish my shower at home was that good. The bed was a big hard for me, which I found mildly uncomfortable, but that could just be a personal preference. The staff were extremely courteous and very helpful, even calling my room to check that everything was in order. I was very impressed with the service and the beautiful city view from my room. The location, great group rate, and service will definitely keep me coming back! Also, the meal provided in our meeting space was really enjoyable. I did not have any other food at the hotel. The little elements of the old bank building that have remained throughout the hotel really make it a unique location.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: flowqueen05
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the hotel and we given the choice to pick a lower level or high level room. The east side view was amazing with the snowfall that evening. Upper level rooms have nice big windows and our room had a kitchen, washer&dryer, and a workspace. The staff were nice and polite and there wasn't much noise. I would defiantely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Pantanel
Reviews.Content: Kitchenettes are convenient if you don't want to eat out all the time. Location unbeatable for everything downtown. Hotel limo to the airport better than taxi and not alot more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: MsJummyO
Reviews.Content: When it comes to staying at hotels, I look for nothing less than 4 stars. One King West definitely met my expectations. My boyfriend and I spent a one might stay at the studio suite for a mini romantic getaway. The rooms were bigger than I expected for a studio type room, however the bathroom was smaller than what I'm use to at other hotels. I'm VERY picky when it comes to how clean the rooms are, and these rooms were very clean. I would recommend the studio suite for anyone traveling alone or with thier partner. The location was right in the middle of downtown Toronto and a block away from the subway. The eaton centre mall is close by too. If you are someone who has high expectations, very picky and are on a budget as well, pick one king west.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be great but standards have dropped”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravel_2011_88
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to One King West for years as this used to be a great hotel with key advantages being very central and good value for money. Which is why I was very dissapointed to see that standards have dropped: - Firstly, nowhere does it mention that the hotel is currently under refurbishment and that the entrance hall and other areas are under construction. Whilst I was there the staff seemed disorganised as the front desk was moved from one area of the foyer to another. I attach a photo I took of the entrance which showed the foyer on one of the better days of construction... - I was charged for internet in my room that didn't work (again because of the construction, apparently). The staff was unable to resolve this issue and asked me to call their internet provider to resolve myself. I was then charged a premium rate for the call I had been asked to make to the internet provider. - My bill was incorrect with some charges billed twice. - staff generally seemed lethargic and unwilling to help. - The suite was quite small for the price I paid. I ended up moving to another hotel (in Yorkville) where I paid $50 less per night and my room was significantly bigger. I think the hotel should advise renovations are currently under way as quite a few other customers I met at the entrance bar were also very dissapointed by the fall in standards recently.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Lillian70
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say this hotel is worth staying in and very beautiful and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Get treated like a "King" at One King West”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Mike444
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel on several occasions. Whether on business or a personal getaway with the wife. The superb hospitality and service of this hotel is second to none. The hotel staff always ensures your receiving the best treatment at all times. They genuinely care about your stay and are very accommodating. The personable and pleasant ambiance keeps me coming back. I've been to several downtown hotels, One King West offers all the services I need with first class treatment you don't find everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “One King West...All Around Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rae2161
Reviews.Content: This is the second time staying at One King West, and this time seemed better then the last. The front desk was courteous and very professional. I stayed on the 44th floor in a Superior Studio Suite which came equiped with a top stove, microwave, dishwasher, and a washer/dryer. it has everything you need...close to a lot of restrants, subway and train station. ONE KING WEST IS AN ABOLUTELY AMAZING HOTEL! I would recommend anyone wanting to stay in the Toronto area to stay here. you would not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great from start to check out”
Reviews.Author: YourChevyMan
Reviews.Content: One of Toronto's hidden treasures located in the area of the City that offers business and/or pleasure people everthing within walking distance distance to core business and points of interest - Hotel offers the older type of building ( original TD Bank ) and a new high story west wing - THIS IS ONE HOTEL ONE CAN CALL HOME

Reviews.Title: “A nice overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: Mont_Family
Reviews.Content: Last night we stayed on the 41st floor in a Superior Studio Ste . It was a nice room ....small bathroom but worked. Bed was great and we had a good sleep. We are booked for Two nights in April and this was a extra night we arranged when we were given tickets to a Murder Mystery show and since this hotel had access to the subway with out going outside in the bad weather we thought we would give it a try and check it out before the April trip......Not to happy we were never told when I booked two days before even though I mentioned we were seeing a show and would need to use the subway. Didn't find out this until after when we were @ the front desk and asking for a copy of subway route's to the show. Yonge line to Bloor was closed for the Sat-Sunday of this weekend. Not the fault of the hotel but had I been informed I probably would have booked closer to Bloor. The hotel was nice and great location for every where.. Just not the best choice for getting around this week-end past.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms with all you could ask for(included in price)!”
Reviews.Author: felecia123
Reviews.Content: Loved this Hotel. Gorgeous rooms. Mini kitchens with stove, microwave, fridge, etc! Free local calls, great service, awesome location... Connected to underground PATH. Love this place! Will stay again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Well equipped and enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: DaveCampbell123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at One King West the first week of feb. Valet was prompt and check in desk was efficient. Booked the room on short notice over the phone and the process was a breeze. The room was nice, more than well equipped with a full kitchen and washer and dryer. We had great views of the downtown core and lake Ontario and I was surprised to find the room was a lot larger than all others I have been to in Toronto. My car was ready for me upon departure in the morning and the good stay was followed up by a personalized email from the GM of the hotel thanking me for me stay. The overall visit was fantastic. One King West will get me business in the future for sure. Dave C.

Reviews.Title: “Always our top pick”
Reviews.Author: lakepenage
Reviews.Content: We live here in Toronto, but once in a while choose to stay dowtown for a "mini-vacation". We always stay at One King West due to it's great price, new, fresh rooms, kitchenettes and great views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “First time staying at the King !”
Reviews.Author: ForensInk
Reviews.Content: I recently had the opportunity to stay at One King West for business.The location is ideal for anyone involved with financial and legal clients, it is walking distance to most meetings and close to subway stops. My room was very comfortable, which included a kitchen area in the room, furnished with a stove top, fridge, microwave, dishwasher. and a washer and dryer. For extended business travel, I liked that I could cook and do laundry in my room. The fitness center could be improved but there is all of the equipment neede to stay in shape including spa and saunas. The restaurant is excellent, everything that I had there was wonderful. The staff were very cordial and helpful, overall I give this hotel very high marks. I loved my stay and will stay here when I travel to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get fooled, not a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Tdot_to_Van0924
Reviews.Content: I'm from Toronto and was looking forward to spending 2 romantic evenings here with my boyfriend. I'd always walk by this hotel and wonder how fabulous it would be to stay there. After we booked it, we read some reviews and got a little nervous about it but still came in with high hopes. First of all, the rooms are VERY small but the view is fantastic (if you request a high room- one thing they didn't disappoint on.. even though it took about 40 min of waiting on the phone and getting connected with various employees of the hotel). Room service is a joke, its open from 6 pm to 6 am, so if you want to order breakfast in bed, you have to order it before 6 am and they will leave it at your front door by 6 am. They suggest warming it up in your in-suite kitchen but really, who wants to do that? Not to mention the meals are more expensive than most places ($16 for mac n cheese?) A cocktail and a beer was $20 in the hotel bar. Service is forgettable, when we were checking out it took 25 minutes for valet to arrive with our car! The location is good for restaurants and its a few steps from the Eaton Centre. If you want to go into the 'cooler' less touristy parts of the city, aka the West end, its too far to walk. Overall, I would suggest looking into other hotels before this one. Toronto is full of em!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell12345678
Reviews.Content: Don't go to One King West!! First time here and I will never go back. WHY IT WAS HORRIBLE: 1. No Valet service upon arrival, had to go inside and ask for valet even though they're suppose to wait outside according to the front desk 2. Check in took a long time, was second in line and took about 20 minutes. 3.Called for towels, never received any, even when we called 2 more times 4. Called for toiletries such as soap etc 3 times within 4 hours and never received anything. Finally went downstairs to the front desk and had to ask in person. 5. Upon checking out, we called the valet 25 minutes before so that they would have time to get our car. When we went downstairs, and we still had to wait AN HOUR AND A HALF! Almost 2 hours in total!!! What was worse is that other people were getting their cars even though they came down after us!!! 6. We asked to speak with the GM and all she said was that "it was a busy day and it's not their fault" WORST SERVICE EVER! You would think you are getting value for your money, but you're not! I would advise you to go somehwere else such as The Cosmopolitan down the street. Only went to One King West because The Cosmopolitan was sold out. PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Little over priced for what I got.”
Reviews.Author: EDubz28
Reviews.Content: This is a nice Hotel with a unique design. Service was good and the rooms were clean. Few things I did not like. 1. No Wifi in the rooms. Only wired Internet in the rooms a $9.99 per night. This did me no good because I had an iPad and not a laptop. Even if I had a laptop with me I wouldn't have paid the extra charge...not on top of the $145 a night I was already paying. The larges size bed the hotel has in there rooms is a queen size bed. Personally I would have preferred a king and the mattresses were hard wi no pillow top. Other than that it was a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mundus-eo-ire-itum
Reviews.Content: I stay here every time I travel to Toronto for business; and that's at least once a month for a couple of nights. Great location. Close to everything - great restaurants, shopping and events. The Hotel rooms are always super clean and smartly furnished. I used to stay at Royal York, but it's starting to show its age.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: standardpoodlemom
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, friendly staff, great room and view from the 23rd floor. My only complaint is there is no free internet in the room. 1 King W. is located near the subway, Eatons Centre, Union Station, waterfront, a short walk to St. Lawrence Market, and many restaurants in the area, plus the theatres. I don`t think there is another hotel in Toronto for the price with all that this one has to offer. You won`t be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Life05
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at One King West. From the moment that we had made our reservation we had known we made the right choice. The Reservation agent was attention to all details and questions that we had. Once we arrived the check in procedure was quick and informative. I have one word to describe the rooms exquisite! Our room had the best of both worlds. We could view the city on one side and then the waterfront off of the other. Service was excellent, very professional. We didn't stay for breafast during the stay, given the great location; and that everything is close by to the Hotel. Thanks for a wonderful Stay!

Reviews.Title: “Top Self - Excellent Hotel for value and experience”
Reviews.Author: randy_helliwell
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at 1 King West on a number of occasions and have never been disappointed. The hotel is centrally located; the amenities and service are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Location: the best - View and Room: fantastic, modern, design”
Reviews.Author: airman7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is exactly located in the centre or Toronto, which means that you park your car in the garage and you can walk everywhere without problems. The Underground station is just outside the entrance of the hotel. It is very close to the shopping centres, to the CN Tower, railway station and a lot of restaurants. They have a garage (wallet parking), unfortunately a bit expensive, but this is Toronto and the financial area. The hotel is made of 2 blocks. The old one was an old bank which has been restructured. The new part is a very high modern building with a nice design. We had a room at floor 36. Beautiful view! It's very good build, 'cause you don't hear anything from the other rooms. Fantastic. In every room there is a modern kitchen with microwave, fridge, dish-washer and cloth-washer! So you can even do your laundry in the room. The room is spacious and have a nice and modern design. The only negative points: the design of the bathroom is definitely nothing interesting, like American standards and the room does have an old carpet.. it should be instantly replaced with a hard wood floor! If we ever go back to Toronto, we would definitely go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Some parts great + other parts not-so-great = average overall”
Reviews.Author: Australianchick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for New Years Eve and when we first walked into the room, we were delighted. Our room was extremely arge and beautiful with high celings and gorgeous furnishings. It was only upon closer inspection that we realized that alot of corners had been cut here. For starters - the bathroom was indeed tiny. I wonder why they made the room itself so ridiculously large and the bathroom so tiny - there could have been a much better balance achieved. There was only one towel each. No spares, no nothing! (Don't they ever have females staying there??) This is the first hotel we've ever stayed in where there was only one towel each. The towels were very thin, too. Next, I tried to run a bath and was horrified when there was hair and some weird gunk stuff in it. I therefore gave up on my bath and tried to let that water out but the plug hole was stuck and it wouldn't escape. The water stayed in the bath until we'd left.
