I then had a shower and the other reviewers are right - the shower curtain let too much water escape on the floor. And obviously with a shortage of towels, there wasn't alot to mop it up with. I was also disappointed to find that there was only one tea bag too - my husband and I shared the camomile. Despite these small disappointments, we did have a fantastic time staying at One King West but next time we will try to see if we can find something better.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: TRVLALOT_9
Reviews.Content: From the images on the Hotel's website I expected much more. The lobby is "tired". Both the King Street and Melinda Street entrances were littered with trash (it was a holiday weekend but still no excuse for what is supposed to be a nice hotel). The room was nice but the bathroom was very small (I was in the historic section) and the bathroom towels were beyond awful - they were so thin you could barely dry yourself. On the positive side the fron desk staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than We Imagined!”
Reviews.Author: Lola_and_Jack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at One King West for two nights recently to celebrate our wedding anniversary. What a spectacular location, and from our 46th floor suite afforded the best views of downtown Toronto possible. We loved the combination of old world charm with up to the date conveniences. Service and food quality were amazing. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a boutique hotel experiences, lots of charm and downtown location....at a great rate. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT STAY IN A REALLY CONVENIENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: MilanoRoberta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a superior suite on the 42th floor,it was really exciting ,the view from our room was outstanding .The room was very comfortable and clean.The hotel is located in the heart of Toronto and the public trasport is the nearest as possible.The staff is very kind and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice stay overall”
Reviews.Author: jet2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights, Thursday-Saturday. We were on the 15 floor, with basically a view of a wall, but no big deal. We were offered a room with a better view for $10 per night, but we declined. Thursday night we had a late dinner in the restaurant, just a couple of appetizers & a bottle of wine - all very good. Service was a little bit slow, since there was only one waiter & we were charged for an extra appetizer on our bill, but it was cleared up. The rooms were nice & comfortable. I also found the hotel to be very quiet, which was great, maybe there weren't too many people staying there. The room & the hotel in general were very warm, we actually had to turn our air conditioning on. Also, the bathroom was rather small, hard for 2 people to be in there. And there was no tub (which I didn't care about), but the shower curtain didn't really keep the water in the shower, so the floor ended up with a lot of water which needed to be wiped up. I loved the comfy leather chairs by the bar area.

Reviews.Title: “An all around good place to stay - great food, great location and great service.”
Reviews.Author: kgondosch
Reviews.Content: Room with a dishwasher, stove, microwave, fridge, safe, shower and tub and a comfy bed. Located near many great attractions and awesome restaurants - suits all my needs. From a business perspective - our meeting room was great, clean and again service was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Despite an incredible view and prime location, accommodations leave much to be desired”
Reviews.Author: kdm_traveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a single night at One King West Hotel on our way home from a trip down south. We just wanted to enjoy a nice day in the city - shopping downtown, etc. Let me first say, this hotel and its accommodations has great potential as a hip, modern downtown location for business travellers and vacationers alike, however, in its current state, it's a far cry from the 4 star rating it boasts. Please note, we had this room at a discounted price - never would I pay the general price to stay here. Pros: - We were assigned a room on the 44th floor with a breathtaking night view of Yonge St. spanning all the way across the city to the lake. - The hotel is situated in the "middle of it all". We were a mere five minute walk to the Eaton Centre and all surrounding hot spots. Considering the morning we were there the city hosted the annual Santa Clause Parade, the ability to get places on foot was essential. Now for the breakdown on the less than pleasing room itself. Keep in mind we're a young couple that's easy going. We don't sweat the small stuff BUT we take note of attention to detail (or in this case, lack thereof). So for those interested as a heads up, here's how it is. Cons: - While we did not have need of the kitchen area for our stay, I noticed that hotel basics for this layout such as coffee packets and detergent were not present. - The lobby bar/restaurant made the hotel feel like a nightclub rather than a classy hotel - A female mgr type at the front desk was anything but friendly with a scowl that would make anyone want to turn around and leave. - The beautiful view was sadly obscured by the countless fingerprints and forehead smears on the windows. It was clear the windows hadn't been cleaned..not in days but months. - As another reviewer noted from their stay, we were faced with a hideaway bed; "Murphy Bed" as a mgr explained on here.The ironic part being how the mgr clearly explained that these beds were allocated for guests staying long term for their convenience. We stayed one night. A hard futon quality mattress with little to no support. Not what you expect after a long flight. Also had pot lights previously mentioned with no switch and taped wires. - To further reiterate the above reviewer - LOUDEST, most HORRIFYINGLY NOISY heating/air conditioning system we have ever encountered. In the end we opted to turn it off which just made us aware of how paper thins the walls were - we could still hear the air units in the surrounding rooms haha - The floor hadn't been vacuumed and old face clothes had been left on the bathroom counter. - The shower head was so small it only offered a minor stream of water and while modern in appearance, the shower was void of shelving or trays to put soap, shampoo, etc. Lastly, it was surprising again that for a hotel portraying a hip, modern vibe....the room still had the old 90s big box tv. No plasma in sight.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay for a couple”
Reviews.Author: TorontoA
Reviews.Content: I purchased the "One Love" package directly from the One King West hotel website. It included one night's stay in a Premium Suite, in addition to fresh flowers and chocolate covered strawberries. When I checked in, I was handed an envelope with my name on it, and inside the envelope was two free breakfast vouchers. I was really surprised and happy with this as this was not a part of the deal I purchased. The room was decorated nicely. We had a great view from the 37th floor. We were given a King size bed (the ad said King or Queen), the room had a big bouquet of yellow roses, and inside the refridgerator was two plates of chocolate covered strawberries. The strawberries were delicious! Overall, our stay was great. Things where the hotel could improve: Our bathroom was tiny, and had a sliding door directly adjacent to the bed. In other words there was no privacy in there at all. Also, as a four star hotel, they should have newspaper delivery directly to your suite. The breakfast was o.k. The restuarant is not huge, and the wait staff wer not friendly at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but had issues!”
Reviews.Author: Terri1970
Reviews.Content: We checked in late on a Saturday afternoon, the lobby was busy due to what appeared to be a large wedding party, but check in was very fast and staff were polite and courtious, the porter took our bags to our room and was very friendly and informative. Our room was on the 9th floor of the older building, HUGE suite with great amenities, however no view whatsoever, we simply looked out on the wall of another building just a few feet away which made the room incredibly dark and the internal lighting was not great, this took away much of the 'roomy' feeling it should have had. I was a little suprised that there was no detergent or cloth to enable us to wash up and the maid simply kept piling the washing up into the dishwasher each day until we were left with no more crockery! Would it have taken much to just provide a couple of dishwasher tablets so it could have actually been switched on??? this would have been very handy for a 7 night stay. I was going to say that it was great to have FREE wifi in the room, but having read all the other reviews I can only assume that we were the lucky ones who managed to link into someone elses network as we were connected to 'Trendnet'! For a large suite, the bathroom was disapointingly small, with only a shower and no bathtub, for a 4 star hotel I felt this let it down. The room was generally kept clean though there was a couple of areas including the CD player next to our bed that clearly never got cleaned and were thick with dust! We were also unfortunate that a personal item went missing from our room while we were out, we spoke to the maid about it but she was distinctly not interested and we can only assume if she was the only person who had access to our room that she was responsible for the disapearance, however when we brought the matter to the attention of the manager he could not have been more helpful and even gave me his personal cell phone number to contact him on, although the missing item is yet to be found. The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance to most attractions, shopping and restaurants, with direct access to subway, street car and path (underground shopping) We were also picked up directly from the door for our excursion to Niagra Falls. Although we had a very bad experience with our housekeeper, I like to think this was an isolated incident and would still recomend the hotel as all the other staff we came into contact with were helpful, friendly and polite at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SHEAMUSToronto
Reviews.Content: Perhaps just an off day but I felt for all the hype this hotel was quite disappointing. The rooms while nicely decorated are nothing special; even rather dated, which is surprising given that the hotle is only about five years old. Room service between midnite and 6:30am consists of approximately six to eight items that are premade and meant to be heated up in the rooms' microwave. The items were priced at $15 - $18 each. No energy either from staff or thoughout the entire hotel, just boring. Much better rooms for considerable cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Ayeletb
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here for a week. It was close to the office and people told me it was great so I gave it a chance. It had a decent layout with a kitchen, fridge toaster and washer and dryer. If you wanted to get laundry or dishwasher detergent, you had to order it from room service. I was surprised there was no detergent to wash dishes and no paper towels or towels for the kitchen. They kept forgetting to replace the one knife in the drawer. The bathroom was old. There was no place to put anything in the shower. The towels looked like they were chewed on and often they forgot to leave a towel for the floor. Room service came with no silverware. I ordered a sparkling water with lemon, no glass. It was very strange. For me, the biggest challenge was no wireless. I was happy to transfer to the Four Seasons, at a lower rate, where everything was absolutely fantastic. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Star of the centre stage”
Reviews.Author: robrebrab
Reviews.Content: After deciding to go to Toronto for a holiday I started upon a search of hotels that would suit our needs. I am glad to say that my choice of this hotel could not have been bettered. The location is perfect as it sits right on the corner of Yonge Street and King, and all the attractions are in walking distance from here. If you do not feel like walking there is a streetcar stop right outside and the subway is seconds away. We stayed in the old converted bank part of the hotel and the rooms are spacious with a large queen bed,shower room (no bath) and a kitchenette area. We never really used these facilities except for a morning coffee and cereal. However, if you wish to make full use of the kitchenette there are supermarkets nearby that sell all your needs. We did not eat in the hotel as there is so much choice in the local area, and you really are spoilt for choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - nothing but good things to say”
Reviews.Author: kramer9399
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Oct 15-17th...what an amazing hotel. Our premium room was perfect. Staff was excellent..the location is amazing..2 blocks from dundas square...about 10 minutes from air canada center, rogers center and CN tower. A very modern hotel...lobby is always 'buzzing' which is great. I would definably stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, very good location”
Reviews.Author: JMichel_07
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, in the heart of Toronto, lots of shops and restaurants around, there's a subway station just in front and you can easily walk to the main attractions like the CN Tower. As we were 4 in the same room, we could have a good price for the stay, but the hotel parking was expensive and we had to pay for wireless internet. The room was very clean, we liked to have a kitchenette with fridge, sink, electric cooktops, microwave, dishwasher, dryer and washer. It is simple to drive to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 Star Hotel at a Bargain Price.”
Reviews.Author: itbetterbeclean
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms based on TripAdvisor recommendations. We had 5 night stay to attend wedding, booked in advance and got 30% off deal, much cheaper than Marriott or Hilton nearby. Location is great, right downtown, many restaurants, subway across street, cabs very easy to find, downstairs connects directly to underground â€œPATHâ€�, shopping, dining, manicure, haircut, banks, etc. Skip the expensive hotel breakfast and go to food courts under the building Eaton Centre short walk up the block. We were able to pack light since rooms come with washer and dryer, go across the street to drug store to purchase detergent. We booked premium suite on 35th floor, accommodated 3 of us with no problems, fridge is nice for leftovers as is the microwave. Pull out sofa was comfortable. Housekeeping is excellent both rooms were spotless, we left note and tip for extra soap shampoo and towels and never had any issues. Other room was studio suite on 33rd floor, wasnâ€™t large but was good for one person. Views were great in both rooms. Gym fully equipped and very clean, plenty of towels. Had drinks at bar, wasnâ€™t cheap but bar nuts made up for cost. Used the Commerce Court parking garage (TripAdvisor recommendation) was only $8 on weekends. Will stay again on next visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: gxp
Reviews.Content: From beginning, very inconvenient when arriving with car. No area to pull in and single lane for valet parking. Blocked by car waiting for person to leave. Only valet parking. $30 plus tax. Hotel is old bank and a new tower. Stayed in old building. Windows face into a courtyard with view of a wall. Washroom quite small with only a shower, no tub, Curtain tends to blow around so floor gets wet. Skimpy on supplies so only one bar of soap for vanity and shower. Free internet only in lobby, otherwise $10 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Despite the positive reviews...quite disappointed”
Reviews.Author: idhamr
Reviews.Content: Pros - The location is great - The 1 Bedroom-room is HUGE and has great views of the city - I had no difficulty in sleeping Cons - To receive excellent customer service is hit and miss - I'm sure we were allocated a studio when we had paid for a superior so had to get an upgrade to a one-bedroom for $50 CDN a night. Comments I was swayed into choosing this hotel because of the positive feedback. Don't get me wrong, those reviews can be trusted but, sadly, my experience was different. Firstly, after getting our hopes up with the photos on the internet on their superior room, we were given a small room - which I think may well have been a studio room (a downgrade to what we had paid for). The toilet in this room (2205) was RIGHT NEXT to the bed (well, separated by a door). Secondly, when I had complained, I didn't receive the best of service from the front desk. If you want great service, hold making your request until "Mac" is on duty. Thirdly, no one helped us with our luggage when we were dropped off by the taxi, when we changed rooms and when we checked out. We had to struggle to carry our suitcases and lugggages. Fourthly, one day the maid left the bin bag with all the rubbish in our room (gone the next day mind you, BUT, still not great customer care). Finally, we made one request to guest servivces. The operator said that she would call us back. She never did. If One King West prevented all these niggling bits, then my rating would have been higher. Sadly their service delivery was below our expectations hence the scoring. By the way, the hotel gets used a lot for events so it does get busy. Expect to bump into some rowdy guests (this is nothing One King West can do, unfortunately).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful exterior and 1st impression but disappointed with room”
Reviews.Author: patsashl
Reviews.Content: Arrived Saturday afternoon and our vehicle was taken by valet, flat rate of $30 for the night. There were two weddings in the hotel that night so the lobby was hopping but check in was quick and painless. Our bags were brought up to our room by a porter who was informative and helpful. Upon entrance to the room, we were not impressed. The room was dark and small but what really caught our attention was the exterior view out the window. A closed in blue wall. Not like another building across the street or even an alley way where you could maybe peak out on an angle and see something but this was a closed in blue wall 15 feet from our own window, like it was attached to the building that we were in. Obviously another building that's been built attached to our own. We requested another room and the porter called to inquire if there were other rooms available but there were not. We were there for only one night so we thought nothing more. The bathroom had no tub, just a walk in shower. The next day we called to have our vehicle retrieved from the valet and were advised it would be 30 minutes prior to it arriving. I'm sure there were nicer rooms to be had, we were just unfortunate enough to not stay in one of them, especially for $239 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: remster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice in 3 weeks and were happy with the rooms and service. The concierge were particularly helpful in making sure we get to the airport quickly. They even lend the car service a carseat so our 2 year old could go in the car with a car seat. Location is fantastic, close to the convention center and it is also connected to the huge underground city.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive, find another”
Reviews.Author: Hoogsie
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good location, subway outside, Union Station about 3 blocks away, v close to St Lawrence Market and easy downtown walk (in fact, I walked everywhere at length) 44th floor - fab city views Only accommodation I could find during Toronto International Film Festival Washer, drier, dishdrawer dishwasher, functional fridge which actually kept things fresh Fantastic housekeeping - nothing too much trouble, which is good ... see cons Cons: In CBD Charged wired internet at $10 per day - I paid about AUS$400 per night and expected it to be included (it only goes til 5pm following day, so "per day" is ill-defined and changes depending on which staff member you talk to) Coffee pod machine in room, no pods. When I asked housekeeping for pods, they replaced it with a percolator. No filters, no coffee! Nearest market - no filters, no pods! No kettle for tea - but housekeeping kindly sent up a non-electric whistling one (sorry neighbours) Hairdryer didn't work - housekeeping replaced Asked housekeeping for dishwasher pellets, dish cloths, got both. Given there is are hotplates etc, there are no utensils to cook with, nothing to wash up with, one pot, 2 plates, cups, bowls, 2 sets of cutlery,,no cutting board, no knives Loudest airconditioning I've ever heard, anywhere Pull-down bed (which stays down) has lights in it but no switch, just a wire hanging out, no bedside lamps, no ceiling lights, so no way to read in bed No bath Overpriced for the quality of the amenities and mixed guest services help and advice - if you can get a bargain on a discount website, it would be worth staying, otherwise search Tripadvisor for the apartments in Bloor-Yorkville, wish I had stayed there instead. If you do stay here, be sure to tip housekeeping well! They are worth it.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel suite in a good location”
Reviews.Author: mking57
Reviews.Content: stayed her for three nights over labor day weekend.......nice hotel that includes a full suite in every room.......fridge, stove, sink, dishwasher, dishes, and washer & dryer.......good location in the financial area.........walk to st lawrenece market....king st subway station right below hotel.......hotel is a a little over priced...........my only complaint is that they charge for the wired internet in the room....( for the cost of the room they should include internet in the room),,,,,,,,free wireless is available in the lobby ,,also breakfast is not included......the hotel parking is over prised,,,,,,,,,,,use the commererce court parking garage on wellington st for a lower cost ( especilly on weekends after 5PM on fridays)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room - for the price. Needs major updating to be called a 4-star hotel though.”
Reviews.Author: peachrayz
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on Hotwire for a special rate of $89 for a Saturday night. The One King West Hotel & Residence was listed as a 4-star hotel. For $89, you cannot beat the location - right off the main Toronto street of Yonge, and four blocks from the water. However, I would not pay more. This hotel lists at a regular rate of approximately $180/night, and you would not be getting a great deal nor "4-star" accommodations for that amount of money. The rooms came well equipped with comfortable bed, full kitchenette and washer/dryer. However, the rooms were also a bit tired and dirty - spots on the carpet and this "suite" was no bigger than an average room. The bathroom was small and the TV looked as if it had been purchased 20 years ago. I can believe that at one time, this was a 4-star hotel, however, The One King West Hotel & Residence certainly needs some major updating to retain this star rating.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Holdfast4
Reviews.Content: I spent quite a bit of time researching hotels in central Toronto and settled on 1 king west. My spouse and I stayed in a superior studio suite and were extremely satisfied with our stay. I was attracted initially to the non-cookie cutter rooms typical in most hotels. The room was very modern with sophisticated looking furnishings, a very comfortable bed, nice walk-in shower and modern kitchenette. We were stationed on the 18th floor and did find the room a bit dark as our bedroom window was frosted over as it clearly faced another building in close proximity. We did not consider this an issue however because the room had so many other positives and the 'office' section of the room offered a view of the lake. My only disappointment was that there was no wi-fi (only hard-wired) so I was unable to use it.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCharlie
Reviews.Content: Everything was great here. Location, staff, rooms. Historic building with plenty of charm and character. I didn't make use of anything besides the lobby, elevator and room so I don't have much to say about any other amenities because I didn't use them. Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated and subtle”
Reviews.Author: TrippingAllOver
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this hotel with my husband as tourists in our own city. It was lovely. I really have a preference for smaller, boutique hotels. Our room opens into a small hallway that leads into a long, curved and narrow suite. At one end is the bathroom, stretching down the room is our bed, a change area, a mini kitchen with sink, fridge and microwave, a table and chairs, a desk at the end. I loved it! The building used to be a bank. The architecture, furnishing and wall mountings give you the feel of how grand the offices must've been once. I like that this is now an inconspicuous hotel, nestled in the heart of the financial district. I never knew there was a hotel here. Entrance is either at the corner of King and Yonge or a side street south of King. In the elevate, you run into obvious tourists as well as suited up road warriors on business in Toronto. Hotel is an easy walk to the island ferry, Eaton Centre, a few good restaurants and subway. Furnishing is contemporary and comfortable, housekeeping does a good job of cleaning and tidying up, hotel staff is friendly and helpful, breakfast buffet is plentiful. Breakfast and wifi came with the deal we got, but I didn't like having to pay $30 a day for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Shaky takeoff but a smooth landing!”
Reviews.Author: jerseytraveller_8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned yesterday from a 6 night stay at the hotel. Within the first day I realized the lady at the front desk placed 2 holds on my credit/debit card which kept me from my funds. She told me the machine was acting up so she had to swipe my card again. I wasn't concerned at first because surely all they had to do was call my bank first thing the next morning to release one of the holds. Wrong!!. I had to be present while they contacted my bank and that couldnt be done till the following week due to bank hours. Dont want to spend anymore time on that but just be careful to monitor your credit card or bank accounts. Check in was great in that they gave us a room some 5 hrs. early. The downside was a much smaller room than I had seen on the website. It still had all the appliances listed which was convienient but the room was very small (Room 822) but we didnt complain. Our issue came a couple of nights later when we realized the abundance of light that came from the lights in the atrium. My only thought on the previous 2 nights was we were too tired from the early flight to notice or care. I called the front desk requesting the lights be turned off as from inside the room it looked like it was daytime at 10:00 at night. They told me the lights always stay on and offered us another room (room 601). That room was larger and we had plans to move our belongings the following morning but the air conditioner was broken. The following morning they put us in another room ..out 3rd on this trip but by far the best. We had a room on the 47th floor (room 4701) with an even larger room than 601 and with a view of the city. The room was dark and the air worked. We've been in many hotels and have read many reviews where they have refused to accomodate us the paying customer. I can say that this hotel on this trip did all they could without the involvement of the management. The fitness center on the rooftop gave a nice view of the city but was smaller than I thought. They have free weights, 3 treadmills, 2 eliptical machines and 2 stationary bikes. The location is great..right in the middle of everything and with the train station being right under the hotel, you can't do any better. We didnt eat at the hotel so I can't comment. Lastly I requested a late check out as our flight didnt leave until late in the afternoon and they gave it to us. If a hotel is able then they will..if not then they wont. In the past when traveling we like to spend time in different hotels often in different areas of a city so the likelihood of us returning to One King West is small but short of the few issues, we would strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: kekbaldw
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great price. Great hotel. Our suite had its own washer and dryer units! pretty impressive. Beautiful lobby and lots of history (with a roof top hot tub and sauna!) My only criticism would be that the restaurant wasn't very big - but there are so many places just steps away that it's not a big deal. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: CBelanger
Reviews.Content: When I arrived there was a noisy air mover in my room. It seems the carpet was wet and they took it out without checking, so the carpet stayed wet. There was a dishwasher but no soap, dishcloth or tea towel, which is probably why the cutlery and many of the dished in the cupboard were less than clean. It seems they have some rooms with baths and others with showers. I was not asked if I had a preference and ended up with just a shower. On the first morning I went to use a face cloth and it had mascara on it. I left it and the other cloth on the shower floor and they were taken away, but not replaced! The last disappointment was when I checked out and left my suitcase with the bell man. When I came to collect it, they took the claim ticket and handed me another person's suitcase. This is supposed to be a great hotel, but I won't be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Do Better for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Tamworth76
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The rooms are big and quiet. Higher floor rooms have fantastic views. The beds are extremely comfortable - very conducive to a fantastic night's sleep. The breakfast buffet is good, but as always, expensive. There is a good breakfast spot directly across the road (from the valet parking). There is a gym which is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a full service hotel”
Reviews.Author: djrgreene
Reviews.Content: Very nice rooms. Incredible in-room laundry. Only negatives about the room was the shower, and no high-def TV. The room-service menu showed a nice breakfast menu, but the only breakfast available was a reasonable buffet downstairs. No wireless internet. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Standard hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Zoukie
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at this hotel whilst visiting Toronto. This hotel is right in the heart of the financial district. The rooms are wonderful - much more spacious than comparable hotels in the US. It has all the necessary facilities but nothing that jumps out at you as different or unique to this hotel. It meets your expectations and is good value.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Amit06
Reviews.Content: considering it's a fairly expensive place to stay, did not get the service for the money's worth. I stayed for 7 nights they never changed the bed sheets, phone was broken almost the whole time could not call for room service when needed. Did not have the coffee maker until the 3rd day... I paid for my room ahead of time but they didn't bother to let me know that they were taking out extra $100/per night for security..... i was traveling from US so i was depending on my credit card..... i had to check my bank statement to find out. I thought one king service was inconsiderate and they did not pay attention to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again at the One King West!”
Reviews.Author: dkrmjn
Reviews.Content: Reserved a room at the One King West for 5 nights...my partner was speaking at a local hospital...I went along for a fun trip. The hotel is in a great location and offers comfortable QUIET rooms that all have a little kitchen with 2 burner cooktop, microwave, coffee maker and coffee, small fridge, washer, dryer and dishwasher. Our room had a king bed, large window overlooking the lake, TV, arm chair, desk and desk seating, (Rm 3805). Our friends who came along had a room with less expansive view and a queen bed but much more square footage and a lovely sitting room type configuration. (Rm 3612). We had only a shower, they had a shower and tub. The rooms are tastefully appointed, and though some carpet and chair updating would help, overall the decor is up to date and looks well kept. The entire facility is smoke free and kept very clean. We found the front desk folks to be reasonably helpful, but Justin in Concierge and the guys running the bar were the most friendly and helpful of everyone there. Justin helped us get a rental car for a drive to Niagara Falls, suggested routes for our site seeing and gave us umbrellas to use on a rainy evening. The hotel is literally on top a subway station which makes going anywhere in Toronto downtown districts a breeze. We will definitely stay at this great hotel (located in an historic bank building) again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff and great overall experience”
Reviews.Author: TravellingFBM
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were spending the weekend in Toronto and wanted to stay somewhere in the downtown core that was a bit nicer but not 300+ dollars per night. We found a deal on a premium suite, which meant we were on the 38th floor and had a small kitchen and southeast window that had an amazing view. We got all of this for $330 for the weekend. Not to mention the window opened to allow for fresh outside air into the room which we were both very excited about. The parking is a bit expensive because for the location. Since the hotel is in the downtown core the hotel only offers valet parking at $30 per night but they are very quick to park and bring your car up. The staff at the hotel are very helpful and pleasant and always willing to lend a hand. From checking to bumping into staff in the hall, everyone was very professional. We were very happy with our room since it was large and had a mini fridge, laundry facility, dishwasher, sink, plates and cups. The suite was only one room and didnâ€™t have a separate sleeping area from the sitting area and only offered a chair and stool vs a couch which seems to be standard in a suite. It was ideal since the chair and stool were easy to move to allow us to drink our wine and enjoy our excellent view of the city. In comparison to other hotels I would say that you get great value at One King West and the location canâ€™t be beat! The other nice feature is that you can access the subway from inside the hotel by accessing the PATH system which is very convenient. All in all we truly enjoyed our stay at One King West and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyFunTraveler
Reviews.Content: Book a room with the view of the city and river, Wonderful breakfast . Great location to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Dark and dim room, cooking odors from restaurant...don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Anne9878
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in early May 2010 and found the hotel to be dark and dim. My room looked out onto a solid wall and there was no natural light at all in the room. Even at 1 pm, I had to have all of the lights on in the room. The noise from the kitchenette exhaust was really loud and kept me awake at night. The worst part was that the room constantly was filled with cooking odors from the restaurant down in the lobby -- this was surprising as I was on the 15th floor. I would NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “location and amenities excellent!”
Reviews.Author: travellingdoris
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a long weekend. Got a wonderful sale price on hotel's website. Considering the location and the great full kitchenette, mini laundry in room and view from one of the higher floors, the value was outstanding. We arrived to find that many, many 20-30 somethings who liked to drink loudly and leave their glasses/cans in the lifts were also guests - staff made sure our room was away from the 'differently' mature guests and not near the elevators. So all in all, not a problem at all. The staff also ensured that said cans/glasses were promptly removed. Anyhow good things: location, amenities, view. Adequate: bed comfort. A bit hard and and not as 'quality' as I would have expected. I wouldn't call it a hot spot, I wouldn't call it trendy, and it isn't, IMHO elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: MissouriSteel
Reviews.Content: Extremely comfortable bed, luxurious bathroom & furniture. The location was right in the middle of the action, yet our room was quiet and we slept well. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jen_Edwards
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, close to Hockey Hall a fame, ACC, CN Tower, and the Rogers Centre. The staff was friendly and helpful.The check in and check out was quick and easy. I found the breakfast to be a little expensive for the selection of food that was available. Overall, we really enjoyed this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great amenities in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: costaricanvoyageur
Reviews.Content: This hotel rocked. Our beautiful suite had new furniture, a washer and dryer in suite, a microwave, stove top and fridge. The room shape was unusual, but it didn't bother us at all.The location could not have been better, right in the thick of it, we could see Dundas Square from our room. The gym had the nicest view of any downtown hotel gym I've ever been at. Our only complaint, the gym was too small for such a large hotel. But you will have a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy_Stones
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed back on January. Firstly, thanks to the valet and front desk staff for their warmth and friendliness. The room we got was very clean and spacious for the price. We went to a jazz restaurant/lounge "Joe Mommas" not to far from the hotel recommended by the valet desk guy Carry. Once we got back from our night on the town the lobby bar felt more like a club then a bar so we relaxed there until close. Very friendly staff there as well. A very special thanks to the night manager Sean for all his additional help and tips about the area at night. Anyone looking to stay in Toronto, please give this place a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad experience - Wedding at One King West”
Reviews.Author: Pinky88Toronto
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding reception at One King West last March. Generally the event was great - it's a beautiful venue with delicious food and the banquet team was very accommodating as we planned and prepared for the day. However, there were a few major snafus that should *never* have happenned... specifically not from a hotel that touts itself as a classy facility for weddings/events! In short: - Valet was so understaffed and slow that many guests almost missed the (offsite) wedding ceremony due to the slow rate at which cars were retrieved. Upwards of 45 rooms at OKW were reserved by our guests and they knew the wedding was offsite at 3:30 pm - yet there were 2 people on valet. It was very poorly run (especially at $40/night) - A/V - for A/V, podium rentals - you MUST use their preferred vendor - yet no one checked to see if the podium etc was installed in the right area (as on the floor plan) - it wasn't. - Special meals - we had an elderly guest with severe food restrictions -we had taken great care so as to not single her out but serve her appropriate special items - this was forgotten and the server instead urged her to 'try the regular meal, it's good' - not appropriate and the exact opposite effect from the subtlety we had painstakingly gone over with the banquet manager. - Tip jars on bar - we had this in the contract - there were to be NO tip jars on the bar as the grats were (steeply) included in our cost. Tip jars were present during the cocktail reception - we asked they be removed - they were put back on the bar during the dinner. - Cocktail reception - we were assured the King Gallery would be large enough for our crowd - it wasn't. We weren't offered to have the reception in the Austin Room which would have been far more suitable. - Finally - despite the tasting and the chat with the chef, and the fact that they made us review and initial each page of the banquet order the day before the wedding to ensure all details were correct - THEY SERVED THE WRONG MEAL. Pork with a mushroom cream sauce instead of a garlic ginger crust. It was actually quite delicious, but NOT what we ordered, paid for, or chose to go with the other sides. It also looked very unappealing (gray sauce over meat). Why the error? Because 'that's how we usually serve it in the restaurant'. Well - that option wasn't even on the banquet menu. Why make us review each page of the contract if clearly the kitchen staff didn't even look at it? Overall - like I said, the day was great. No one really knew things had gone wrong except for me - but after all the planning and meetings and painstaking choices we made - it was very disheartening to know that our careful plans were basically ignored. We met with the hotel afterwards - they were apologetic to a point, but really - they already had the money in the bank so it wasn't really their problem. I would still recommend it - it was lovely - but think it's important for people to hear both good and bad feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Common hotel”
Reviews.Author: russo45
Reviews.Content: This is a common one from all the same style hotel in toronto. We stayed at this for our travelling to my Son home. Room big enough and comfo facilities, We enjoyed the breakfast in room service, and the tolwer color.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Wizzzkid
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this hotel as a base point for a one week sightseeing tour of Toronto. This was my first time spending any amount of time in Toronto. I did a lot of research before the trip as far as what I had planned and my options as far as hotels go. I like to think i am an experienced traveler, as I have visited over half the states in the Us as well as a number of provinces in Canada, all by car. I had studied the reviews for this hotel quite extensively and can usually pick out the "nit pickers" from the serious issues. This seemed like a reasonable place in a great location. After reading the reviews I knew what to expect and what not to. Cleanliness - I was greatly impressed by the cleanliness throughout the room and hotel in general. My only complaint was the staff seemed to take their time in cleaning tables at breakfast. They have a small amount of tables, so in my opinion I think they needed to be a bit quicker on that part. Location - This hotel is in one of the best spots in downtown. The subway stop is so close to the hotel you could almost fall down the stairs into the subway stepping out of the hotel doors haha. If it is raining or cold you can take the underground walkway to the same subway stop. The hotel is right on the corner of Younge & King st, so bus routes are also right at the doorstep. I never even tried to get a cab as I had a 7 day subway pass. Great value, as it works on both the subway and busses. Just make sure and get the correct pass, as there is more then one choice. Several restaurants and shopping is close by as the Eaton Centre is only a few subway stops down, or a nice walk on a summer day. Several other attractions are also close by such as the Hockey Hall of Fame and CN Tower. Also the location (Younge & King) may seem like it would make for a noisy environment. Being 40 floors up, we did not experience hardly any noise with the exception of a couple nights when it seemed that half of Toronto's FD was driving past the hotel. Rooms - I was able to book a one bedroom suite which features a separate bedroom area from the living area which itself as a pull out sofa bed, which is larger then most pull-outs I have seen. Also included is a full kitchen area with mini-fridge, microwave, mini-stove, automatic dishwasher, dishes, and even a mini washer and dryer for your clothes!!! We were also on the 40th floor so the view was beyond breathtaking. Heck I even hooked up my antenna to my laptop and was getting TV broadcasts all the way from Buffalo NY across the lake! Service - The service for the rooms was very fast. There were times we left the room for 30 or 45min to go eat breakfast then come back to the room to gather a few things before heading out. When we got back to the room after breakfast, the room was already made up almost everyday! Check in and check out was quick both times. Though I did give service 4 / 5 because while I was there the fire alarm sounded. I found out later that someone thought it would be funny. The reason I gave them 4 was because of the way they handled it. They came on the loudspeaker (one in every room and through the hotel), and told everyone to stay in their room while they "investigate" the situation. hmm?!?!?! I was always trained if a fire alarm goes off you get the heck out, especially in such a tall building. Is this a Canadian thing? Anyway the alarm kept going for about 15min, giving the SAME speech, no updates. Finally after the FD had been on scene for about 10 minutes they reset it. Again, im not complaining about the fire alarm, the hotel cant control that... but they are asking for trouble telling people to stay in the rooms during a fire alarm. Also most the time it seemed like the elevators took forever! I understand this hotel has 40+ floors but there were 4 elevators. Value - The overall value was good. A lot of people complain about the price, when they go during peak season. Wake up people! What do you expect out of a major downtown hotel that is rated as high as this one, and is mostly suites. I went in Sept so it wasn't peak season and good a decent price (cheaper then the hotel site) off of expedia. Again I did give it 4 / 5 because the internet in the room was quite expensive. They did have a business center and you could access the lobby wi-fi for free after obtaining a free code from the front desk. My complaint is if you spend all that money on a nice suite, why would you want to be confined to sitting in the lobby? That was not well thought out. The internet was also VERY slow. The breakfast (if you did not want the very few hot buffet items available) cost $40 for two! The food was average to good, but not worth half that much. There is a breakfast place a block or two south on Younge st. Amenities - The exercise room seemed to be fairly nice. They have two very large hot tubs but no pools, with men's and women's saunas and a complete changing room right there. That seemed kind of odd to me, for a hotel this nice and to have all of the aforementioned but not have a pool. Oh well, I made it up by spending some well needed time in the hot tub. There is also a bar in the lobby area. There is an outdoor deck area near the hot tubs. There is also a gift shop. Avoid it if you can, it is a rip-off as most hotel gift shops are. There is a grocery store directly across the street that will sell everything you could need. Summary: This is a well-maintained hotel with mainly suites, that is in just about the perfect place for a base location throughout Toronto. You just need to come during off-peak times to get good prices, or else you will be paying a premium. It's that simple.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: LaraVancouver
Reviews.Content: Me and two of my co-workers stayed here on a recent trip to Toronto and none of us had a good experience. We found the concierge and valet service to be consistenly slow and unhelpful and the business centre was so expensive and tiny that it may as well have not been there. I will be back to my regular Westin Harbour Centre next time I am in town. Service in the restaurant in the evening was also slow and the food was mediocre. Breakfast was ok though. The location is quite good and having the kitchen is handy. The heat was very loud.

Reviews.Title: “I just love this city!!”
Reviews.Author: SamIAm012
Reviews.Content: and this hotel was right on King st., which is the perfect place to start walking tours around the city. The view from my room was amazing, right to the CN Tower; the bed was very comfortable, overall a great experience. I booked this through lastminutetravel, and could not get hotel name by the end of the booking, but I wasn't disappointed. I gave it a rate of "very food", but it was nearing excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Angela_The_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We didn't know where we were staying until we booked it, because of the online service we use to book our hotels, so we had no expectations. We have stayed in every major hotel in Toronto but never this one. I really liked having a kitchette and laundry in the room, it really was like home, we stocked the fridge and were able to make a meal and have drinks. These are very well laid out rooms, very nice toiletries and a good spacious shower too. Because it's an old bank cell phone and wireless reception is dodgy. I had a cold breakfast delivered in the morning which the hotel promptly removed from my bill, I didn't ask. I highly recommend this hotel, it's in a lovely building the rooms are well appointed and comfortable and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: mbellny
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times on trips to Toronto. It is in a great location. Walking distance to Eaton Centre, restaurants and theatres. Parking price is a little steep at 30$ a day but will pay around that amount anywhere in T.O. The room came well equiped - washer, dryer, kitchenette and king bed. Only negative in the room was the shower which tended to leak all over the bathroom floor and was so powerful it was an extremely uncomfortable experience. This could be room-specific as I did not have this experience on my previous stays. Overall, for the price, this is a great place to stay in downtown T.O.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Fiddlemaster
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the heart of downtown Toronto and was close to everything. ACC, Rogers Center, Distillery District, Financial District. The staff was so wonderful and helpful. Rooms were great with a great view of CN Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Excellent location. Dynamite view. Would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: bedhead57g
Reviews.Content: This was our third time at this hotel in the past two years. It feels like home. We discovered this gem when attending a wedding. Hotel is 49-stories located on the corner of Yonge and King. We've always stay in the Superior suite. Haven't stayed in a floor lower than the 30th. Spectacular view. Great buffet breakfast in the lobby. Walking distance to the Eaton Centre and St. Lawrence Market. Valet parking. You can come and go as often as you want with your vehicle at no extra charge. Staff at the front desk are awesome (Jessica and Mark). Found a deal on their website for $149 night including parking. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ample, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: RickStevesJunior
Reviews.Content: Perfectly fine for a business stay; slight step up from a holiday in express. Rooms are suites, with washer, dryer, and dishwasher, microwave, kitchen sink. Bathrooms in some rooms have clother shower curtains that stick to you. In shower, there was no place to set shampoo containers but the floor. Watch out for rooms that open to interior, fake outdoors space. There is a void in the building that many rooms open into; it's been done up to look like outside with fake cloudes, rocks and lighting. It might have actually been an asset as far as shelter from street noise. The problem is that they leave the artificial daylight in this void on all night, which in turn creates the sensation (even when your curtains are drawn) that you are sleeping in daylight, which in turn makes for not so good sleep. I would have rather contended with road noise than have this fake light. When I go to Toronto again, I will search for something better in this price range. Doors to hallway also thin, and let in a lot of noise if people are talking in hall.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: FatherHinie
Reviews.Content: Room 4705. Excellent location for walking to attractions. If you drive, get the valet parking BUT look at a map closely. The entrance to the hotel (and parking) is on Melinda St, not King. I recommend highly you go East on King and turn right on Jordan St and then a quick left on Melinda and turn into the hotel on your left just before Younge St. Everyone at the hotel was friendly. The breakfast buffet was very good too. We took a cab to CN Tower for $7 plus tip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: samby4ever
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, with in walking distance to the Blue jays stadium and the CN tower. The Hockey hall of fame was right down the street. The hotel it self was very busy but very clean. Parking however was alot 30.00 a day

Reviews.Title: “Great service, ammenities, view and price at downtown Toronto hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelLadyMadisonWi
Reviews.Content: Used Trip Advisor to find this hotel. Stayed 3 nights at downtown location next to subway, streetcar & within walking distance to harbor, restaurants, Eaton Center, CN Tower, Hockey Hall of Fame, etc. Received special rate that included breakfast for 2, taxes and $30 parking fee. This is a residence hotel and included a refrigerator, stove, microwave, dishwasher and washer/dryer. Smaller room but adequate and clean. We were on the 47th floor with a lovely view of the city and Lake Ontario. Full breakfast with service. Valet and registration desk extremely helpful with recommendations. Was our 45th wedding anniversary and hotel suprised us with 2 bruts of champagne and a dessert tray!

Reviews.Title: “A very strange room!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cheshirepen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in September 2009. The hotel is adapted from an old bank building and you can sense that all around the place from the entrance and lobby to our room. And what a strange room!!! Overall it was a reasonable size with one bed which was comfy. But the dimensions of the room could not be described as anything - not square, not round, not rectangle but looked as if it had been cobbled together from a couple of rooms and perhaps a storage cupboard. This made for cramped conditions in the area where the bed was and a lot of wasted space as you entered the room with a massive "hall". However, the worst thing about it was there was hardly any natural light which made for a very gloomy room. This was because the only window which could give any light was at the end of an "arm" of the room and was not big enough to let sufficient light to the rest of the room. There was another sham window at one side but this was useless for any light. It was well enough appointed - reasonable bathroom (but make sure you lock the door if you are using the loo in case someone comes in and knocks you out with the door!!), washing machine, tumble drier, hair drier, sink, microwave, hob, utensils, fridge, couple of wardrobes. However, if you wanted to make your own meal, there was not really anywhere you could sit at a table to eat it. There was a desk in front of the aforementioned window but this could accommodate only one person. The other table was a more like a coffee table with 2 arm chairs at the side. Also if you wanted to watch the TV the only place you could sit was on the bed as the 3 chairs in the room were not in front or even slightly to the side of the TV. All in all extremely quirky and did not make for a welcoming and homely feel and, for the price we paid, we thought it very poor. We were up early for breakfast so did not suffer the fate of a crowded breakfast bar as mentioned by others in their reviews. However, I could quite see the point they were making. One thing was good - we wanted to check in on line for our flight to Calgary and they had a facility where you could do this for free from their business centre. The staff were friendly and helpful but unfortunately this does not make up for poor accommodation. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: sousse
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days here on the 21st floor. Full kitchen fridge,microwave, hob,dishwasher,washing machine & dryer. Even an ice machine on one of the floors for the gin & tonic. Right on the main Yonge St. close to Hop On Bus stop, theatres,supermarket (opposite the St.Laurance Market). Had great meal in the revolving restaurant in the CN Tower ( you have to pay to go to the viewing deck anyway but this is included with the meal).

Reviews.Title: “Great value - will come here again.”
Reviews.Author: puilam
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant about staying here after reading some negative reviews. Although I stayed only one night, it made enough of an impression on me that I will be back again as I visit Toronto often for business and pleasure. My room was on the 29th floor with a great view looking east. It was clean and perfect, packed with all the luxuries you need for extended stay (cute dishwasher, small fridge, microwave, washer and dryer, coffee maker). My only complaint is there is no kettle or pots/pans for the stovetop so you can't really cook or boil water. But there are enough restaurants and take out places within walking distance that one can enjoy meals in the comfort of your room. Front desk service was attentive and the lobby very inviting for a drink or light meal in the Bistro. For a large hotel it was quiet. Other than city noise, I didn't hear other guests even though my door was very close to the elevator. I needed easy access to the subway so this location is ideal (stairs to subway right in front of the building). Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: K8y69
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 7 nights at the start of the month. Check in upon arrival was quick and efficient and the guy on the reception desk was friendly. We stayed in the older part of the building and the room was a decent size with good facilities. I had read reports about rooms being dark and our room was quite dark too but that is beacuse you are in the heart of the financial district which is a pretty built up area. The hotel has an extension which is higher so I guess if you want a view you could upgrade but personally as we were out all day I didn't care about the view. The room was comfortable and clean and thats what mattered. You could also control the aircon. The room was cleaned each day and although I rinsed the cups and placed them in sink to drip dry the maid dried them and put them back on their shelf. If you bring a laptop you can get free wifi in lobby. Location was great - not much noise from street below at night. Very close to Union Station, CN Tower and Eaton Centre and beside King St Subway and link to PATH. PATH was accessible from hotel. We would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish We could have stayed longer!!”
Reviews.Author: mayaluvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed Friday Sept. 4th for two nights at this great hotel. Our package included Room, parking and a buffet breakfast for both days We were there. We had stayed here twice a couple of years ago and never had any complaints. We arrived around 1pm and were upgraded from a deluxe room to Superior Suite without even asking. When asked if We wanted a low or high floor We chose the high floor which ended up being 46 floors above Yonge St. The view was really nice and made for some great pics. Room was very clean and suited all of Our needs. Wife loved the DVD optioned as it gave Her something to do while I attended Jays games.The buffet breakfast was very good and a great way to start off the day. Location is key here and just a short walk to lots of shopping, sports events and dining options. We will definitely look to stay here again if it within Our price range and recommend this place to anyone who asks.Also the air show was in town this weekend and provided for some extra entertainment both days.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and quality and price”
Reviews.Author: bobapanbeers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in August. We paid 130 $ a night including valet parking and a buffet breakfast. The location is so great: it's right next to the Hockey Hall of Fame, not so far from the CN tower and Rogers Center. We had an excellent view of the city from our room. The bathroom was a bit small but everything else was very cozy. The only bad thing I have to say about this hotel is that I had to call room service twice for them to send 2 glasses to our room. Other than that I would highly recommend this hotel and I will surely stay there if I ever go to Toronto again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms...Nice views so I been told”
Reviews.Author: None2one
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto on business and the One King West seem like a good choice. The rooms are large has everything I needed. I like the fact the windows opened as I am not a fan of A/C and the days I was there the weather was nice. The bathrooms are on the small side, but the fixtures are nice. Now for the not so good things about my stay. I requested a high room and was told the catergory I was in are all on the higher floors. When I arrived I was given a floor on a lower floor and I am sure it was a different catergoy and not the one I paid for. I ask abou this and was told this was the same type I paid for. The room did not have any bar soap. I asked and was told some will be sent up. It never arried. The next day I assumed soap would be provided during the room make up it was not. I asked at first the person make some excuse then confused the hotel was out of soap. I asked the same question the before...I do not have a problem buying a bar of soap. But the empty promises is frustrating. If you bring a car be aware the parking is $30 and only valet. Call about 15 minutes befor you want you car or you will have to wait for the car.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_K13
Reviews.Content: We had a basic suite which wasn't humungous but still plenty of room for two people. It had a kitchenette with a small fridge, stove top, sink, microwave and dishwasher, which is great for buying/making food to cut down on eating out costs. The in-hotel restaurant is on the pricey side but there are places to eat within easy walking distance. Overall the location is pretty central, with plenty of activities and museums in every direction. It's also connected to the PATH, so if you can figure your way through there, it's a nice convenience. The hotel used to be a bank building so it's pretty neat with some interesting history. Only disappointment was there's no free internet in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable comfortable and good value, with top-notch excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: wheelyweb
Reviews.Content: We wanted a night to ourselves while visiting family nd after making a few calls decided 1KingW was the best on offer. Other hotels couldn't offer a room with a view for our reservation for that same night, stating we had to check in before we could have one. 1KW offered a good view in the direction of our choice, threw in breakfast and parking and it still came out less. The staff were faultless: polite and efficient and all I could have hoped for.

Reviews.Title: “Never Disapoints”
Reviews.Author: Crhino
Reviews.Content: Just stayed downtown Toronto at One King West for the weekend to take my daughter to a show and I found (again) that the service and facilities at One King West were terrific. I have stayed there before for both business and pleasure and the service seems to get better each time. The hotel itself has character to it and reminds me a bit of New York or Old Montreal. The rooms are spacious and extremely clean. Our room was also very quiet. It is very centrally located with easy walks or subway to everything. What impresses me most about One King West is the staff. From the valets, to the front desk, everyone is smiling and sincere. I have no hesitation recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and stay”
Reviews.Author: lorderps
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for two nights and was very pleased. Upon arrival, the lobby seemed clean and nice. The staff was quite friendly, from the front desk to the valet/bellhops. They were all helpful with answering any questions we had about the hotel or area. Our room had an amazing view (located on the 45th floor) of the city and Lake Ontario! Our room and bathroom were very clean and spacious and the bed was comfortable. No free internet in the rooms, but we used the free wi-fi in the lobby anytime we needed to which was not a problem. The hotel was close and within walking distance to all the major sites we wanted to visit: CN Tower, Hockey Hall of Fame, Eaton Center, etc. A few cons included: no hooks anywhere for wet towels or to hang anything else on, seemed to be able to hear a lot out in the hallway at nighttime (this could have been due to our room being near the elevator), and parking costs $30/night. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Customer comes last”
Reviews.Author: mckravmaga
Reviews.Content: One King West is ideally located in Toronto. Our room was initially clean and well laid out. Several problems did crop up though. The daily room cleaning was not well done, and there were several delays or omissions when service was requested for our room. My main concern, however, was how the hotel responded to a problem that the hotel created. During our stay, on one of the days, there were 2 false alarms. One was in the morning, and the other was very late at night (actually early AM), totally disrupting our sleep that night. The alarm and frequent accompanying announcements via the room speaker persisted both times about 30 min to 45 min. Each time, we were to stay in our room, and the elevators were disabled. Fair enough. These things happen. But remember, this was due to a recurrent false alarm. In any case, this is a supposedly quality hotel. When I asked about an adjustment for the loss of a night's sleep, I was treated like a disposable commodity. I spoke with the Office Manager (Lazara Rouco) who's main job seemed to be to defend the fact that it was inappropriate to make any kind of adjustment in the cost for that day of highly disrupted sleep, and how this false alarm was due to the fact that the hotel had my safety in mind. I have stayed in many high quality hotels, in fact I prefer them and willingly pay the increased price to do so. I do expect quality service and consideration in exchange. I do not feel that One King West is sufficiently customer focused - as evidenced by my experience and interaction with hotel management. It is for this reason that I would look elsewhere for a quality hotel experience in Toronto. There are other fine, well located hotels that should fit the bill!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - great rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: WLTM_Adventure
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in November for a couple of nights with a friend. The rooms were large and comfortable with a great view (from a high floor). The staff were helpful and courteous, particularly the concierge. The location is great it's easy to get around from here. The suite had great facilites, including a washing machine. I can't find fault with my stay there, had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Horatio07
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the corner on King and Yonge, which puts in within walking distance of the CN Tower, Eaton Centre, etc. Our room was the basic suite, which had a king size bed and a kitchenette. The room was a good size and from the 38th floor had a nice view up Yonge Street. I think people mistakenly believe that because the rooms are called â€œsuitesâ€� that they are getting something the size of an apartment, which they are not. That being said, basic suite is still one of the bigger hotel rooms I have stayed in and I have no complaints about the size. The kitchenette had a 2-burner stove, bar fridge, microwave, coffee maker, dishes, and cutlery. It also included a dishwasher, washer, and dryer which are all hidden in the kitchen cabinets. Dishwasher and laundry detergent are not provided, but we brought our own. The bathroom was lacking in counter space and had a standup shower. Valet parking is $30 a day and has in-out privileges (tip: the entrance to the parking is on Wellington Street). The front desk staff and valets were very friendly and efficient. Checking in and out was quick, and the car was usually brought up within a couple of minutes. Everything was great at this hotel, I plan to stay here again the next time I am in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ellie_the_tiger
Reviews.Content: Was a bit worried before travelling after reading a couple of these reviews, but we found the hotel to be fine. No problems with hotel staff. Was a little disappointed with the room size, as we had upgraded to a superior suite, but this seemed like a regular suite. The room was large and clean, with a useful kitchen area and bathroom with small bath and separate shower cubicle. Bed was king size and comfy. We were on the 7th floor, and there is currently road works outside which started every morning at 7am. Didn't bother us too much, as we were waking up early anyway still being on UK time. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city as the location is great. Walking distance to everything. Head to St Lawrence market for breakfast or lunch, and the restaurants in that area are great too.

Reviews.Title: “One King West - Two Happy Guests”
Reviews.Author: NekoCat
Reviews.Content: I booked a Superior Suite with a king size bed (Orbitz) and the rate was $160 USD for 1 night. We arrived at 1 King West around 1:30 and got right into our room. The room was huge! I had no idea it was going to be its own mini apartment. There was a stove, dishwasher, fridge, toaster, microwave, washing machine and dryer. We only stayed one night, so used none of these things, but the room was very nice. Considering how large the room was, the bathroom was a bit small, but completely adequate. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet. The location is perfect for visiting Toronto and is walking distance to the Rogers Center, CN Tower, Distillery District, waterfront, etc. The subway entrance is right across from the hotel which comes in handy. The parking is a bit expensive at $30.00 CAD per night (plus valet tip). You are definitely paying for convenience. There are parking lots all over the city so if you want to shop around and don't mind carrying your luggage, there can be a savings. Especially if you are there on the weekend. We took our car out after one night and parked for $7.00 CAD the flat rate for Saturday right nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Aliceesjan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night to explore Toronto. We had a great stay, the room was perfect and big, the lobby and bar was nice, the location was excellent. Would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to stay in Toronto to visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and lovely views”
Reviews.Author: norm1cumb
Reviews.Content: Chose the 47th floor and the views over the old town and the bay were amazing from our large bay window. All the staff were very helpful and the gowns delivered to our room were lovely. Could have used soap in the bathroom on the first 2 days but it appeared on the 3rd. Very handy for all local amenities and access to PATH from hallway.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE ! Bait and Switch hotel - I agree with others that Suites at 1 King West should be avoided”
Reviews.Author: Poetryprofessor
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was somewhat hesitant about booking a suite at 1 king west suites. However I wanted to be right downtown for a get together with old friends and the location seemed perfect. The disappointment started right away. Room that they gave us although it was supposed to be a "luxury suite" was a very very tiny room with no view and a double (and VERY uncomfortable bed). I voiced my concerns to front desk but was brushed off and was told that they were sold out and that's it. Everyone should think twice before reserving anything there. This place is a BAIT ans SWITCH!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for our perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Kingdingruairi
Reviews.Content: Although we stayed last september, we still remember our stay in toronto and especially Suites on 1st. Its a perfect location to explore the city and with most major attractions within 10mins walk which was great or if you don't feel like walking well step outside into the street and catch one of the many trams and buses that pass-by or simply head down the stairs into the hotels own entrance to the subway station. If you are like my wife and I, who walked non-stop everyday there was nothing bettter than to come back to the hotel have a glass of wine, relax and head to our suite, where we'd sink into the comfy bed and fall fast asleep. I would recommend this hotel highly and hope to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located hotel apartments”
Reviews.Author: ClaireyA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of May. It could not be better located, we walked practically everywhere and when we wanted to go a bit further just hopped on the subway, which was next door to the hotel. We were located on the 26th floor and had a view of the CN Tower. The rooms were well equipped, clean and quiet. We'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Suites & GREAT Location”
Reviews.Author: soulparis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Suites at 1 King West & was very surprised with the Good Service I've received from the Front Desk. I was Up graded to a very nice suite without any hesitations. The first room was not as pleasant, it had a Murphy Bed that was Not Very Comfortable & really was Not what I expected from The Photos of the Room I booked on their Website. Well, the second Room had an Air Con problem, it was working. They send some one to try to fix it, the room just stayed warm. So I went back down to the Lobby & spoke to one of the Female Front Desk Clerk & again, without hesitation she put me at a Higher Floor Suite(40th) with a very nice view & a working Air Con. The Hotel is Right where the King Subway Station's Located (right outside the Entrance) I find the Staff very Helpful & Great Suites at a very Reasonable Deal. I really enjoyed staying there I'll definitely be Back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: awsomelight
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Suites in March and had a great experience as far as our room was concerned it was an enormous room with comfy chairs and a couch, big windows with great views of the lake. This June 13-14 was totally opposite, we reserved 2 rooms a month in advance with special request for high floor with views of Lake Ontario, we explained to the reservation staff that we loved our stay in March and we wanted the same quallity . We wanted it to be special for our friends from England, we intended to take in some theatre , Toronto Island, and nice dinners on King St at the great selection of fine restaraunts. When we arrived at the hotel and received our rooms we were very disappointed, the rooms were both very small with minimal seating for two. Only one of the rooms had a sliver view of the lake. When we asked guest services to please make this right they said that the hotel was sold out of this quallity of room, the could only offer less on lower floors. I was told of there policy in giving out the rooms, and cancellation will not allow you to go to another hotel, because you still have to pay for these rooms unless you cancel 2 days in advance even though it is not remotely close to what we reserved in the first place. The room was tastefully decorated with quallity appliances, the bed was small only a double and not a pillow top King like the rooms we wanted to reserve. I have seen houses with walk in closets the size of these rooms.The problem I see is that these rooms have been classified as high floor luxury suites and that is far from the truth. In the end we were offered a complimentary breakfast or 10% of the total, after a great deal of stressful conversation. We found the whole situation disappointing and embarrassing on various levels. I feel reservations should be reservations, not we will see what we have left when you show up. I do not reccommend this hotel to anyone that needs anything more than just a last minute place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Shandy07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the end of May. Check in was quick and easy, our room was clean, comfortable, and had more than adequate amenities. We loved that we were walking distance to the hockey hall of fame, CN tower, Rogers Center, Eaton Center, St. Lawrence Market, the waterfront, and many restaurants and shops. My only complaint was the noise level from the hallways. We were on the 7th floor, away from the elevator. Everytime someone walked by talking, it sounded like they were right in the room with us, and I was woken up a few times because of the noise. There is very poor insulation in the walls, but this may be because we were in the older section of the building. Other than that, we really liked this hotel, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing Room”
Reviews.Author: Toptotoetan
Reviews.Content: Two rooms were booked months in advance by our Canadian friends who had stayed there previously,and wanted us to experience the wonderful views that they had on their initial visit,rooms close together and at a high level were requested when the advance reservations were made,what we got was exactly the opposite we were in 1801 they in 1812, opposite ends of the floor,they had a partial view of the lake we had a view of the building across the street. The room was a rather strange narrow elongated shape with windows at on end and an opaque window at the other end behind the TV. It was so dark, the lights had to be turned on in daytime. The room was not particularly comfortable having a laminate type floor covering and minimal furniture,it did however contain a washing machine,tumble dryer,microwave,and refrigerator.none of which we used for the two nights we stayed. On checking out we complained to the duty manager and he was gracious enough to give a 10% discount off our bills the original cost being C$220.00 per room per night. A lot of money for a bed for the night!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Logan780
