Reviews.Content: I just spent four nights at the Suite at 1 King West. I was impressed with most everything in the hotel. Check-in was quick and painless and the staff was, for the most part, very friendly. I was pleasantly surprised when I got to my room to find that it was a very good size with excellent amenities including the kitchenette with a washer, dryer and dishwasher. The washer/dryer was welcome after ten days of travelling and was very efficient. Room service was very efficient and quick. The hotel was centrally located to shopping and theatres. Because I had booked four nights I also got a good rate compared to the regular rates The only complaint I had during my trip was the service at the restaurant the one evening I stopped there for a late afternoon meal. I seated myself (as I was instructed) and then waited for at least 10 minutes at which time I left as no one had even acknowledged that I was there. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, Elegant Hotel in an Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: LaBella_NYC
Reviews.Content: I just came back from visiting my boyfriend in Toronto this weekend and we stayed at the Suites at 1 King West. Our check-in was effortless (although do note that the hotel will hold anywhere from $100-200 CAN on your credit card for incidentals, so be prepared), and we were immediately upgraded from a Studio Suite to a Superior Suite at no extra charge. The hotel was even gracious enough to give us a delayed check-out. Our room was beautiful, modern and roomy. Our bathroom had both a shower and seperate sunken bathtub. There are also great amenities from Bath & Body Works. The hotel also has a very nice fitness area complete with whirpool and a very nice indoor hottub. Oh, and the location couldn't be better! You're right in the middle of downtown, across from a Starbuck's and a great restauarant called Beerbistro, which I highly recommend! All in all, an amazing stay at a great price. You won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury boutique hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: cici-la
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia.ca and got a great deal since I opted for the non-refundable price. One of the few negative things we can say about this hotel is arriving in a car. There is a valet service but the front of the hotel is very small and would not be able to accommodate more than 4 cars arriving at the same time. The front entrance is also located in a side street off of Yonge that looks a little like a large alleyway. We drove a pretty large vehicle and were not sure where to park it while we checked in (no valets apparent) so we parked on the street and walked in. We were told that we needed to speak with the valet desk to get the car parked. It would cost $30/night, but we were told to park ourselves somewhere else since our vehicle was too large. Whatever, it saved us $16, so I recommend parking in the building next door since it's waaaay cheaper to do that on a weekend. The cashier was very nice and genuinely hoped we had a good stay. We wanted a late checkout time but it was hotel policy that they charge us so we had to be out of there at noon (not her fault). The room was really nice with the correct size bed that we requested. Clean linens and overall very clean room. The only drawback was all the glasses (both wine and rocks glasses) had to be rinsed and wiped before using since they had a small layer of dust on them. The freezer in the refrigerator wasn't working since the ice cream we brought melted overnight. Noise from nearby Yonge street was present, but not at a level that would keep us from sleeping. Overall, nice hotel boutique hotel that just needs a couple of tweeks. I would not pay full price for a room here though. Save that money for the Fairmont Royal York.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great views, great location.”
Reviews.Author: GreenwichUK
Reviews.Content: We were in the hotel for 4 nights for a family trip including a wedding. 2 x adults plus 2 x kids. The staff are completely fabulous. The location is unsurpassable - it is possible to walk to the harbour, CN tower, baseball games, shopping and has lots of restaurants and eating places nearby. The reservations, on hearing my UK accent, offered to book us into a room with a view and as this was 2 months before the trip I wasn't sure it would happen. But yes, we had rooms on the 46th floor - amazing views. The facilities are really comprehensive in the rooms. If i have a criticism it is that the bedroom was a little small, with nowhere to put clothes - only one small wardrobe. There are shelves outside of the room. We requested a roll away as we had one of the kids on the sofa bed and needed a 2nd bed - this was supplied no problem but was tricky to fit into the space. The general decor is fine - not special, not perfect but in a way with kids made it feel more homely! Having said that we would definitely book again. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay......loved it”
Reviews.Author: andreabarton1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at the suites may 10-13.......this hotel is awesome. i had recently stayed at the westin harbour hotel about a year ago and thought it was great until i stayed here... the westin is so far from everything and separated from the city by their major highway. Im assuming we got upgraded because our room (502) had a small patio outside which was awesome. My only complaint would be the lack of restaurants around the area ..we did visit the richtree down the street one night but we were in the mood to get served and this is more buffet style. And the diner Over Easy, which is real close for breakfast, is terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Michael01UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the 1KW suites on business, once in Feb-09 and the other time in Oct-07. These suites are just beatiful, with all of the amenities, inside the heart of the financial district and adjacent to the subway at King Street. I am a Torontotonian by birth and am therefore naturally sceptical of all hotels in my original home town. But this hotel did not disappoint, The suites are new, with fully renovated bathrooms, a nice buffet breakfast is available and very good concierge service, at all hours. The rate of something like $199 (Canadian) was unbeatable for a hotel in this location and of this standard. Beats large chain hotels like the Westin or Hilton and is a better location. Highly recommended for business travellers, although families could stay there too given proximity to Air Canada centre (hockey, basketball), Rogers Centre (baseball) and the club district a half a mile away on King Street or the distillery district at Sherbourne. One drawback is the elevators: very slow. But that is it. Enjoy your stay here; I certainly did.

Reviews.Title: “Suites at 1 King West - The Good, The Bad and The Ugly!”
Reviews.Author: Alleycat1820
Reviews.Content: This review will be broken down into three sections - The Good, The Bad and The Ugly of the Suites at 1 King West. Last month we set out for a romantic coupleâ€™s weekend in Toronto and decided to stay at the Suites at 1 King West. THE GOOD The location of this hotel is great for walking to nice restaurants, shopping and attractions. The view of the room we had was pretty impressive as you could see Lake Ontario and the skyscrapers of the financial district and beyond. The kitchenette is a nice touch with dishwasher, washer/dryer, dishes and utensils. Room service was quick and tasty. The bell staff was very nice and accommodating. THE BAD The room was a bit on the small side although the layout made the most of the space. The bed was small but more importantly â€“ the linens were a disgrace. There were holes in the bed skirt, the pillows and mattress was uncomfortable. The hotel could easily raise its profile by investing in this area and dressing the bed to look more luxurious and inviting with a better duvet and decorative pillows. The bathroom was pretty small, the tub could be larger but it does serve its purpose. The shower needs improvement in terms of the water pressure and two small aesthetic changes: install a rain shower head and upgrade the curtain to something better or a glass door. THE UGLY There are a lot of great deals on right now at Toronto hotels and since this hotel is downtown as well as close to the club district the Suites unfortunately drew a rowdy group of young people on the Saturday night of our stay. They started their noise early with the drinking before the club and returned after 3 am even louder and more obnoxious with yelling and door slamming while other people were trying to sleep. It took 2 hours and 2 calls to security to get them to finally shut up. This comment does not reflect on the hotel itself, it is more directed toward the clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent rooms”
Reviews.Author: kristopherowens
Reviews.Content: One King West is in a great location. As the name implies, it is at King and Yonge Streets. For someone new to the city, this is a great base to explore the waterfront, the CN Tower area, the Old Town, and the shopping that Toronto has to offer. The area is safe and clean. It's a little quiet at night as mostly business people occupy the area during the day. But there are no shortage of pubs and restaurants within 5 minutes walk. The hotel is also directly connected to the miles of underground shopping that Toronto has. Very convenient for a quick trip to the drug store without going outside. There is a new part of the hotel which is the tower, and an older part. The rooms in the older part seem to be be different from each other. Inconsistent amenities and what not. Some of our group was in a room with a fireplace and an interior window, and our room had no fireplace but a great view of Yonge street (I watched the Christmas parade from my window). Overall, clean, great bed, nice area, and good hotel services.

Reviews.Title: “A Home from Home!”
Reviews.Author: Marie C
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel! We like 4 or 5* hotels and are pretty fussy by nature of the amount of world travel we have done, this hotel qualifies for us but is so not "up itself"! Its so friendly and pleasantly decorated. The staff are great. We stayed in the old part of the hotel first visit then for the second they put us in the new tower thinking we would prefer it but I dont do heights so they moved us straight away! We could sit at the bar for hours its just so comfortable. My hubby has stayed there on business too its so handy for everything especially the theatres. You could actually "live there" it has a washing machine, dryer, little kitchen fridge, hob. You can bring your own food and wine in to save the pennies!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff - Good room rates just be aware of parking and other extra charges...”
Reviews.Author: MandyLee_7
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this great hotel numerous times for business and pleasure and am never disappointed with the level of service from the superb staff. I was surprised at $40/night valet parking, as it seems it was much less during my last stay. The daily wired internet connection charge seems a bit pricy when many other downtown hotels offer free wireless. As we were staying in the city for post-operative surgical recovery before a long drive home, it would've been nice if the hotel still offered private car service but the valet was very helpful in arranging a cab.

Reviews.Title: “What an awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stu-baby
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night in September, '07, having attended Toronto to see Rush at the Air Canada Center. This hotel is within easy walking distance to the ACC and within easy walking distance to the lower end of Toronto and shopping district. It is within an easy drive to most Toronto locations. This hotel had only recently been refurbished from my understanding and was awesome. Our room was fantastic. One of, if not, the best hotels i've ever stayed in. I look forward to getting back to Toronto and in particular, staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: novelty-traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 1 King West for 3 nights, which we booked on the internet. It's a very nice hotel in the centre of the city. The room was on the upper floor with views to the river and city. Its easy walking distance to the theatre district, shops and the Eaton Centre. The subway entrance was outside the hotel which was great during the middle of winter. The room was really large and heating was adequate. the rate was reasonable for a city hotel. Overall a great stay and will be back again when we return to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_WalnutCreek
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel late (11:30pm) on a cold February night. The bar was full, and there was plenty go on. The staff was very friendly and my room in the old tower exceeded my expectations. The king bed was very comfortable. I didnâ€™t use the roomâ€™s kitchen. The free wireless from another hotel was a bit slow. This hotel C$10/day for wireless was not any better. The room was large and had an internal (not wall unit) heater that was quite. Starbucks was just across the street for breakfast. The bathroom was very small, but clean. The kitchen included under-counter washer and dryer. I would definitely stay here again. Check out the old Bank Vault downstairs.- Watch for C$40/night for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great views at the heart of the action”
Reviews.Author: roomtoview
Reviews.Content: Terrific views of Toronto are offered from the upper floors of the Suites at 1 King West. The tall window views almost make you dizzy when you stand next to them. Three impressions from big to minor are to be shared. 1. We arrived exhausted after an early morning flight to Toronto and when we attempted to check our bags in for safe keeping for the morning we were actually invited to check in early! When was the last time that you were spontaneously checked into a hotel at 8:30 am on the day of your arrival at no extra cost? 2. How often does a hotel include a connector for the TV so that you could plug in your own electronic device to watch your own dvds etc without paying the usual high price at most mainstream hotels? The Suites at 1 King West does. 3. The final small thing that impressed me was the large print conditioner and shampoo bottles so that you can read the label in the shower without your reading glasses on! I just wish that the bottles I use at home were as easy to read. Rental car locations are just a short walk away. Somehow we managed to purchase the room through Expedia when the hotel website indicated it was sold out. The rate was high due to the Toronto International Film Festival. In summary; if you want a nearly floor to high ceiling view, great location and a thoughtful hotel look no further.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: MapleCanoe
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at this hotel. What brings us back? Cleanliness, location (max 10 minute walk to Air Canada Centre, Rogers Centre, Union Station, Historic District), friendliness, quality of room, and price. Also, the concierge is really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Cold, Uncomfortable, Mediocre Service, But Good If You Need a Washer”
Reviews.Author: OffTheBeatenPath
Reviews.Content: The Suites at 1 King West is an adequate but not plush business hotel. A number of issues, taken together, made it less than comfortable. Given the number of preferable options in Toronto, I am not likely to return, nor would I recommend this hotel to others. For someone needing to stay a week or more, the concept might be attractive. The rooms come with a small kitchen, dishwasher, and washer and dryer. I didnâ€™t use any of these, but they appeared to be in working order. The room itself was reasonably well decorated, although small for a suite. A small desk was provided, with a wired internet connection for $9.99 a day. The bathroom was nothing outstanding â€“ no bathtub, just a shower with weak water pressure. The tower I was in seemed old, even though the room had been redecorated; this was most evident in the roomâ€™s insulation and heating / fan. A colleague told me he had stayed in the hotelâ€™s other tower before, and been impressed with the room, but that his room on the 45th floor in my tower during this stay was much shabbier. None of my three colleagues liked their rooms during this stay. Negatives to consider before booking: â€¢ The floor to ceiling windows in my room let in a lot of cold air and noise from the wind (it was December, but not particularly cold or windy). â€¢ The fan on the heater / air conditioner was extremely noisy, to the point that it woke me up several times each the night when it came on. Because the windows let in so much cold air, the heater needed to run most of the night. â€¢ The bed was very firm, which I found uncomfortable. â€¢ I was supposed to be in a non-smoking room. While my room (1602) itself had been heavily perfumed, the hallway outside my room reeked of cigarette smoke. â€¢ The water pressure in the shower was weak â€“ I couldnâ€™t get the shampoo and conditioner fully out of my hair. â€¢ The hotel does not stock the same toiletries other hotels do. A colleague had forgotten his mini toothpaste. At most business hotels, you can get a free mini toothpaste at the front desk if youâ€™ve forgotten yours. At the Suites at 1 King West, they directed my colleague to the Shoppers store across the street to buy toothpaste. â€¢ The room next door had put out room service trays for pickup before I arrived in the late afternoon. The next morning, they were still there. The next afternoon, still there. Two days later when I checked out, they were still sitting out in the hallway with the food & beer drying up on them. That was pretty disgusting. All in all, for the money you can find a better business hotel with more accommodating service in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good solid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SigKelowna
Reviews.Content: Over all this is a great hotel and was as good as we were expecting. It is rated as a 4 star and is generally that but may fall short on the TV and the halls to the rooms. However the bed was great and the little kitchen was excellent.. The location is right on the subway, near Union Station and clsoe to most downtown attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ia3020
Reviews.Content: My first stay here and I cant wait to stay here again! The room was magnificent! High ceilings, view of downtown...We stayed on the 8th floor.......Staff was great and friendly! Room had useful appliances such as tea kettle, microwave......also had washer dryer and dishwasher. Fabulous hotel, definately recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great service, great price.”
Reviews.Author: Winnipeg_Dave
Reviews.Content: We booked a studio suite for 3 nights over a weekend with an average price of $215. We stayed on the 8th floor in the â€œold sectionâ€� which didnâ€™t provide for a nice view of the city but was certainly adequate and quiet. We had no problems at all on the trip and had good help and service from the staff as required. There is a self-serve restaurant two blocks south of the hotel called Richtree Market. I had breakfast there on the last day regretting that I had missed the previous two days! Lovely place with an enormous selection of great food throughout the day. Look it up on the â€˜net. The Studio Suite was a good size with dishwasher, washer, dryer, iron and board, hot plate, coffee maker, and a good sized fridge. Cutlery, glasses, etc too. The bed was very comfortable (which is a true compliment as I have become something of a princess in my advancing yearsâ€¦) and the room was clean. Friendly people at the lobby bar who gave us some good tips on nightlife in the evenings. The Valet folks were helpful with pointers for the subway and other minor travel help. The only downside was the expensive internet access in the lobby. Although they have three computers available, at 50 cents per minute, taking a few minites to check email each day starts to add up! They should consider dropping the cost by half or perhaps making it entirely free. Next time Iâ€™m in Toronto Iâ€™ll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Up in the clouds”
Reviews.Author: ZandaSpain
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Suite 3107 was very comfortable and had a good kitchen and washer/dryer too. Great views over the Lake and Islands. Staff were efficient and friendly. We found lots of good restaurants nearby and with the PATH system available from the basement of the hotel we could walk anywhere and lots of food courts were available. Got a good discount and upgrade from the hotel when I booked it, and we will be going back again in 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: AlFalkirk
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the suites ( stayed for 10 days Sep 07). This time we were upgraded to a suite on the 46th floor with 270 degree view of TO - Fantastic! As a base for visiting TO it cannot be beaten - direct access to PATH and fall out the door to subway or streetcar. Suites are very well equiped - washer and dryer a boon. One very slight gripe - lack of hanging space. Staff are very unobtrusive yet friendly and efficient when required Tuesday to Sat do yourself a favour and walk to St Lawrence market for the best bacon roll in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Felt Right at Home”
Reviews.Author: RicknvalVictoria
Reviews.Content: After a six month stay in Europe it was great to get back to Canada and we felt right at home here though we live on the West Coast. Staff were friendly and efficient and we really needed time on the free high speed internet. Our suite was cheaper than most but had all we needed,,including a washer and dryer! The location is suberb for the tasks we had to do and we walked right to the train station!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, affordable place.”
Reviews.Author: Pakk
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed four nights at 1 King west during our stay in Toronto recently. As we arrived we asked for a high floor and was told all rooms at higher floor was occupied but we could change to a higher the following day. The first room we got was on the 7th floor with no view. The room however was very large, had two tvs, bathtub, sofa and additional seating. The second day we moved to the 45th floor with a great view but no bathtub and "only" one tv. From the window we could see both the city, Lake Ontario and cities far in the distance, so the missing additional tv was not causing any larger depression. We also used the free wireless internet in the lobby and had both dinner and breakfast at the restaurant. The food actually was very good, breakfast was a little pricey, but you had a lot to choose from at the buffet. The hotel is also situated in the very center of Toronto and you can reach the harbour, CN-Tower and Eaton centre in at most 10-15 minutes. I will probably stay here next time in Toronto as well, the reason I won't give it a five star rating is that it could have had for instance lcd-tv, a little better cleaning and a few more things to make it top class. But the Hotel is great, no question about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: debaser_79
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop in trip from Toronto to New York. The hotel was in a great location to stroll to shops, restaurants and most attractions. There is also a subway right outside. After our long flight from the UK we found the Suites to be very clean, comfortable and well furnished, and the room was bigger than expected. The bed was very comfy! There is a great gym on the 12th floor, which has a great view of the city. Didn't try the jacuzzis, but they looked good! Didn't try the food in the hotel either, but there are plenty of restaurants nearby (can particularly recommend Over Easy for breakfast, great staff and food!) A few minor niggles, staff could be friendlier (with the exception of the concierge who was great) as we found them to be slightly aloof, no wi-fi in rooms, which we would expect for the calibre of hotel and seems to be standard even for hotels of a lower rating. We were on the 6th floor in the historic section and experienced some road noise as other reviewers have commented on. All in all, we would recommend this hotel as a great base for Toronto. We found it was well priced given the location, but would strongly recommend requesting a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: podirish
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in are great location, theres a subway right under the hotel, the cn tower is about 10 15 min walk, theres loads or great restaurants nearby, the hotel is v clean , the onlt problem was the vault bar does not open up, its onlt opens for big group bookings. if i were to go back tp toronto this is where i would stay

Reviews.Title: “Who needs the CN Tower ...”
Reviews.Author: bellbuoy
Reviews.Content: ... when they can stay at Suites at 1 King West?! We had a suite on the 40th floor. The view was so spectacular that we did not bother going up the CN Tower, though this supposedly is one of THE tourist things to do in Toronto. The hotel's downtown location makes it easy to get everywhere, the staff was very friendly and the suite was clean, spacious and had a washing machine we were happy to use. Unfortunately the hotel does not provide free WiFi. You have to pay 9 Dollars for a day's access. Not an enormous amount of money, but still it is strange as so many cheaper hotels do provide internet access for free. We booked via the city of Toronto's tourism website and got a very good rate, by the way.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central”
Reviews.Author: BettyBoopClaire
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week in Toronto. My Husband,s surprise 50th celebrations.Stayed in Hotel One King WEst. Would recommend it to others. Very Central to all, good clean hotel, lovely view of city as we were on 39th floor. Just one problem, bathroom is small and I mean small.Each room has a little kitchnette so if u are on a budget you can do your own food.Do go for breakfast at "Eggspectication" on Younge st, 2min walk from hotel. Fantastic food. We are a couple from Ireland who likes a lot of walking and Toronto has a lot of walking to offer. It is not a cheap city, we found the prices are similar to a city here in Ireland, and Ireland is the most expenisve country in Europe at the moment. Do go see Nigara Falls. We flew with Globespan and were very nice to fly with. Looking forward to my next trip to Canada already.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: partick
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Suites for eight nights at the end of August . Everything about the hotel from its location through the comfort and cleanliness of the suites to the friendly and helpful staff was absolutely excellent. We payed an average of $169 plus taxes a night and thought it was worth every penny. Suites at 1 King West will be our automatic choice of hotel in Toronto from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great base in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Giltmirrors
Reviews.Content: Due to the keen price for this hotel, we were pleasantly surprised once we entered the majestic foyer, and even more pleased when we saw our room. This place is excellent for travellers. The rooms are v well appointed, the bed v comfortable and big, and extras provided are second to none. We had been travelling for a few days, and were delighted to be able to use the washing machine and dryer provided before we continued on the second part of our journey. The view from the room was fantastic. We asked for a lake view on a high up floor The Business facilities provided are v good - free internet access - always a great bonus. The bar is fine - good cocktails and barfood, but maybe a couple of dubious local characters there touting for some afterhours business. The area itself is close to the harbourfront, but we would recommend going to Yorkville for the atmosphere and the restaurants All in all, you can't go wrong if you stay here

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with service, room, location and price.”
Reviews.Author: Karen B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a fabulous experience at the Hotel, the rooms were clean, spacious, modern,quiet and very well equipped. We found the hotel the perfect location and centrally located within walking distance from all the attractions we had planned to attend. The staff was helpfull and friendly and always ready to help with a friendly smile.. As for price, you could not find a better hotel in such a good location at this price in Vancouver thats for sure.We have travelled from coast to coast in this country and this hotel gave us by far the best bang for our buck with highest quailty service. We will be staying there again on our next visit to Toronto for sure. Karen and Peter Williams Lake B.C.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view â€¦ and a dishwasher”
Reviews.Author: BostonDaveL
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Toronto for a six-night visit after spending four nights in four different towns heading west from Boston. The Suites at One King West was a great place to unpack and stay for a while. We were elated to find a washer and dryer in the room, which saved us an unpleasant trip to a Laundromat. Other conveniences include a refrigerator, sink, two-burner stove, microwave oven, DVD player, and dishwasher. Add to that a 180-degree view overlooking Lake Ontario, a comfortable bed, large marble bathroom, couch, coffee table, and desk area and youâ€™ve got yourself a pretty great hotel room. (We were in suite 2410, which was at the end of the hall on the south side of the building â€“ the best location on each floor, I think.) The general hotel amenities were good, but not quite as awe-inspiring. There is free wireless Internet access, but only in the lobby. Wired access in the room costs $10 a day. Valet parking costs $40 a day. We chose to put our car in a garage a block away for $28 a day instead. The hotel lobby is very nicely appointed, but for some reason the area on the ground floor where you wait for the elevator is very plain and a little dingy in comparison. Front desk and concierge staff were very helpful, although for some reason the check-in process took several minutes longer than I would have expected. (But if they were spending that extra time upgrading us to a better room, it was worth the wait.) The location of the hotel could hardly be better. All the major attractions and neighborhoods of Toronto are within walking distance, and the subway and light rail are right outside the front door. You can stock up on breakfast food to eat in your room at the drug store across the street. A luxury hotel room like this does not come cheap. We paid CN$229 plus taxes per night. But I think it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday yet”
Reviews.Author: anjoola
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week in june and had an excellent time. The hotel was huge and so was our room. We were only on the 5th floor but the room definately did not disappoint us. The bed was extremly comfy and the room had air conditioning and heating. In the bathroom they supplied you with toiletries. The hotel is in an ideal location and linked to the PATH. Free internet which was fantastic. The staff were very friendly and approachable and so was all the people we met there. We enjoyed our stay so much that we booked up to come back to Canada in August for another week to the exact same hotel. Best holiday i have ever had and don't think anything can beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Left Feeling Like a Victim”
Reviews.Author: JollioPeppers
Reviews.Content: I should have taken it as a sign of things to come. From the beginning service was slow and poorly organized: Our room was ready, and then it wasn't. I had made a deposit, then records showed I hadn't. The fridge in our room had defrosted and water had leaked all over the place. I overlooked these minor things as it was a nice enough place to stay on a group rate. Then I left the hotel and realized the valet (which you are forced to park with) had damaged my car. When this was brought to the attention of the staff and management they did everything in their power to squirm out of having to take responsibility. I felt betrayed, ripped-off and more furious than I'd been in years (not to mention left with a $800 repair bill I have to pay out of pocket). I ask that you choose another of Toronto's fine hotels. Not only because I would love them to lose business as a sort of karmic retribution, but because for the money, you can do a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lassieshropshire
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. I stayed for 3nights in early July with my husband and 2 teenage sons sharing 1 room. Plenty of space, 2 TVs, Very clean. Nice bar area. Frendly staff and good position. For the money it is hard to fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Great midweek deal, a few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: maryvale
Reviews.Content: We got a great midweek deal through a Web site ($140 a night), and my boyfriend had stayed here before and loved it. The location was perfect -- right next to a subway -- and I thought it had a good atmosphere. Drinks at the hotel bar one night were uneventful, despite listening to the staff gossip and flirt with each other. We had just a few problems. 1) The AC didn't cool the room to the temperature we dialed in. (68 and still so hot in the night!) 2) I called down one day and asked for two extra towels and they never arrived, even though the woman who answered the phone noted that she was "writing it down." (How about just bring them instead of making a note of it?) I called again for the towels the next morning, and it still took 25 minutes or so for them to come upstairs. 3) The internet situation is a little backwards. There's ethernet cables upstairs, in the rooms, for which you pay $10 a day, plus taxes, but there's free wi-fi in the lobby. Huh? I want wi-fi for my mobile devices in the room. Other than these fairly minor complaints, we liked our stay, and thought the room amenities -- washer and dryer, dishwasher -- were very, very cool.

Reviews.Title: “No hot water. Dirty rooms and Unhappy staff. Need I say more ?”
Reviews.Author: Demonsfan
Reviews.Content: I was in TO for a few days and decided to try 1 King because of their location. I guess I should have read the reviews first. Their staff is very unpleasant if not rude when I arrived. Every day that I stayed there I had not seen a smile. Maybe they don`t pay their staff well. The ``suites`` are really dingy and unclean very small bachelor apartments. I found dirt under the bed and in the bathroom - it was disgusting. They also seem to have a HUGE PROBLEM with hot water which worked intermittently and one day did not work at all. I would NEVER STAY THERE again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: jkkras
Reviews.Content: I am originally from Toronto and was coming back to visit and show my hometown from 15 years ago to my fiance (yes, I left a long time ago). We spent some time at my relatives but wanted at least one night to ourselves, and we wanted to be close to the theatres as we had a show that night. One of my relatives recommended this hotel to me. The hotel was great. Everything went along and worked without any problems and the staff were very friendly and efficient. The suite was quite large and had a great view over part of the lake and city - very impressive at night. The room was fully equipped and the kitchen was handy to have. The location is what it is - great! - and you connect directly to the subway. As an added bonus, they were filming a depression-era period movie the next Morning just outside, so it was fun to see all the extras and props on the street. Great experience and the fiance loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Everything it is Cranked Up to Be!”
Reviews.Author: Ash-in-NYC
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! First time -- even though I did not require or use them -- I have EVER had a dishwasher, clothes washer and dryer in a hotel room (in addition to fridge, microwave, etc.). The room itself was very tastefully decorated and comfortable. I was on the 28th floor and enjoyed a lovely view of the Toronto's bristling skyline. I am a 68-year-old bachelor and a bit fussy. If I had had a bathtub -- in combination with or in addition to -- the shower in the bathroom, I would have been in heaven. I happen to prefer a tub or tub-shower combination to a shower. But it was a very nice shower. This hotel was everything the reviews said it would be and perhaps a bit more. It is centrally located (I walked from the train station to the hotel which was only two or three blocks away) and right near a metro station and lots of places to shop and eat. Toronto has an extensive underground shopping and dining mall. One can enter it directly from the lobby of the hotel. There is a suana, exercise room and pool, but since my visit was so short (3 days), I did not use them (but I did check them out). There was also free internet service on three computers in the lobby. I only had one meal in the hotel (room service is available): breakfast in its lobby. It was a lovely buffet with hot and cold selections, but (for me) slightly overpriced at aproximately US$20. Especially, when one can step out of the door or go down to the underground mall and find something much cheaper. The staff was polite and helpful. And my room was as silent as tomb. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful experience for us...”
Reviews.Author: cdourz
Reviews.Content: I was shocked at the rudeness we experienced at this hotel. We'd booked our stay as "extended stay" guests, as we stayed for a whole month at this property. The sales rep, Jonathan, was very polite and professional, but I guess he was an exception at this hotel! On our first day, the AC did'nt work. The AC technician came up to check it out and told my husband offhandedly that he should actually put the temprature up (?????) We did...did'nt work....we call them the next day, and are told by another technician that we need to put the temperature down! We tried it all...up, down, it did'nt work. The first technician came up and spoke to me with his back facing me throughout, eventhough he was'nt working on the AC! We were finally moved to another suite, and the AC worked fine, but we had no hot water when we got back to the hotel in the evening....it carried on for 4 days before they found a permanent solution! All the time, we'd been ordering kids meals from room service for my children, but, one night we were told that they had no more kids meals, and it was a management decision. My husband called "Guest services" To inquire further and was told that they no longer cater to kids as they are a business hotel! The next day, they magically had kids meals!!!!!! Then one day, the garbage was not taken out of our room, and when I contacted guest service, I was told by: "You take out your garbage, go to the end of the hall, there's a refuse room there, you open the door, put it in there, just as you do as home!" When I told her I don't even do it at home (Yes, I am a spoilt well-off lady...sue me) I was told: "The rest of us are not so fortunate, and we have to do it ourselves!".... Front desk never smiled at us for the duration of our stay. As for the hygeine standard, when we first entered the room it was dusty and dirty. The wardrobe was never swept, and towels and shampoo were never replenished. The only advantage of this hotel is the view and location, but it is'nt worth it, as all downtown toronto hotels are close to some form of public transport. I would'nt recommend this hotel. I expect to be treated with courtesy and respect where I choose to spend my money...don't you?

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MJ24
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel. First, location. I took public transportation from the airport which if you have some time and want to save some money, this is the way to go. For $2.50 I took the Rocket bus (#192) to Kipling Station and then took the Subway to the King stop and walked upstairs to find the hotel. Overall the trip took about an hour. Upon arrival at the hotel at 12:40pm was told that my room was ready which was a pleasant surprise (I was prepared just to drop off my bags and head over to the Rogers Centre). The guy who checked me in suggested I take a cab if I wanted to make it to the game on time which I did. It's about a $6 cab ride otherwise it's about a 25 min walk (which I did on my way back from the game). Next, the room itself was wonderful which a nice kitchen and very comfy bed. I had an interior room so no view but that's fine since I wasn't planning on spending much time in the room. The floor I was on was very quiet so I was able to sleep like a baby. The decor was very nice and modern and the bathroom was a nice size. I would have liked to see a hook of sorts to hang your towel especially since they are into reusing to conserve energy. I was only there for one night so I can't comment on the maid service but all in all everything else was great. On Sunday I stored my bag so I could continue sightseeing. Toronto is a great city with lots to do and easily accesible for folks like me who like to walk. I was fortunate to be there this weekend when they were having an outdoor Art Exhibit on the grounds of City Hall. Wow, what a great time, with tons of local artists selling their work. I took a harbor tour which was very nice. Didn't get a chance to go up the CN Tower (next time) nor enough the many great restaurants they have (Summerlicious was also happening and I didn't take advantage of it either). This hotel is near all if you walk or take public transportation. I will definitely stay here again next time I'm in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: scotlass99
Reviews.Content: We spent our first 2 nights of our trip in this hotel and cannot rate it highly enough. We stayed on the 24th floor, overlooking the harbour (opposite side from CN Tower). The room was bright, modern and functional. The kitchen area was ideal as we were able to wash and dry clothes for the rest of our trip! The bed was so comfortable we slept like babies! The staff were incredibly helpful, always saying "Good morning, how are you?" as you passed. We also asked the concierge about train services for the next part of our trip, and he was very helpful and let us use the hotel phone. All in all, I was very impressed by this hotel. It does not only look good, but has substance too. I would recommend this hotel for location also!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: TimmmyJoe
Reviews.Content: I travel to Toronto frequently (about 15 to 20 times a year) and like to rotate my hotel stays between about 6 hotels in the downtown core. In December I travelled to this hotel for the first time on business. I must say from the staff to the facilities to the overall charm of the hotel I instantly found a new favourite place to rest my head while in Toronto. Everything was tip top and the location is hard to beat. In June I decided to take my wife and little boy on a weekend family trip to Toronto (my home away from home). I had remembered my stay here in December and wanted to show my wife and child Dad's favourite hotel. Now while not an ideal "family hotel" (the lack of rooms with 2 beds is the only reason), the service and location did not fail to deliver, once again. We stayed in a one-bedroom unit with a pull out sofa and everything worked out very well. Overall I am not a loyal customer to any one hotel, as I have said I do like to give a new place a go from time to time. This place though may just have changed my mind... You will not be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: raginasian238
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. Every staff member was friendly. We especially liked the bartenders, who pointed us in the direction of some awesome local hotspots. The room itself was immaculate - there was even a small washer and dryer to do laundry. The location of this hotel was great - it was one block from the Hockey HOF and just a few blocks from St. Lawrence Market. The subway is right outside the hotel, on the corner of King and Yonge. There are bars, shops, and restaurants all around. We absolutely loved our stay here. I recommend this for everyone, unless you are on a tight budget - valet parking is $40/day and the internet is $9.95.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: DizzyOAP
Reviews.Content: Wecoming staff and helpful concierge. Clean good sized room (not really a suite). Given a room on 32nd floor with side lake view without asking. Only problem the sliding bathroom door which was difficult to keep shut, so not good if two sharing. Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Quality Overall”
Reviews.Author: BiznisTravlr
Reviews.Content: While the front desk staff were able to accomodate my request for an early check-in upon arrival in the monring, I was quite dissapointed with most other aspects of my stay. The room itself had ample room, everything just felt as though corners were cut. The room itself needed some TLC, and felt a bit tired for a relatively new hotel. Staff was only average, room service was poor, and overall, hotel feels like it needs a power-washing on the outside, and a staff facelift/morale boost on the inside.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suites”
Reviews.Author: djb1gator
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a six night stay at the Suites at 1 King West, and could not be happier with our choice. Front desk staff was friendly, professional, and efficient. Our west-facing suite on the 47th floor was well-equipped, immaculate and gorgeous. Concierge was helpful, taking the initiative to call the tour company to confirm our pickup time, even though we booked it online and not through the concierge desk. Location was perfect, we walked to everything - Distillery District, St. Lawrence Market, Harbourfront, CN Tower, Entertainment District, Chinatown, Casa Loma, ROM, Bloor-Yorkville - and even managed to navigate the underground PATH back to the hotel during an afternoon shower. The lobby bar was surprisingly lively and a great place to relax with a frosty cold beverage after all that walking. We decided we would probably be quite happy living there (the hotel, not the lobby bar).

Reviews.Title: “Walked many a mile”
Reviews.Author: AdamBirimnghamUK
Reviews.Content: Our room (2008) had a partial lake view. Check in was good, allowed straight in even though we got there over an hour before the regualr check in. The Room was very nice, clean with a comfortable bed nice decor and a full kitchen. The powerful air conditioning, large TV, fridge an CD player were all useful. We paid about Â£90 per night which mean the hotel seemed very good value. Toronto is not as big as I expected with not as much to to as many other major cities. Musts include a trip up the CN Tower and dinner at Gretzky's on Blue Jays Way was a highlight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Fab rooms”
Reviews.Author: travel_the_world2008
Reviews.Content: Stay in Toronto for 3 nights at the King West Hotel. The hotel was located on the main shopping street in downtown and not to far from the Eaton centre.... you may of guessed i did loads of shopping! From this hotel everything is in walking distance - habour/CN tower/nightlife etc. This is a great hotel for a tourist who can walk everywhere if the weather is good. The rooms were very big, with a washing and a dryer/cooking hob/ fridge/ mircrowave. as we were travelling alot we washed a few clothes very easy to use just need to buy some powder to put in tho. bathroom a good size... only annoying thing was that when other people closed there doors our door would shake as if someone was trying to enter into our room which woke me up a few times in the night as i thought someone was trying to get in!!! otherwise great hotel for tourists with a great locations to all the tourist attractions!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with PRICEY Valet”
Reviews.Author: AuntieAnne22
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at 1King West during a recent business conference. As stated in other reviews, verything you need is in the room (frige, washer, dryer, ironing board with a decent iron, two flat screen tv's, dvd player), along with some cute extras. For the coffee machine, instead of the cheap powdered creamer, there were the miniature tubs of creamer and Equal instead of the off brand pink stuff. We have found that quite a few hotels restrict use of the input jacks in the tvs so they can sell you movies and viceo games, but we were able to hook up our own equipment to the tvs. We had a nice one bedroom suite room (can't remember the number) on the 14th floor with a balcony. The balcony had no chairs, so we just opened the doors and enjoyed the breeze. The windows in the bedroom were functional and we enjoyed the fresh air. The bar downstairs is nice during the evening. Great atmosphere and people-watching. Room service ended early. We bought some nasty frozen food to cook in the microwave...not recommended The hotel is close to a lot of very good shopping. Convneient to a drug store and Over Easy (great breakfast place).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: IntoTheWest
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and wished I could have stayed longer. Really enjoyed our stay. The room was fantastic and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. The hotel is located fight in the center of Toronto and is ideal for touring the city by foot. The quality of the hotel was very good and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever again”
Reviews.Author: TexMex2008
Reviews.Content: Well, I don't know why they call it Suites, I've seen bigger standard rooms. Very noisy... I tried to get room service at 10 p.m., after complaining several times, I gave up waiting at 2 a.m.. Mentioning this at check out, they didn't care at all. Breakfast is so poor, I decided to wait until I got back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: shamaw148
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel - especially if your company's paying. Terrific location - links directly to the subway so there's no need to step outside as well as to the underground shopping concourse. It's more like an apartment hotel - with microwave, dishwasher, washing machine, dryer, stove, kettle all included in the room. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Did not enjoy the Suites”
Reviews.Author: Skully1980
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in The Suites At 1 King West for a night (May, 3 2008) so that I could fly into Toronto and not have to drive a great distance to get to my final destination. The person at the front desk was very pleasant as she denied my request to be in the new tower on a floor that would give me a nice view of the city. I didnâ€™t think that would be an issue given what appeared to be a great number of vacant rooms available judging by the lack of people in the lobby and bar area. Instead, after she verified that I had booked my reservation through Travelocity, I was given a room in the "Historic Section" of the building on the tenth floor. The "Historic" part of the building was originally a bank that was built around 1906 and at some point in time converted to a hotel. Unfortunately, even after several upgrades, it still isn't desirable by todayâ€™s standards, even at one quarter of the cost at $212USD a night including taxes. And buy the way, the valet parking was an additional $40. The room that I was given was a standard suite which isnâ€™t really much of a suite at all. It compares very closely with any normal room in a typical three star hotel even though this was supposed to be either a four or five star hotel depending on what you read. In no way should this hotel have either a four or five star rating, at least not based on my room. The windows are single pane, uninsulated, wooden windows that should have been replaced years ago. The paint is in need of a refreshining. The heater was loud but worked okay. When I went to find the vending machines for ice and a soda, I was unpleasantly surprised to find that the only ones around were located on the twelfth floor and finding them even then was not easy. As I mentioned, I was on the tenth floor, and unfortunately, due to the windows and the proximity of the room to the street below, just the noise from the traffic was enough to keep me from getting a well deserved night's sleep. I have read several other reviews and noticed a disturbing trend.... those that stay in the new tower seem to enjoy their rooms, while those that are relegated to the "Historic" part of the building are not at all happy with their rooms. I hope that the managers of The Suites At 1 King West will read this review perhaps change their policy on placing guests in the "Historic" section of the building. My guess is that "one-nighters" that book through a third-party will be very unhappy! My advise is to look elsewhere for a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “King of hotels”
Reviews.Author: Car01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at One King West during our recent holiday to Toronto, and managed to get a superior studio suite for CAD187 (+taxes) by booking directly with the hotel which is well under their advertised price (I did a price comparison on TripAdvisor, and one of those gave me a prepay rate of CAD187+tax for the hotel, so when I asked the booking agent at One King West about the rate, she instantly agreed to honour it). Room itself (suite3506) was large by British standards, and had magnificent views eastwards towards lake Ontario (as we requested). The kitchen was equipped with microwave, sink, fridge, dishwasher, washing machine, tumble drier, crockery and cutlery, but lacked the small essentials such as dishwashing liquid, dishcloths or teatowel - they are available from reception for a small charge, but since you'd hardly expect to stay in a hotel and not be provided with bath towels, shampoo, bath soap etc, feel that the addition of these items would improve the experience for guests at a fairly minimal expense to the hotel. Apart from that, the only other small niggles were that the door rattled in its frame which necessitated us wedging a rolled up newspaper in the gap to prevent being woken every time someone walked past, the air conditioning was a bit noisy and the paintwork could do with a bit of freshening up here and there. Everything else in the room was lovely; linens were classy, the bed was comfy, TV signal was strong with a good selection of channels (what *is* it with British hotels? they never seem to get the TVs to perform adequately), bathroom (well, shower-only-room) was small but perfectly formed - although no hooks on the back of the door as it was a pocket door. All the staff we had dealings with were polite and professional, and the business centre (3 PCs connected to the internet) near reception providing free internet access for hotel guests was really convenient. The hotel connects directly to the PATH system which means you don't even need to go outside to get around, which would be good in bad weather. Lots of nice places nearby to eat - we had brunch at Over Easy on Yonge and would highly recommend it despite its rather unpromising looking entrance. Also nearby on Yonge is the Houston Steaks and Ribs which serves what might be considered standard burger and steak fare, but which we found to be friendly, fresh and well- priced (so much so that we went back for a second meal); not haute cuisine, but it suited our tastes very well. There's a handy pharmacy/drugstore directly opposite the hotel which stays open until 10pm. Around the corner from that, there's a very small convenience store which sells a lot of basics. For quick food shopping, I'd really recommend The Market by Longo's in Brookfield Place which carries a large selection of fresh food and household essentials in a fairly small space - we bought cereal, milk, bread, ham and butter as well as juice and some treats and this kept us self-sufficient in breakfasts and a couple of picnic lunches for nearly a week. The location couldn't be better for public transport access (King subway station is accessible either just outside the back door of the hotel, or through the PATH system), streetcars stop on the corner of King and Yonge, and Union station is a short walk away. Although the airport shuttle bus doesn't stop at this hotel, we found the closest (and most convenient) stop to be at the Fairmont Royal York on Front Street â€“ about 5 minutes away above ground and a bit more like 15 minutes via PATH â€“ not recommended if you have suitcases as there are lots of places with stairs and no lifts or escalators â€“ it's also very easy to get lost! The Eaton Centre is a short walk away if shopping is your thing, and if you're into chilling out away from the bustle of the city, I'd recommend taking the ferry to centre island and hiring a bike for a ride around the Toronto islands â€“ stunning views and a peaceful location made a couple of memorable afternoon visits for us. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at One King West and wouldn't hesitate to return or recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “All style and no substance”
Reviews.Author: jimbojetset
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 nights in the Suites at 1 King West ,and out of all the hotels we had booked for our 2 week jaunt to Canada we were looking forward to this hotel the most. After all an overall rating of 5th best in Toronto is something to look forward to. Upon arrival at the hotel we were initally impressed with the grandeur of the lobby area and the sense of class it seemed to exude. This nice early impression was soon quashed however by the cold and rather rude welcome given by the rather uppity guy on the front desk. Instead of advising of how much would be taken as pre authorisation he just took the card and swiped without asking our permission. When we queried the high amount taken as pre authorisation ($110 a day!) the guy kind of looked down his nose at us as if we were tourist peasants and said 'well its' gone through'. This kind of stuck up attitude kind of set the standard for the remainder of our stay. We encountered this kind of frosty service whenever we approached reception. It seems that because we did not appear to be high flying business types and instead came across as lowly tourists we were not worthy of their service. Come on guys has spending all that time in the company of snooty businessmen rubbed off on you? come on i mean you are only receptionists?! don't dismiss the tourist trade. If you dont want mere mortals like us at your hotel then don't advertise on tourist websties. The hotel room itself was aesthetically pleasing with modern minimalist stylings. The bathroom was fairly small but looked stylish. The addition of a washing machine and dryer was a nice touch as i managed to get all my clothes clean and dry before flying home. One's overall opinion of a hotel is made up of many factors and i rate service and warmth to be as high as the quality and style of the room and its surroundings. The service given by this hotel and in particular the attitude of the staff was the worst i have experienced in over 300 hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy”
Reviews.Author: WolfRider
Reviews.Content: Spacious classy room in a great location, and really well designed with a hideaway washer-dryer in the kitchenette - the only hotel we stayed at that had this. The hotel had a nice bar area so you could go for afternoon drinks and stay for dinner. It looked as though we had to pay for internet, but we just plugged the laptop into a cable and we weren't charged. We would happily stay here again if we ever go back to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Practically perfect!”
Reviews.Author: alan93
Reviews.Content: My partner and I went to Toronto to be married, and we couldn't have asked for a better place to stay than the Suites at 1 King West. Everyone was so, so nice. When we booked, we told them we were coming for our wedding, and they upgraded us to a one bedroom suite. Our suite was on the 46th floor, with spectacular views in 3 directions. I'd read in reviews that bathrooms were small, but we got lucky and had a spacious bathroom with shower and huge jacuzzi tub. The living and bedrooms were a little small, but the views more than made up for that. We rearranged the living room furniture to make more space, and all was fine. We were extremely comfortable. Didnâ€™t want to leave. As much as I loved our stay, I have to point out that this is NOT the Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton. Things were a little rough around some edges. A fresh coat of paint here and there would do wonders. Also thought the music in the lobby was too loud, but these are really nits in a wonderful stay. Great location, too! Lots of quality restaurants within easy walking distance. Two places we ate that were incredible: Bravi and Jump. Be sure to visit nearby St. Lawrence Market. Hope you have as nice a time as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: shals27
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Toronto and choosing a hotel through the internet is a difficult decision to make as photo's don't usually show the true picture once you arrive. However this hotel was exactly as the photo's on their website. The staff at the front desk were so helpful and friendly. I stay in the studio suite which has modern furniture, the bed was so comfortable, updated applicances....it was perfect. The hotel is right across from the King Street station for the subway, Starbucks and within walking distance to the Mall, City Hall, Union Station, CN Tower, Roger Centre. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: Gazza24
Reviews.Content: Bit of a late review since stayed there a year ago but had to put one one. Simply fantastic hotel, I had been to Toronto previously and stayed at the Holiday Inn on King and had a good experience there, but this place was exceptional. The staff were superb, attentive and knowledgable and the concierge desk and had no hesitation in helping us arrange our trips and evenings out ensuring we maximised out time there. The room was good, although an odd shape, and had good amenties and was very clean and tidy. This was a bonus as we were not planning on spending much time in our room at all. The bar was also pleasant and we spent many an evening taking a nightcap after an evening out. The location is excellent and immediate access to the subway was useful, although most of Toronto is walkable. A wonderful place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the decor & location.”
Reviews.Author: Sunnybird
Reviews.Content: Loved the decor - simple, clean, yet some color, not the strictly stark modernism of many modern hotels, but no generic hotel floral visual noise. Extremely efficient use of space - room had microwave, stove, fridge, dishwasher, washer/dryer. Bathroom small (as other reviews noted, but not a huge issue). Nice view of city skyline (stayed on the 27th Floor). I think this is my favorite hotel room that Iâ€™ve stayed in over the last 10 years. Location: fantastic. This was my second trip to Toronto, and I picked the hotel for the location. The hotel is right across from the King Street station for the subway (Rocket). Easily walkable to theater, Eaton Center, new and old City Hall, Union Station, CN Tower, the BCE building (neat architecture) and a number of other attractions. Can get to the Royal Ontario Museum easily by subway. Save money by going to the small supermarket on Front Street and picking up supplies for your trip (I only stayed one night, wish I had stayed longer). Several food courts also nearby for quick lunch. Can walk to Fairmont Royal York (10 minutes or less) to pick up the Airport Express bus to Pearson (as it doesnâ€™t stop at the Suites). Service: Ok, not stellar, not horrible (although, Iâ€™ve only ever been impressed by service at the Four Seasons, so thatâ€™s a tough standard to match). Would definitely stay again and would definitely recommend to anyone I know traveling to Toronto. Prices for rooms were decent through the major travel/hotel websites - not the cheapest, but by far, not the most expensive. At the price I booked at, the amount was very fair for the roomâ€™s central location in a major city.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Nice - Very good service”
Reviews.Author: HamiltonONT
Reviews.Content: We went into Toronto for the weekend and stayed the Suites at 1 King West. After about 5 minutes in the room I told my wife I could easily live in a place like that for an extended stay. It was very comfortable and beautifully decorated. Valet parking was excellent, check in was quick and accomodating to a party of 4 wanting 2 rooms close together. Rooms had a safe, washer, dryer, iron and board, 2 burner hot plate, coffee and tea. It is right on the corner of King and Yonge about 2 blocks from the Eatons Centre. We walked to the Canon Theatre from the hotel quite easily. Other theatres are also nearby. The bar in the hotel lobby is also a great place to unwind at the end of your day. Very attentive staff. This hotel, previously a bank, has been very well done and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Apoll0
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple nights. The location is ideal if you're trying to check out downtown Toronto, via the two-foot express. Great, great, service. Sheets weren't great though.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Bevill
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights between arriving in Tornoto for the first time and boarding the VIA train for the Rockies, thus to walk out of the door into a subway station and PATH network of underground shops and routes was ideal. It is walking distance to the CN Tower, the ferry to Toronto Island, Central Station and numerous restaurants. Our studio room, though compact, was well equipped with free internet access, washing machine, dryer, dishwasher, cooking hob and microwave (and an electric kettle!). The room looked onto a brick wall on which was a mural painted and lit to look like sky thus negating any feeling of clostraphobia. The service was friendly and efficient and we will certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: john54321
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, friendly staff - then everyone in Toronto seems to be friendly, I was there during the film festival - it's about a 20 minute walk to Bloor & Younge, which was a nice streach in the morning. I had grand hopes for the gym - it could probably do with more space/facilities. It has a 'pressure pool' - which is basically a tiny swimming pool with a strong current going one way, in which you exercise. Here in Ireland, we have full lenght swimming pools, which are much better. The views from the gym, it has to be said, are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: PresidentBartlett
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Suites on the first leg of our honeymoon and it was a magnificent stay. The staff were always very helpful and the room was superb. The suite that we stayed in was a superior suite (upgraded because we were on honeymoon) and had the most amazing views over the city and the lake. It is very centrally located and is great value for money. We have recommended it to friends who have since stayed there and totally agree with us. It really was a special stay for us and we enjoyed every minute. We couldn't recommend this highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “A winner”
Reviews.Author: pyegirl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed twice at One King West. The first time we took a chance on this place given the reviews on Trip Advisor. The second time we returned because of our good experience. I've stayed in both a studio suite and a superior studio suite. The latter is quite a bit larger and quite enjoyable. Both of these did not have views of the city, rather they looked to the interior of the building. Still, the price we paid at the time ($149/night Canadian and $129/night) were quite a bit cheaper than any of the other hotels. The furnishings of this hotel are very new and tasteful; I believe it has been renovated within the last 12-18 months. The superior studio suite had a nice couch, kitchen area and work area and a separate alcove for the bed. The studio suite was quite a bit smaller and had just enough room for the bed, a kitchenette wall, and the desk. It was on the tight side and was quite dark. Service was quite good in the hotel. They came and provided a line for the computer connection and fixed a ktichen drawer that was not working. Overall, this is a good value for Toronto, although if I were staying for a longer period of time, I would spring for a room on a higher floor and with a view with natural light. The lower floors that look onto the atrium or inside of the building or quite dark and a bit depressing if you must be in your room for more than a few hours in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Coxei
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here at the end of September beginning of October. We payed around Â£69 per room per night for this hotel and expected to get the basic studio room, which we did (7th floor), but it was absolutely fine for our needs. Lovely king size comfortable bed, kitchenette with 2 rings for cooking (no cookware apart from kettle though there was microwave cookware and some utensils, plates, cups etc), coffee machine, microwave, dishwasher, washer and dryer, iron, ironing board, hairdryer, safe and t.v., the air conditioning was good. Our view only overlooked the internal atrium but we didn't expect more for this price. As mentioned on previous reviews, there is not much natural light in these rooms, but we found the bathroom light adequate. We could read fine with the room lights on. Housekeeping called daily and the room was very clean. The location is brilliant and in the evening if you just go east along Wellington or Colborne and walk down Church, the area where Wellington meets Front Street is really good for bars and restaurants, if you then walk down Church onto the Esplanade, there are lots of places where you can sit out in the evening when the weather is good (as it was when we we there) literally minutes away from the hotel. We would stay again and definitely recommend it. I would post photos but they are identical to the ones already posted! Seeing the lights of the financial district buildings lit up (although I know it is a terrible waste of electricity) was a favourite view of mine when walking back to the hotel at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Diane-TA
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights and requested a low floor studio apartment. Although the studio was quite dark as it receives limited natural light, initially it was ideal whilst we were jet lagged, however, by day 3 the poor lighting made reading difficult. On the plus side the studio was equipped extremely well and we heard minimal noise from other apartments. The large bed was comfortable and everything spotlessly clean. The staff we dealed with were very helpful and friendly. Seeing the old bank vault in the basement was amazing. The orginal part of this building has lots of banking history and there is a free guided tour plus information boards. Whilst we were there only one of the whirl pools was working, but as we were on our own it was not a problem. The location was excellent for trains, shops, eateries, cinema etc. From the basement there is a direct walkway to the sub life of eateries etc and an easy walk to the CN Tower, Union Station etc. We never required a taxi. A good supermarket is within walking distance. I would return but request a room with more natural light.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Tyroneslittlesthobo
Reviews.Content: Spent seven nights in the Suites on One King West and, apart from having a poor view (I had an internal room on the 15th floor, 1516), I couldn't fault the hotel. The room was spacious, well equipped and clean. It's location is perfect, right in the middle of the financial district, which makes it the ideal location to get to the entertainment district and the shopping. In the whole week spent in Toronto not once didI need to use any form of transportation other than my two feet. There is breakfast available in the hotel, but just a block or two away are two fantastic eateries for your first meal of the day, both on Yonge St - Over Easy and the Sunset Grill, which will leave you ready for the day ahead. Would certainly reccomend this hotel to anyone visiting Toronto, great value for money and the staff are helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in a downtown location”
Reviews.Author: chatnoir28
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from two weeks in Canada. During our holiday we spent seven nights at 1 King West. On checking in, which was very quick and pleasant, we requested a room with a soaking tub and were given a suite on the 17th floor, opposite the gym and health suite. I think we were one of the only occupied rooms on this floor as there was never any noise at night and it was very convent for using the hotels facilities. The suite itself was large, with a small seating area and good size bed which was comfortable, however the room was a little on the dark side with only one outside window at one end. The bathroom was also a nice size with the all important soaking tub and a separate shower which was nice. We had breakfast in the hotel on the first morning, which was very tasty and not too expensive, however most days we either grabbed something in the PATH food court which is accessible via the stairs in the hotel lobby, or had cereal in the room. We did have two minor problems during our stay. A carrier bag containing a brand new top which had been bought the day before was taken from our room by the maid service however after about an hour spent calling various departments within the hotel the bag and top was returned in perfected condition by the head of hotelâ€™s security along with an apology. Also on our last night the fire alarm went off at about 3:15 am, however the hotel did use in the room announcement system to keep guest informed of the situation and I am pleased to say that we did not have to evacuate as it was a false alarm. We did speak to the hotelâ€™s concierge on two occasions and apart from receiving a good map of the city were not very pleased with their restaurant recommendations or with their overall knowledge of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: matt_robertson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights earlier this month and were generally happy, although there were a few niggles. 1 bed suite on the 47th floor, as it was a corner room we had a view of the lake and islands from the living room, lake from the bathroom (which was lovely led in bath overlooking the lake as the sun went down) and the CN tower from the bedroom. Some of the furniture was chipped and a couple of cupboard door hung badly, some general maintenance and tidying of the units is required, overall though, it was very clean. There was plenty of room, but it was poorly laid out, the living room was plenty big enough, but the bedroom was cramped with very little storage space, the hallway was massive (too big, could have been used by a larger bed room) and the bathroom was a good size with separate shower and tub (with jets). The location was brilliant, right on top of King station, easy stroll up to the Eaton Centre and Lawrence Market, as well as down to the waterside. We did upgrade to the executive package, probably won't do this again. Main reasons for booking it were the continental breakfast (extremely limited choices and was closed 1 day with no alternatives laid on) and priority access to the classic cars (the service was withdrawn prior to our stay). It was very handy having the washer and the dryer in the room, make a nice change getting home with suitcases of clean clothes. As for eateries in the local vicinity, we hated (I know that's a strong word, but we couldn't wait to get out of there) Richtree, I can see why it would appeal to some, but we didn't enjoy the experience, over easy on Yonge was good for breakfast, we went to a mexican place called Hernandos (on Wellington by Lawrence market) twice, which was very good, lunch at 360 in the CN tower was brilliant for $49 (brilliant value considering that it includes access to the observation decks, the food was just the better side of good) for 3 courses plus the view on the clear day was fantastic, rest of the eating was chain places (that we don't have here, so we enjoyed them) Would we stay here again, yes we probably would and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: wrldtrav
Reviews.Content: We also stayed there for the film festival (9 nites). We have stayed at the Four Seasons and Park Hyatt in the past but they have become too difficult to reserve and too expensive! We stayed at 1 King West in a one bedroom suite at half the price of the Four Seasons. It wasn't the Four Seasons for service, but overall it was defintely better value. We stayed on the 44th floor and had a "to die for" view of Lake Ontario with a morning sunrise over the Lake. We used the efficiency kitchen every day and the King bed was extremely comfortable. The room was spotlessly clean and the housekeeping service excellent.The hotel has its own entrance to the subway and if it is raining you don't even need to go outside. All the venues for the film festival are conveniently near exits of the subway!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Niagra
Reviews.Content: we stayed on the 17th floor and its a great location. the corridor is nothing impressive, but the room was really comfortable. would recommend this place to anyone wanting to be in the centre of toronto and having the benefits of an suite

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: LePiaf
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the Suites. We booked a Studio suite for two nights, knowing from previous reviews it would not have a view, but did not mind. It would be just a place to sleep for us. We were pleasantly surprised the window looked out on an atrium, not exactly an airvent/shaft as some people said. Extra bonus was that we didn't have any streetnoise. If you want to look out over the city, you can take an elevator to the 17th floor, or to the gym, which has a balcony. Or better, visit the CN-tower. Room was a good size and clean. Great bed. Smallish bathroom, no bath, just a shower, but clean. Liked the kitchenette, great if you would stay longer, has almost everything you need. Missed a kettle though, but used the microwave to boil water for tea. Roomservice was efficient, they didn't blink an eye when we ordered oatmeal at 10 pm... 15 minutes later it arrived. Breakfast (not included) is served at the Vault, but we used roomservice once again.
