Just pick the things you want and hang the card on your doorhandle before 1 am and promptly at the time requested (6 am) there was a knock on the door. Staff was friendly and helpfull. Check in was quick, check out even quicker. We went to Niagara Falls by train, Union Station is only three blocks away, so we walked there. The Fairmont is across the street from Union Station and that's the closest stop for the Airport Express shuttle. If you don't carry too much luggage, it's doable to walk to the Suites from this shuttle stop. If the weather is bad, you could use the underground walkway system PATH, but we found it a bit confusing. Back to the airport we had the hotel book us a limo for 50 dollars. It's about a half hour to 45 minutes drive, depending on traffic. It's a great bargain for such a nice hotel at this perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Pitch_the
Reviews.Content: Stayed at 1 King West for 3 nights. Were given an internal room in the historic wing. Personally did not mind only window overlooking internal courtyard as was not in room that much. However some may find the room to dark. A good aspect of the room we were given was that it had a v.high ceiling so felt more spacey than was the case. Room was clean and comfortable and of adequate size. Small kitchen as you entered room which we did not use. Location of the hotel was great. Walking distance to all the attractions. 5 mins walk to Canoe Restaurant which is highly recommended. Breakfast diners / pubs all near too. Overall a good stay, nothing to fault but at the same time nothing to rave about. Did the job.

Reviews.Title: “Service was fine when we were checking out”
Reviews.Author: SuzyMountHope
Reviews.Content: The reservations for the hotel was made in May for Sept 8 to 9 and prepaid at that time. When we got to the hotel they refused to put us on the same floor , when you book that far in advance and one person books two rooms, you would expect to be at the very least on the same floor. We were even in different parts of the hotel. The next morning a bill is slipped under the door for the room. The hotel informs us that they did not get the paper work from The Helicopter Co. Once the error was found it was recitfy immediately. As for the rooms they were clean and well maintaned.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights during August. Purpose for our visit was to visit Niagara Falls. Hotel was in an excellent location with easy walking distance to everything we needed. Felt safe the entire time. Hotel lobby is very nice and well presented. Staff friendly and helpfull. Room size was more then fine for us, not small at all. Tastefully decorated with all the mod cons needed. Great view from our windows. I am terribly fussy in regards to cleanliness and the Suites passed my test with flying colours. Comfortable bed and clean shower and toilet. The hotel has a little store downstairs that sells coffee, sandwiches etc. You can also order breaky packs each day rather than going out. Nice little bar for drinks located in the foyer also. I would stay here again and would recommend it. (We only wish we had more time in Toronto - very nice homely city). Great price also. I would also recommend 'Tim Hortons' bagels if your a bagel lover like me. Can be found on nearly all street corners.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful natural light!”
Reviews.Author: My.Take
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying in two separate suites at One King West (both in the new tower). What struck us most about the suites was the beautiful natural light. So often in big city hotels you have one small window with a view of a brick wall. At One King West there was nothing but windows. The rooms were clean and well laid out. There was a sitting area in both as well as a mini kitchen and in-room washer and dryer. Our first room (Tower Superior Suite) was supposed to have a lake view â€“ but it did not. While the room was comfortable, my husband decided to ask where the lake view was. In doing so, he discovered that we were put in the wrong room. He also managed to get us an upgrade to a Premium Suite. Both rooms spoiled us with the size and the natural light. SO often the only place to relax in a hotel room is on the bed. At One King West we enjoyed the ability to eat at a breakfast table and unwind on the couch after a full day of sight seeing. If we return to Toronto, we will stay at One King West.

Reviews.Title: “Creative Financing”
Reviews.Author: RojerPerkins
Reviews.Content: Has cought up with this hotel. While the location is great, this 3rd stay has been well below expectations. I purchased the "executive" upgrade for 2 rooms. Basically, the classic cars are not there anymore, the Vault was always padlocked for entire day except breakfast, the internet service was at a crawl all week-end, the room water was only brought on the first night and the "nightly" turn-down service only happened twice. The hotel manager did however make the proper adjustments to the charges before we left. The upgrade package was never explained upon arrival We assumed the content of the package by the web-site pictures and description, room flyers and elevator posters. There was no mention that the complementary continental breakfast: was only available in the vault room and not room service. After the first day there weren't any more breakfast request tags to hang on the door. The hotel is in a great location with great views convenient for sight-seeing, waterfront, theaters and shoppping. HOWEVER, locations isn't everything. It has to be backed up by quality service not by excuses from the owner in the local papers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for families”
Reviews.Author: DDDSurrey
Reviews.Content: Excellent for families as the rooms are equipped kitchen appliances . This meant were did not have to bring a too many clothes hence the amount of luggage. Location was good as it was walkable to most atractions and close to all amenities. The rooms were clean and the beds were super comfortable. I would without a doubt recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Rasprincess
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Suites at One King West in early July. It was a personal getaway for relaxation. I'm not a picky traveler since I've stayed in everything from hostels to timeshare condos to five star hotels. I really had nothing to complain about with this hotel. It was rather quiet which I needed. My view was decent. The room was exceptionally clean and well lit. The room was maybe more compact than most American hotels, but for 2 adults it would have been just fine in my opinion. Staff was friendly enough and helpful when needed. They seem to have a lot of convenient extras but I didn't use most of them. Hotel is also close to many restaurants, the subway and PATH system. Eaton Centre is a 10 - 15 min walk away. I enjoyed my stay and would defnitely return with my significant other or alone. Love the city of Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: ChrisNorthants
Reviews.Content: We were allocated a room in the 'Historic Wing'. Overall I was quite disappointed as the room was very dark and quite small considering I was expecting a Suite. It was no bigger than a standard hotel room with a very small kitchenette squeezed in. I requested that we be moved to a room in the 'Tower' wing (especially as the air con unit kept us awake during the first night) however despite moving rooms we had to stay in the historic wing. The room was a bit better, very clean, but still small and dark. Hotel location was excellent for the main shopping area and there were loads of good restaurants within a few minutes walk. I think I would look to stay in a different hotel if I was to return to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Avearge Rating”
Reviews.Author: Sanks
Reviews.Content: Well just got back from a 5 day stay at Suites , as described by previous posts , check in was an issue we reached the hotel around 1 tried to get an early check but this was not to be had to come back at 3 ,, so went to do some exploring in the mean time . Came back at 3 was told to come back in 20min did do so and got a room . even this was a bit of a hassel as i had to choose between a queen bed in a high floor with a view or a king bed in a low floor with a view of the city ( which i choose ). Room was comfortable , compact and clean The location was good for shopping , eating and close to all the major sites Guest services we re very attentative , called 1 am to arrange an early morning pick up to the airport amd got a very pleasant voice ( hard to believe for the time ). All queries we had (sites , resturants etc were well advised and handled )

Reviews.Title: “Good Times at 1 King West”
Reviews.Author: MRJNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel Room was spacious (room 1706) with washer, dryer, dishwasher, fridge and stove top. Bathroom had large tub as well as seperate stand up shower. If possible I suggest you request the 17th floor. There are only a total of 6 rooms on this floor along with the fitness centre. Why did we love this floor: 1. Less rooms mean less noise (barely heard a sound the whole 4 days we were there). 2. Fitness centre across the hall with two VERY large hot tubs, and 2 saunas. Being on this floor meant knowing when the hot tubs were empty (which was most of the time) thus we could just walk across the hall and jump in. 3. Need clean towels?? Walk across the hall to the fitness centre and pick up some clean ones from the locker room. I found the staff here amazing. Several times we ended up in the elevator with staff who immediately struck up conversation about our trip. Location: SMACK DAB DOWNTOWN TORONTO. You are about a 1 minute walk to the hockey hall off fame, 15 minutes walk from the CN Tower and Roger Centre (aka Skydome) and you are actually on Yonge Street (coner of Yonge and King West), the longest street in Canada where you will find everything you could possibly need. If someone said I had to come up with 1 negative the only thing I could say was the elevators seemed a bit slow... but it is a 49 floor hotel. Beside that this was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in and I do a lot fo travelling. Check out my photos

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel... but bring a torch!”
Reviews.Author: IrishRuth
Reviews.Content: Initially we were given a room with a great view but only 1 bed. No good for 1 adult and 2 kids so back to reception where they happily gave us a bigger suite (no view this time!) The suite had everything you need and for Â£295 for 4 nights I was very impressed. The location is ideal and the free limo service is great for the CN tower and Union Station. My only problem with the hotel is the fact that the room was dark. Really dark. Turn all the lights on, open the door and still have to feel your way around dark. Don't be put off. It's still worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: JoeKo18
Reviews.Content: Our room was not ready at 3:15 (check is at 3) so they told us to come back in 20 minutes. Whne we returned, again the room was not ready and come back in another 20 minutes. Finaylly the third time we checked around 4:20 the room was still not ready but they upgraded us 3 tiers to a one bedroom suite which was ready. The room was huge with a raised dining area, kitchentte (cooktop and microwave but no oven, also a washer/dryer and dishwasher), living room with large leather couches and a bedroom. The room was clean but not spotless. We were on the 14th floor and although threre were lots of windows, they were about 7ft above the floor so there was no view. Considering we got the free upgrade, we didn't complain. The elevators were really slow, and the day we arrived, the fire alarm went off twice. The first time we went down to the lobby, but saw most people were ignoring the alarm so we stayed in our room the second time. There were plenty of PA annoucements letting us know what was going on. There is a DVD player in each room and there was supposed to be a selection of DVDs at the front desk free to borrow, but they only had about 5, and most were tv shows. We ended up paying $14 for a pay per view new release. There was supposed to be a safe in the room, but we couldn't find it. Check out the giant vault in the basement, it's neat. Because this hotel is priced so low, you get a mix of people staying there - some very noisy and trashy.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as expected”
Reviews.Author: MKKim
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights at the end of July as part of a trip to Canada to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. We pre-booked a car to take us to the CN Tower for dinner two months before we left. On the morning of our dinner reservation at the CN Tower we checked to make sure that the car was booked - and surprise! they had no record even though we had the email confirmation with us. They re-booked our car for 7.30. When we came down for 7.30, we were told they had thought it was 7! Luckily there was a car available but their organisation of this booking was poor to say the least! The hotel itself is located perfectly for everything with access to the metro and Path. We had not booked the top level of suite and definitely felt that the service was poorer because of this. Our room was not cleaned until 5pm each day - which was inconvenient when we wanted to take a shower following a day out and about. I think they probably do the rooms in the order of how much you paid! The lifts also seemed to prioritise the higher floors - which generally held the more expensive suites. The room itself was fine with good facilities although we could probably have found just as good a room elsewhere for less money. When we return to Toronto on our next trip, we will not use this hotel as we were disappointed with it following the high expectations given by their website and the cost which was not competative.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: wddarknight
Reviews.Content: My wife stayed at this location & we were expecting a four star hotel but got a 3 star at best. First of all, the room was small and the bathroom was big enough for one person at max. There were cracks in the walls and the pool which was not in-service was not big enough to swim in. There were no air conditioning on the floor hallways and the elevators felt like a sauna. We were on the 46th floor and there was a fire alarm so we had to walk down 46 flights of stairs because we had a dinner reservation. The $30 a day parking is a bit too much also. On the positive side, it's a good location because it is within walking distance of the entertainment district. The bed was very comfortable. The entire staff was polite and courteous. I should have stuck to my guns and stayed at the Marriott because I have never not enjoyed my stay there. I probably would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: TimIL747
Reviews.Content: Was in town for business meetings in the financial district. This hotel is located right in the middle of the financial district. Most of the bank headquarters are within a few blocks. Lots of restaurants and bars within walking distance. Good clubs less than a $10-15 cab ride away. Very large room / suite. Not sure what makes it a suite in this case other than larger than a normal room. Decent room service breakfast available for under $20. Nothing spectacular, but very convenient and more than edible. Comfortable bed and room was clean. Fairly large fitness room has treadmills, ellipticals, and free weights. I didn't try this stuff out, but they also have steam room and hot tub by the fitness room. Great location, decent rate, nice rooms. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Seaburn
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here in late June. It is a really nice hotel in a very good location. The staff were really friendly and helpful. They arranged a ride in a 50s Cadillac to Union Station for us on departure, completely free. On arriving, we were given a room in the lower part of the building which only had a view of a brick wall but reception were very helpful in switching us to a room on the 34th floor which had excellent views over to Toronto Island. We had to pay a small supplement but it was well worth it. The room was clean and spacious with all the amenities you would want for a short stay. There is a small fitness centre on the roof level of the older part of the building with saunas and a jacuzzi. You can actually go out onto the roof and get some nice photos too. Breakfast at the hotel is a reasonable buffet and proved to be good value and tasty. The serving staff were extremely friendly. Most of the main attractions (CN Tower, Harbourfront and Eaton Centre etc) are within easy walking distance but the Metro system is outside the front door and access to the Path is within the hotel. The building has a history of it's own and it is worth reading about it. Overall, a very enjoyable stay but, if you want a view, make sure you ask for a room that has one as this is quite a busy hotel and an upgrade may not always be available

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hopi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in June. We booked through [--] and payed Â£296 for four nights in a delux suite, which we think is a very good price for a centrally located Toronto hotel. Initially we were given the keys to a room on the 32nd floor. We don,t know who had more of a shock us or the naked man who occupied it !!! We made a hasty retreat to reception!! We were then allocated a room on the35th floor, and were treated to a plate of cheese, bisciuts and fresh fruit - obviously to cure our shock! The suite ,although not large, had everything needed to make your stay pleasant and unlike other reviews was extremely clean. It was certainly very nice to be able to wash our clothes in the comfort of our room and to be able to pack clean clothes before heading off on our next leg of our journey to Ottawa. The location of this hotel makes it a great place to stay. It is within walking distance of most attractions, there are plenty of shops and restaurants nearby and the PATH system is accessable from the hotel basement. We booked a lift to the train station in the hotel's Rolls Royce,and certainly arrived in style! If we ever return to Toronto we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BeautifulBC-7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have relied on trip advisor for many of our travels (and we travel alot). Most the time we are not disappointed until now. First of all, their website says that they would be happy to book a limo ride from the airport for you at a cost of course. Since my parents are elderly, I wanted to have a ride ready so they did not have to stand in line for a taxi. Well, when I got to the airport, there was no ride waiting, so I phoned the hotel valet services and was told that "Daniel" forgot to book it. Then in a not so pleasant response, I was told to just go outside, there should be lots of taxis and limos. Well on a Friday night at 5:00, there were no limos to be had and my parents and I waited in a taxi lineup for about 20 minutes. The hotel was not even sorry! We booked a one bedroom suite. I was staying on the hide a bed in the living room. I made sure the hotel knew there would be 3 people in the room. When we finally got there, there was no bedding for the hide a bed, only 2 towels, 2 cups, etc. I phoned down and they sent up another towel, cup, pillows (without pillowcases) and a blanket. The next day, the housekeeping staff again left 2 towels, 2 cups etc. I would think that if a hotel specialized in "suites", they would have some kind of system to let the housekeeping staff know how many people were in the room. The hide a bed was very uncomfortable, but I suppose that is the way with all hide a beds. At the end of our stay, the front desk argued with me over 18 cents for a phone call which should have been free. I paid the 18 cents as it wasn't worth arguing over, which made me wonder why "they" would argue about it considering all the problems we had. I did let the front desk know that I wasn't all that happy about our experience there, but they did not seem to care at all. I would probably not stay at this hotel again, more because my concerns were not dealt with rather than the place itself. The customer service was very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Hotel Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: MelPLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. The first room we were given was very spacious but the window was so small and far away from the main part of the room that it felt dark and claustrophobic. So we requested a change. We were immediately given a smaller room with more light which we accepted. The room was very pleasantly furnished with a kitchen area and washer/drier which was very useful. Staff were very polite and helpful. However, on our third day we were woken up by a fire alarm at 6.10am. There were no staff directing guests out of the building or waiting outside the building to tell us where to stand or provide us with info. Firemen arrived and left promtly. When re-entering the building we found most of the guests were in the lobby and only 2 members of staff were present and they didn't know whether there was a fire in the building or how to switch the alarm off. This continued for an hour. It was a shambles. It turned out that there wasn't a fire. What if there was a fire ? All hotels should be prepared for a fire emergency and have fire marshalls to provide direction, not leave guests wandering around the lobby until they have figured out if there is a fire. Putting this aside, the hotel is in a great location, good value for Toronto and the staff are pleasant enough.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Deal”
Reviews.Author: mrpaladin1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in June at one of the "studio suites." I ask you -- where else can you get a downtown room In Toronto (let alone a suite) for three days for $500, total price after taxes? Answer: nowhere. Our 10th-floor suite was fairly roomy, if somewhat oddly laid out (in a more-or-less triangular fashion), complete with fridge, microwave, washer, dryer, TV. Two cabinets provided plenty of space to hang clothes. Lots of drawer space, as well. There was a workdesk next to a window. Fixtures and furnishings were modern and in excellent condition. The layout resulted in no common walls with neighbors, so guest noise was not a problem. Elevators were quick. Room darkening blinds worked well to keep out early morning sunlight. Shower head was high enough for a tall person, but water there and at both faucets took about 3-5 minutes to heat up. TV reception was fuzzy, possibly due to loose connections, but we didn't bother complaining. Hotel staff was quite attentive and helpful. A couple of old limos are available to take you to nearby locations, if available, for the small price of a tip. Valet parking (with in-out privileges) was a steep $30 a day, but apparently they round down, since we were charged for only two days although we parked around 2.75 days. Overall, a great deal, indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location - very large but dark rooms.”
Reviews.Author: pontificator
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice with my girlfriend. Both rooms were in the "historic" part of the building (below the 9th floor). Rooms are large and very well equipped with excellent facilities and a good value. The front desk and services were very good, especially the bussiness services. The location is excellent in the heart of the Financial district - surrounded by good restaurants of all prices. My only mild complaint comes from the lack of natural light in both rooms I've stayed. One had a small window and the other was completely internal - looking out to a hallway (this suite was huge!). However the suites we picked were far from the most expensive and overall a very good value for the size and location!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Sweeper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in April and could not fault it. We had a room on the 23rd floor which was clean and large. The location ws excellent for exploring the city and we walked to all the points of interest and shopping areas. Hotel staff were very helpful and pointed us in the direction of using the old limos for local journeys instead of taxis - need to book but its fun and free! Being in the city centre the hotel is busy with lots of tourists and business people alike but we liked the atmosphere it created and would recommend it as a place to stay,

Reviews.Title: “WARNING - Stay elsewhere for special occasions!”
Reviews.Author: rebel1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at several downtown Toronto hotels, although this was the first time here at 1 King West. I booked the room over a month ahead of time by phoning the hotel for a one night stay. We were headed into Toronto for a concert at the Air Canada Centre. At the time of booking the hotel (1 month ahead), I made 2 simple requests - a King Size bed and a car ride through their complementary car service. I was told that most beds were Kings in the hotel and they would put a note on my reservation requesting such a bed. I was offered a Tower Superior Room for $239, which was supposed to be one of the better rooms according to the hotel. I booked the car service with the valet, who told me the date and time was open and inked me in. The Good: Well, it's hard to pin-point the good when the Bad and Ugly just cloud everything, but I'll try. Location: King and Yonge right in the downtown core. Close to shopping, restaurants, and connects to the PATH (Toronto's underground downtown walkway). Subway stop is just outside the hotel. Rooms: The room has a mini-fridge, washer, dryer, microwave, dishwasher, plates, silverware, DVD player, in-room safe. Kind of nice if staying for an extended period. Appliances were kind of awkwardly put into the kitchenette (washer and dryer are in the cabinets in your kitchenette, fridge sits atop your counter) but I guess that's the only way to fit it in the limited room space. Beds were comfortable and bathroom was average sized for a 5-star. Overall, the room was good...not 5-star comparable to most other downtown TO hotels, but better than your average 3 or 4 star hotel room. Complementary car service to downtown locations on a first-come-first-serve basis (booking with valet required). The Bad: Not to be nit-picky, but the room was somewhat run down. For a relatively "new" Toronto hotel, every corner had missing paint chips, scuff marks, etc. I can certainly see the need for a little maintenance and house-keeping over the regular sweep-and-vaccuum. The parking in front of the hotel is non-existent when checking-in/pulling up. The traffic is heavy and there is no room to pull into the hotel (the few spots the hotel has house the complementary car service limos). You end up pulling along the street and the valets come out to greet you across the street. Poor design for sure. Valet Parking by the way costs $30 per day, which is a little steep even by downtown Toronto standards. There is no hotel self park, although lots in the area charge approx $20/day. The Ugly: A couple of points are specific to our experience, but after reading a few other similar reviews here, I can see a pattern of apathy and nonsensical logic on the staff's part. Like I mentioned, I booked a month ahead of time and made a request for a king bed. We have one at home...we are used to the size and we are not the smallest people in the world. Well, of couse when checking in, we are told that our room has a queen bed. When I mentioned that I had requested a king, I was told that there were no Tower Superior Rooms available with a king bed. This was at 3:10pm when check in was 3:00. I then asked if they had any other room that had a king bed open. Was told that there were standard suites with kings available. The standard suites were a downgrade in room type and size, however we were willing to take if for the king bed. Remember, I paid $239 for my room and the standard suite normally goes for $169. I was willing to switch rooms and pay the $239 rate even with room downgrade. However, I was told that because rooms were so full that day in Toronto, the rate for the standard suite was now $350! So, basically they wanted me to take a downgrade and pay an extra $111 on top of it. Ridiculous! Next, when confirming my ride, I was told that there were other people also going to the concert and they wanted to cram everyone in one vehicle. Well, so much for their first-come, first serve policy. The point of riding in the classic car was to have a romantic ride to the event, not be packed like sardines in a '56 Cadillac. Finally, I mentioned the room needed a little repair and maintenance. The maid also needed to learn how to clean. There was filth on the kitchen counter under the fridge (hair, food, who knows what else). There was an unmentionable stain in the bath tub and the light switches were covered in filth (see photos). Overall, if you are staying for a holiday, vacation, or special occasion, I would HIGHLY recommend you stay elsewhere. The business traveler may find this hotel useful if you can get over the obvious deficiencies. Don't expect the staff/management to do anything if you voice your concerns...they don't even have comment cards. There are many quality hotels in downtown Toronto...this is definitely NOT one of them.

Reviews.Title: “What a place, what a room...but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Guru_99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon recently taking in New-York, Niagara and Toronto. We drove from Niagara some 300 miles to be at the hotel for the 3pm check-in time. Unfortunately after struggling to get our car valet parked (its quite tight round the entrance) we were told we had to wait as our room wasn't ready. Two hours, numerous drinks and lots of questions later we were "upgraded" to a higher suite and given a free breakfast voucher. I then told the lady behind the counter it would be a nice gesture to pay for our bar bill since we were told we would only have to wait 15 minutes. They did begrudgingly do this after much faffing about - but hey at least they agreed. At least they reacted when something went wrong, but I do feel they could have done more to keep us informed - or why not just upgrade us immediately? Anyway, back to the Hotel. The lobby is very large and nicely finished with a classical feel. There are bell-hops and staff a plenty and even a small shop to buy the essentials. While we were waiting for our room the lobby was very busy with business men and stranded travellers no doubt also waiting for something. The bar was professionally run and service was first rate. On to the room. The photos of the rooms on Expedia looked fabulous and they didn't disappoint. We were given a guided tour of the suite by the bell-hop and he even went as far as to show us how the hidden dishwasher/washer and dryer worked! The Suite had a separate bedroom with good size bed, TV and Fireplace. Off the side was the compact bathroom with bath, wet-room style shower, etc. The complimentary toiletries were very nice too. The living area had a nice table and chairs opposite the kitchen area which was very contemporary and didnâ€™t look like you were sitting in the kitchen if you understand me. There was also a flat-screen TV above the kitchen units. At the end of the living area was a modern desk and ergonomic chair looking out over Toronto harbour and the skyscrapers â€“ breathtaking. Ni fact the whole suite was blessed with floor to ceiling windows providing stunning views. Location was very good, walking distance from everywhere (CN tower, harbour, shops) and the service was very good too. Breakfast was buffet style and was taken in the lobby which was a little strange. Be warned that this is a hotel in a busy city so we shared it with many business men and women. In summary, as a traveller with high expectations when I pay good money for a room, I can heartily recommend this hotel even given the small check-in mishap.

Reviews.Title: “black hole”
Reviews.Author: ja66ke
Reviews.Content: requested a room on high floor TWO months before arrival to no avail. The room we got on the 13th floor was very dark with little natural light. The staff on reception said that they were fully booked but would try to change room following day. Needless to say they did not try very hard as we were still in our dungeon two days later when it was time to checkout. In all honesty we were very dissapointed with the room allocated especially as the hotel knew well in advance that this was a special occasion for my wife and i , and they let us down big time. Anybody planning to stay here make sure you get a room on one of the higher floors .

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good everything but not outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: BalSingh
Reviews.Content: Bit of a mixed bag here but generally positive. The hotel is in a perfect location. You step off a subway train and its there if front of you. Nearby there are tons off shops, cafes and restaurants. The main sites are within walking distance too. Even though the hotel is located in the financial area amongst the skyscrapers of Toronto, it is better located than some of the the hotels near Bloor/Yonge which I thought was a bit out of the way. Rooms are nice and have great views. All include a CD player. DVD player, microwave, washer, dryer etc. Service is good although one day out room wasnt cleaned very well and they lost the TV remote, other days were fine. One of the days we had a balcony room (1506, I think). Avoid these rooms as they have slanted windows without curtains. As a result, the light comes pouring in early in the morning and the heat can be unbearable. There is no pool in the fitness centre ... for some reaosn, I thought there was so I wasnt too happy when I only found a hot tub & sauna (but thats my mistake). Generally, a nice stay if it werent for the odd few niggles. One thing to point out, from the airport DONT get a taxi. Get the 192 bus which costs $2.75 and takes you to the subway and form there you can get the train right to the hotel door. It takes an hour door to door but $2.75 compared to $30 odd for a taxi is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Toronto's best hotel”
Reviews.Author: gabe05
Reviews.Content: Booked two superior rooms when i checked in on the check in time only one room was ready, half hour later the other room was ready but it was on a lower floor when I asked both rooms to be on a higher floor. My room had a great view but was a little on the small side and the decor was cheap looking. My biggest problem with this hotel is the elevators they are small and they don't have enough of them in the tower. In the mornings it was a long wait for the elevators. If your want a good budget hotel this is the place, if your looking for luxury you may want to stay else where.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Jamiee8672
Reviews.Content: I'd read the reviews and felt confident we'd get value....and we did. A nice clean hotel in a great location for site seeing. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a short break to take in Torontos sites. Very good. My only small gripe is I would have liked bottled water available in the room. You need to buy your own but that's a minor personal irritation. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: JATraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week in May for a conference at the Metro Toronto Convention Centre. I was upgraded to a "Superior" suite on the 34th floor and I loved it. The views of the city were beautiful and I could see the harbour as well. As this hotel is right on the corner of King and Yonge Streets, you can easily get to places like the Convention Centre (I walked every day), Rogers Centre and lots of little restaurants nearby. There is a subway stop directly outside of the hotel and it's only 2 stops away from the Eaton Centre mall. If you prefer to walk, it's not too far either. I really loved the amenities of my room- the washer, dryer, dishwasher, fridge and microwave made things easy for a long stay. The staff was very helpful and accomodating. If I'm sent back to Toronto on business, I would definitely stay here again. Compared to other area hotels at this price, it's well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: jaredw
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at The Suites and I was very happy with everything. For the price of the room ($180US per night) it almost certainly can't be beaten in downtown Toronto. We were up on the 32nd floor with a great view, the room was spacious & clean, comfortable bed, washer/dryer, fridge, microwave, desk, etc. You can walk to almost any attraction, but if you want to ride they have a complimentary car service. I have stayed on Queen Street in the hip area, but why pay 2 or 3 times the price when it's just down the road?

Reviews.Title: “Not Good. Not Bad. Ok.”
Reviews.Author: bembridge
Reviews.Content: I have really mixed feelings about this hotel. I had a really great room on the 29th floor (2910) which seems to be larger than many of the other rooms and had a very comfortable large bed, sofa and the desk area and a small kitchen area. In the kitchen area is a washing machine, tumble dryer, microwave and fridge. the decor was stylish, the pictures on the wall attractive photos and the view was really quite amazing. I had corner windows on 2 sides and then windows looking out over to the water where in the early evening the water was full of small sailing ships. The bathroom was small with small bath that was more of a shower than a bath but you could have had a bath if you wanted one. The suites at One King West seem to be a mix of hotel and also residential and long stay. The accommodation is in a large tower of about 45 floors that was built above an old bank building from the turn of the century. The place is very much two different places. The old bank building (which seems to have had a chequered history and been empty and abandoned for a long period) is a bit gloomy and dowdy. I did not like the lobby area at all as it really feels a bit like one of those conference type hotels that usually seem to be in the middle of nowhere. Then you go up into the tower and your room and it is like you are in a different hotel altogether. The interior designer who did the hotel rooms clearly had no say on the old bank building. The meeting areas and rooms in the bank building area are very gloomy and dark with dark drapes. You eat meals if you have an event there in "The Vault" which is what it says with the amazingly HUGE door that used to lock the vault still there. It is worth looking at. The hotel has 24 hour room service but no actual restaurant to eat in. It is a great location as very central with lots of shops and places to eat around and is also very close to the CN Tower etc. But there was something overall impersonal and cold about the place. The price is very good and so great value for money for the rooms. But not a place I would rush back to if I was heading back to Toronto. It is one of those, ok places. Not good. Not bad. The view from my room though was the one thing that I did really like about the place.

Reviews.Title: “The best yet!!!”
Reviews.Author: Elliep216
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Toronto and my first (of many I hope) stay at Suites at 1king west. Excellent location. Subway is right to across the road and the PATH (underground concourse) can be accessed from inside the hotel. Attractions and excellent shopping all within walking distance. What can I say.... fantastic! The staff were friendly and made us feel very welcome. The classic car service is fabulous and complimentary. The rooms are clean and fresh and housekeeping looked after us, even cleared away our few pots in the sink! Just make sure you don't forget to tip - the service is so worth it. Definitely recommend 1 king west. In the process of booking my next stay! If you want to watch a Blue Jays Game - I really recommend going to the Hard Rock Cafe at the Rogers Centre. Reserve a window seat - there's a 5CAD cover charge and you have to spend at least 20CAD whilst your there. The atmosphere is great and the staff fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “NIce stay”
Reviews.Author: monaprincess
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights. CONS I had a window that faced an interior blue wall. There was no way anyone could see into my room (I think..) but there was also no light. If you can afford it, ask for a room with a window to the outside. Carpet in the room was dirty and old. I did walk on it without slippers. The shower floor needs to be replaced or properly cleaned. Room kind of small but adequare for one person. "Business center" is a small alcove off the lobby with two computers. During my five days either one or both was always broken and they were doing construction in that room. I guess they do that so you can pay to have internet in your room. PROS Washer and dryer in the room! Kitchenette with dishwasher, sink and microwave in the room! Small refrigerator! Utensils and dishes. Nice for someone on a budget who wants to eat leftovers once a day or prepare a simple breakfast. I love the small rooftop gym! Ellipticals with televisons, two saunas, two hot tubs, showers, lockers, etc. Very nicely done. DVD player etc. in the room. I didn't use it but I imagine that it would be nice for kids. Also, CD player, etc. Restaurant and parking on site. Nice downtown location walking distance to shopping, convention center, train station, subway, streetcar, etc. Would I stay again- yes, but in one of their big rooms with a view of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: Cybergirl12
Reviews.Content: Stayed May 13-18, 2007. Took flat fee limo from airpoirt to hotel. Cost was $50. Check in was smooth and quick. They gave me a choice of a room on the 27th floor with a view and a stand up shower or a corner suite on the 8th floor with a full size tub/shower combination. I took the 8th floor room and had a nice view of King and Yonge Street. The room as very clean and had all the comforts of home and more. It had hardwood floor throughout, a king size bed which was very comfortable, very nice white bedding, a 27 inch TV with a DVD player, nice size bar fridge, micowave, small dishwasher, sink, dishes, etc. to go with it all, a small washer and dryer, iron and ironing board, hair dryer, good sized safe that held a laptop computer and much more, good size desk and two very comfortable chairs - one leather office chair and one easychair with ottoman. It was very quiet, no noise from next door, above or below what so ever. The temperature control seemed to work well. Calls to guest services were dealt with promptly and politely. The conciere desk staff were very helpful on giving directions, restuarant recommendations, etc. Checkout was smooth, bell services kept my luggage from 8 AM - 2:30 PM for no charge. The VERY BEST THING about this hotel is it's LOCATION. You can exit directly from the hotel into the underground PATH system. You can go out the door, into the PATH system, turn left, go down a short flight of stairs and get on the subway. I walked to and from my course (about two blocks away) without stepping outside, no jacket or umbrella's required. The entertainment district is within walking distance as is the Eaton Centre mall. And when you have a bunch of bags to carry back after shopping all evening at the mall, you can just hop on the subway for $2.75 and get a ride straight from the mall to the hotel in a matter of minutes - again all without stepping outside. The hotel lobby is grand and beautiful. Had room service once - it was a little pricey but the food and service were excellent. They offer a long distance/internet package for $4.99/night. Gives you high speed internet and unlimited long distance which I used extensively. Worth every penny. Had no problems connecting to the internet. High speed - although not wireless worked very well. Paid $209/night which is a steal for a hotel of this quality in this location. Would gladly stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great!”
Reviews.Author: travel_bug3379
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research when booking my Toronto accommodation as I wanted to be central in location, and in a nice place that didn't cost the world. Reading other reviews narrowed things down a lot and when I found a good price advertised for 1 King West, I decided to take it. I loved this hotel from the moment I arrived. The lobby is gorgeous, and as someone else previously reviewed, it reminded me of a private club setting - dim lighting (not too dim, just right!), a huge bar area, big lounges overlooking the lobby... Check-in was simple and fast and the lady was extremely pleasant. I was on floor 36 and had no issues with my room at all! My desk overlooked Yonge St, and the rest of the suite had city/water views which were beautiful. I was able to wash my clothes in the in-room washing machine which was handy since I was on a 3 week trip, and I also loved the fact that I would be able to cook myself if I wanted to. Everything you needed was there! It really was like a mini apartment that you could live in permanently. I ordered room-service dinner one night and it was the tastiest pasta dish I have EVER had from a hotel before - AND it was a big serving! Need I say more on how good the food was! Breakfast was also very tasty and in good portions! A little known fact about the hotel is that they have a local car service that will take you from the hotel to anywhere in the central business area for no charge. I was told about the service from someone else who had stayed there and decided to use it to get to a business meeting. I honestly felt like a celebrity! The car was an old 50's/60's car, not sure of the make/model but everyone on the street was staring in to see who I was and checking out the car. Service was great by most staff, some were much better than others but that is normal. The bar in the lobby is a great place to sit and have a drink in the evening, especially if travelling alone like I was. I met some great people at the bar and there is a huge tv screen there also which was always playing sports but that was a good thing! I would not think of staying anywhere else when I return to Toronto, and I would absolutely recommend it to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels in the area”
Reviews.Author: KD123NJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Suites at 1 King West Toronto for 4 days/3 nights, at a tower superior room. The suite is spacious, we were placed at the 34th floor, so got a nice view as well. The location is excellent, walkable to/from CN tower & St. Lawrence Market. The hotel is connected through path and the King subway station right outside the door. I do however have several complaints about the hotel. The concierge does not know where Chinatown or Little India is. For Chinatown she had to google and then ask one of the bell boys where it is. For Little India, she directed us to take the subway to Yonge St, walk over a few blocks to Gerard Street, and then walk along Gerard for 15 minutes. Let me tell you, that's not even remotely close to Little India. We actually took a cab from Gerard &Yonge and it took a little over 12 minutes drive to get there! Additionally, The night before arrival, I called the hotel to see if they have any room available for early check in the next day. The person I spoke to at the time said "Sure No problem". So off we went arriving at 7AM. I know it's very early... At the front desk, the staff told us that there was no room available and to come back at 12 (the checkout time is 11). So we dropped the bags at the hotel and went for some sightseeing. At 12PM we came back, and was told the room isn't ready yet. We decided then to stay at the hotel lobby and asked them to let us know as soon as it's ready. At 1:30 still nothing, we then went to the front desk for status, in response we got brushed off with an attitude and was told that the check in time is 3PM. Finally at 2:20PM, a front desk staff came by to tell us she is putting a rush on a nice suite for us (mind you we did book a tower superior room). We finally checked in at 3PM. Make of it what you will, but I've stayed in many hotels (and occasionally requested early checkin), but had never experienced anything like this. If you are ordering room service breakfast, it's simply not worth it. My continental breakfast came with a cup of coffee, a glass of juice, sugar & milk in sachets, and 2 pastries. No flask to keep the coffee warm or milk in its own pot. During our stay there were plenty of college-age kids staying at the hotel, and they made quite some noise in the hallway at night. This is not the hotel's fault though. However, needless to say we won't come back.

Reviews.Title: “It's definitely downtown!”
Reviews.Author: BeenThereAlready
Reviews.Content: The upper floor rooms were clean and spacious. You get a city view but do not expect a lake view, maybe more like a lake glimpse. The pricing of about $148 (with taxes included) for a tower room is acceptable for the heart of downtown. You can walk or take the streetcar/subway to everything. The noise does come through the walls thought, so you might want to takes some earplugs with you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Economical and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: macmtn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convienient to the Eaton Center and other downtown shopping areas. It also has access to the metro from the lobby. The staff was very cordial and helpful. Our studio room, while having an odd shape and being rather small, was nice and had a great view from the large corner windows. It had a very quaint little kitchenette area equipped with a 2 burner stove, microwave, refrigerator and yes - a dishwasher, washer and dryer ! Not something you'll find in very many hotels and didn't cost extra - the cost was among the lowest for the downtown hotels. And there is a drugstore right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “A very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Thelockes
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom on the east side of the tower on the 31st floor for 4 nights in April 07. We had a very nice view of the less famous parts of Toronto but very good just the same. It looked like rooms on the west side could only see another high rise building. The accommodation was not very spacious for the queen size bed and the sofa bed in the lounge. Our daughter slept on the sofa bed that was fine for her but a large adult may not find it very comfortable. Space around the bed in the bedroom was a little tight. The bathroom was not very big either. On the plus side; the cleaning staff were very good. The kitchenettes are well equipped with a washer and dryer that worked well. We chose to have the internet/long distance phone call service for $5.00 a day and this worked well. There is a large desk and ethernet cable connection. The room had umpteen windows so natural light and outlook were pleasing. The reception and conciege service were very friendly and helpful. We used the free vintage car service twice. This is a low key operation. The hotel is very well situated near to everything we wanted to see. Walking to most attractions (CN Tower, Blue Jays baseball park, harbour, Eaton Centre etc.) is very possible. The PATH is easily connected to via a tunnel from below the hotel. We booked through Air Canada, this was cheaper than directly with the hotel but has drawbacks if you need to cancel. The hotel is only two years old so the equipment is in good condition and there was very little cooking smell in our hallway. All and all we thought it a pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but great location!”
Reviews.Author: WaterMonkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night in February and loved the location. Smack dab in the middle of downtown life, immediate access to the King subway stop, and sitting on top of the PATH network of underground shopping. The room itself had everything in it for a lengthier stay, like fridge, washer/dryer, oven, sink, dishes, etc. The downsides: smaller room than I'd expected, and only valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Well appointed rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Bumblebees
Reviews.Content: I stayed in one of the studio apts. Got it for a great deal online considering the suite was right downtown, with the subway right on the doorstep. My modern room had a little kitchen, as well as a washer and dryer, fridge, microwave, king size bed, tv, etc. etc. The room was very clean and quiet. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wish it was more than one night!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JOCURT
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay and a wonderful hotel!! We came to Toronto to attend a function downtown. Checked several other hotels and this one had the best reviews and a good price. We asked for a good view when booking and we weren't disappointed...42nd floor overlooking the financial district. We booked a "Superior Tower Suite". Great room with nice amenities. Next time we will book a king size bed. There could be more shelf space in the bathroom. Heater is noisy...shut it off if you want to get any sleep. From one of the previous reviews we learned of the hotel car service. Got dropped off at our function in a Bentley...AWESOME. Overall a really nice stay

Reviews.Title: “new and modern or old and vintage”
Reviews.Author: jshien
Reviews.Content: visited with my parents. booked two rooms, our room was in the older section (the lower floors) my parents rooms were on the highest floors. The new rooms are very nice and modern with great views. The older rooms in the lower floors seem more spacious but they were also darker because they were on lower levels. If i remember correctly the rooms had washing machines as well as dishwashers. The price was great for what you get! They also have free car service in their vintage cadillacs. overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected ...”
Reviews.Author: jendon
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate on this room by calling the hotel directly. Requested a room with a view, we were upgraded to a 30th floor room. Room was not ready when we arrived, but we able to leave our bags and take the underground PATH to have some lunch. The hotel itself is very beautifiul with many historic features. It is worth an explore to see everything. The Dominion Hall is awe-inspiring - make sure you look up to see all the provincial crests on the ceiling. The fitness area seemed to be well equiped. It is on the 17th floor with a walk-out patio. There was also a small lap pool, hot tub, saunas and change rooms. The change rooms were stocked with toiletries. We were quite impressed by our room. It was strangely shaped but had a nice layout. The desk sat in a corner overlooking the city. The bed and TV area was comfortable. The kitchenette equipped with a fridge, microwave, dishwasher, clothes washer and dryer, toaster, microwave, dishes and cutlery. There was also a small personal safe in the closet. The bathroom had a small single vanity, toilet and shower stall. We were happy that the showerhead was high enough that we didn't have to duck and the water pressure was sufficient. Althought is was one of the smaller and most economical rooms, we were very comfortable and not crowded. The room was very quiet and the bed ery comfortable with nice linens and a duvet. One of the best things about this hotel is the location. You are close to all downtown attractions including theatre, shopping, the Air Canada Centre and Roger Centre (Skydome). We walked underground using the PATH system to pretty much anywhere we wanted. The King streetcar stops right at the hotel's front door. The food courts in the attached buildings provide a wide variety of food and shopping outlets. Although it was cold outside, we really didn't need our coats! We did not eat at the restaurants in the hotel - had a few pints but found the price very high compared to other watering-holes nearby. To get to the hotel from the airport, we used the TTC (public tranport) - $2.75 each. There is an express bus to Kipling Station on the ground level of Terminal 1. Once on the subway, we had to transfer to the Yonge-University line and the exit at King. Look for the large stairway upstairs, exit the subway to Commerce Court/Melinds Street and make an immediate right to access the lower level of the hotel. To get back to the airport, we took the Airport Express bus from the Farimont Royal York - a short walk underground to get there. This is definitely a hotel we will use again - maybe not with the kids due to lack of recreational pool, but definitely for a couple's vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RosyDays
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of January. The location is fantastic, everything is within walking distance. The room itself was all great. It was large, warm and had a large TV, washer, dryer, microwave, dishwasher and fridge. The bathroom was adequate but a little small. The food in the hotel was expensive so we ate out. I would recommend Richtree around the corner - loads of choice and very cheap. There is direct access to the PATH (underground walkway) from the hotel. This was invaluable as it was -15 degrees whilst we were there! The only downside was that I requested a room with a view, and the only view I got was of the building across the road. I asked for a view but was told I would have to pay more for one. As it was snowing and very cloudy I declined due to the fact that I couldn't see the view even if I wanted. The room was booked through hotelopia and if you quote 432 in the discount voucher or code you get 10% off.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable if you are paying for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: ScottishPrincess
Reviews.Content: We had three rooms from mid December to 28th December and then again in early January. I normally stay at the Inter-continental but with having to pay for three rooms- for teenagers, the different price ranges in this hotel was ideal. We had a one bedroom suite and two studio suites. On hindsight given the length of stay, we should have booked for one month rental - might have been cheaper to get the block price. We booked directly with the hotel which was useful as we could negotiate room prices etc.. The rooms were very comfortable- particularly the beds. I sleep with earplugs so the heating systems did not disturb but they can if you do not switch them off. One thing we felt was that it was a real hit or miss as to which rooms you got for what you paid. We paid almost $140 more for the one bedroom suites and they were nice. We paid $129 per night for my teenagers and one of them had a fantastic room on the 44th floor- and frankly we probably could have lived with that rather than pay the extra $140. The other had a basic room in the old part of the hotel. Depending on who you have at the check in desk- you either get a coordinated room allocation ( as we did on our return visit- with being allocated three rooms on the one floor) or spread all over the place. Also there appears to be no logic as to how you are allocated rooms so $129 could be a studio suite with no view or it could be a fantastic room with windows on three sides of the room- stunning view. It could be in the old part of the building or in the new at a very high floor. One very positive feature is the $5 per day access to high speed internet access. We used Skype to call home to the UK and with teenagers ringing their girlfriends back home for hours each day and wanting to go on MSN, this feature was fantastic. We stayed over the Christmas period though we went to relations for Christmas day. Rather disappointing that the hotel did not issue a seasons greeting to all its customers- the only note we had for Christmas was from the maid who placed a note on Christmas eve wishing up a Happy Christmas- presumably looking for a tip the next day- which we did give. I realise not everyone celebrates Christmas but it would have been a nice touch from the hotel management- as it was, it seemed impersonal and they took down the Christmas tree first thing on Boxing Day- did the Grinch arrive? Rooms were clean but again maid service erratic. For example, most days we were given enough toilet rolls etc but some days, they forgot to top up the coffee, milk. Some rooms had kettles and some had none but you could ask for one and always delivered. The classic cars were a nice touch- but you do need to tip but at least you arrive in style. There is a route to the underground- to PATH and malls- very convenient if the weather is cold. When we were there, it was absudly mild for Christmas/New Year- should not complain...some days we had to turn the air con on in the room- it was too warm to sleep at night! Staff varied- generally very very helpful and friendly, Conciege were helpful but we believe there is a fairly high staff turnover and we are not sure why this is, unless it is a feature of the industry. Good breakfast places nearby e.g. Overeasy(rather pricey), Richtree which is a food marketplace catering for different tastes- a good bet if you have a family with different culinary likes and dislikes and of course Tim Hortons which is not only reasonably priced but with tasty fast food. We never ate in the hotel, we found the menu range bland and standard. There is really no need to eat in the hotel given the choice around. Also very handy is a Shoppers Drug Mart across the road with Canada Post in it. No queues- go the Mart near Eaton and it is mobbed. Eaton is only 3 blocks away as is Nathan Philips Sq. Also walking distance to the CN Tower. There is a Dominion Supermarket about 7 minutes walk away where you can shop for washing powder etc.. don't bother buying these items in the hotel if you are staying for more than a few days. After spending nearly $4500 CAN in the place and having spent quite a while there over the festive period, we did get an upgrade for our second visit. What was really good was they kept our luggage for us between stays as we could not fit them all into the hired car when we headed to the snow in Algonquin. This is our 10 th visit to Toronto in as many years and we have generally stayed in a range of places from the bottom end e.g. Town Inn Suites and Comfort Inn to Sheraton and Intercontinental. This place is about location, location, location.This was a good experience and we would probably book One King West again simply for the location and the varied room prices.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Bluetax
Reviews.Content: well i chose this hotel having reviewed the trip advisor website - and my expectations were surpassed from even the rave reviews posted here! great location - right in the heart of the city. the building is the former TD bank headquarters to which they have built a 50 storey extension on the side of - sounds kind of weird but really works. the old vaults are still there and if you are there on business i believe you can still book the old boardroom and chairman's office. we booked a tower suite in order to get the view - we were not disappointed - our room was on the 45th floor and was large and comfortable and the view spectacular! the staff were very helpful and indeed searched high and low to find us a restaurant open for christmas eve (thank you Helen on reception!) and booked us into Mortons of Chicago (also recommended but you really need only order one steak between two or no starters - i actually don't think i have ever seen steaks that large before!!). we also got to use the complimentary transport to take us to and from the restaurant as no one else had booked it - quote of " i really like this car" from my girlfriend received a hearty "don't get used to it!" - it was a ROLLS ROYCE!! room service also good and prompt. rooms also have microwaves, washing machines and tumble dryers and the lobby can supply washing powder. one small point would have been that with only a tiny effort in room layout hey could have got a bath into the bathroom not just a large shower. we booked from the link here and that was much cheaper than through the hotel direct.

Reviews.Title: “great extended stay”
Reviews.Author: BubbaLove
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto for business and stayed at the Suites for 8 weeks in November and December. It was a delightful stay. My room was not big, but well thought out. The design of the room was chic and the bed was very comfortable. I had a separate bath & shower and the room was complete with a kitchenette, dishwasher & washer/drier. Not all the rooms have a bathtub, so if this is important to you, be sure to specify when making your reservation. I stayed in the historic section of the hotel which has fantastic 14 foot ceilings, however the windows were a bit drafty. Staying in the new tower offers views of the city. The fitness center was very modern, but small for a hotel this size. The sauna was great, but the hot tub had frequent problems. The antique car service is a unique perk. Be sure to reserve in advance if you want a lift on the weekends. There were some kinks with this new hotel, but the staff could not have been any nicer, even when they couldn't quickly handle some issues. The location of this hotel is FANTASTIC! You can walk to many nearby attractions. Or the King Street Subway station is directly beneath the hotel, & you don't even have to go outside to connect to it or the PATH system. The street car also stops in front of the hotel. There are many great restaurants nearby. (I suggest going out or eating at the lobby bar rather than ordering room service.) I would definitely stay here again. The charm of staying in an old bank is very cool, and it is a terrific value!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Suites”
Reviews.Author: kstuart123
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, Went there with my girlfriend for 5 nights and absolutly excellent. We order food through room service was cheap and very very quick. If you book through the internet for this hotel you can get it alot cheaper, i booked it through expedia which was the cheapest place i could find it. They were also very helpfull at the hotel, for example one night i was taking my girlfriend out for a meal so they suggested a reasturant and also rented out of their private cars to take us there for free. Great hotel, recommended A++++++

Reviews.Title: “I'll Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: LelandGirl
Reviews.Content: Quite a nice hotel especially when you consider the rate, its location and the fact that the entire establishment is smoke-free (a definite advantage from our point of view). The rooms are studio-like and I loved the in-unit laundry. Had a problem with the room the first day we were there. We were asked to wait for the room because of a "routine" carpet-cleaning, we were fine with leaving our luggage with another couple who were travelling with us and got their room assigned already. Anyhow, when we finally got up to the room, it was roomier than the one our friends got (a good sign). I could smell a hint of the carpet cleaning agent and smoke but thought I was being overly sensitive. After a while though as we were unloading, I noticed some red wine stains on the window treatments and carpet (whoever cleaned it must have missed these spots earlier). We rang the front desk and they apologised for the experience and gave us a room with the same view on another floor and offered to come up for our luggage. The staff members were very helpful and took care of us during our 5-day stay, we took advantage of the classic car rides to local restaurants and they even arranged a stretched limo to take us to the airport. All in all, I'll definitely stay here when visiting Toronto again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JG-TRIP
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Suites for 4 nights in December and could not fault it at all. We stayed on the 21st floor and the views over the lake were spectacular. The rooms were modern, clean and very well equipped . The bed was extremely large and so comfortable we found it hard to leave and brave the cold outside, it was minus 10c outside but the suites and the hotel lobby were very warm and welcoming. We found the staff and service excellent, In particular the concierge who went out of his way to help us find directions and book excursions. What made this hotel even better was the location, I doubt there is a better located hotel for shopping and sight seeing , right on the corner of Yonge Street and 15 mins walk to the lake shore and all major attractions. This is one of the best city hotels we have stayed in and would not hesitate to recommend it to fellow travellers

Reviews.Title: “loved the suites”
Reviews.Author: WenKat
Reviews.Content: The suites on one king west was one of the nicest hotels I have stayed at. We were on the 42nd floor with a spectacular view. The bed was super comfortable and our room had a fridge, microwave, dishwasher, washer and dryer plus utensils (including a wine opener). The staff was pleasant and very helpful. The location is perfect too. The only drawback we had was when the heat vent came on it was very loud. It woke us out of a sound sleep. We will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value at the Suites!!”
Reviews.Author: Cupper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were Toronto for the evening to see a show. The hotel had a wonderful package deal that included a studio suite, dinner at the Dominion Club (in the hotel) and transportation to and from the show for $195 plus taxes! This was such an incredible deal, we had to take it! Not only was the price enticing, but the service we experienced from the front desk to the valet was absolutely top notch! The room was very modern and offered a kitchenette equipped with a microwave, mini fridge and mini dishawsher. It was also convenient that the room has a small washer and dryer, if you needed it. My husband and I also worked out at the gym. It was located on the 17th floor and the view was very motivating and breathtaking. There were also top of the line fitness equipment and two hot tubs to use after to relax. Dinner was fabulous and considering we only paid $240 with taxes for the whole package, our dinner was a steal and was worth a value of $170! We were chauffered to and from the show in an old rolls royce that maintained the historical and old charm the hotel has to offer. This mini stay in Toronto was worth every penny and I can't wait to spend another night at this marvelous hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent overall value”
Reviews.Author: esyho
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, top-notch value. While you're there, do try the Dominion Club Restaurant, wonderful food and service. Definitely will come back, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Can't get much better!”
Reviews.Author: cmckee1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel is almost perfect and we were so glad we decided to book based on the reviews on TripAdvisor. Location is perfect and as stated in previous posts the subway line and streetcars are right outside the front door. The hotel is also within walking distance to Union Station, Eaton Centre and City Hall (all of which can be walked via the PATH which is connected to the hotel) . We took the 'Rocketbus' and connecting subway ride's from the Airport to the hotel and back and found it a very cheap option if you don't have too much luggage. The subway stop is right outside the hotel so not much walking required. Check-in was fine and staff were very friendly and accommodating. The concierge service and complimentary car service are excellent and the room was cleaned everyday by the maid's who do a very fine job. The room itself is excellent and more than worth the price. The decor is great and the kitchenette is very handy, although it does miss a proper kettle (a cafetiere is supplied). The bed is very comfortable and the perfect size for a great nights sleep. We were on the 38th floor and the views of downtown at night were quite impressive. We did have lake views but not as much as we would have liked. The food was good and very reasonably priced. We spent a lot of time at the Richtree Market Restaurant around the corner (breakfast, lunch and dinner) which we would recommend as a must do just for the experience. The Beer Bistro also became a bit of a local and again this is a must for anyone who can drink a beer or two. The staff were excellent and the food and drink was awesome. The Irish Embassy Pub is across the street and well worth a visit. All in all a great hotel at a great price!!

Reviews.Title: “#1 at Suites on 1 King West...”
Reviews.Author: Mongo1
Reviews.Content: One King West did not disappoint. I was on site for four consecutive nights end of oct and first 3 days of November. I booked and received a rate of $149.00 plus taxes. The room was a great deal. It was a king suite on the 15th floor. The problem I had was that the windows looked out onto nothing but a large ventâ€¦no daylight. It appears I was in one of a few rooms that opened into the buildings infrastructure interiorâ€¦.this problem appears to be corrected at the 17th floor above. The room was in constant heat mode with no cool air available. I asked to have the matter corrected however it never was. Staff/Service; Excellent. Any requests were handled with a smile and in an efficient manner except my non air conditioned matter. Room; Carpet was worn/stained however the room was clean every day. The facilities within the room were well maintained and efficient for everyday use. The room was well appointed and left little more required. Common facilities; These were excellent. It had a great health center for adults however any kids may notice the non-pool concept. The health/athletic center is one of the best I have seen in my travels. The elevators as previously reported were slow however did not have too much of an impact on my daily schedule. The lobby area was impeccable. It was not over powering. It had an exclusive club type of feel and was well laid out. Check in and checkout was fast. It was obvious staff knew their job and enjoyed working there. Other lobby staff was equally courteous and available to answer all questions. Location; They say location is everything, and here it is just that. Located on Younge Street in the city core you are close to everything. Having a cook facility in your room you are just two blocks from a major chain grocery store open 24 hours. If you are a non cook and on vacation I challenge you to figure out where to eat in a timely fashion. There are so many first class eateries within this area you will be dumbfounded. The subway is in the basement of the building and can be accessed at street level on the buildings east/north sides. Most convenient way to travel if the subway meets your destination needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent room”
Reviews.Author: Therooster
Reviews.Content: This hotel is smack bang in the middle of town, so if you want a central location this is as good as it gets. My room on the 15th floor was very nice. It was clean and comfortable. Importantly, it was very large and even had a balcony. Not many rooms have a balcony, so if you want one you may want to ask when you make your reservation. I think I booked a standard room with king size bed, but I suspect I may have gotten something better, though no one mentioned an upgrade (the room struck me as too good for the price of a standard room). The bathroom was fine, though not very big, and the room also came with a kitchenette, washing machine, dryer, and fridge. Sadly the fridge was empty, but 24h room service fixed that. The food was good. The complimentary transportation service around the city in vintage luxury cars (Bentley, Rolls etc) was a nice touch and the drivers were very friendly. I only had two small problems with this hotel. First, the window above the door to the balcony could not be obscured with a curtain, so the morning sun woke me up earlier than I would have wished for. Second, I ordered room service twice (a late night meal and a breakfast) and both times they managed to mess up my order by failing to deliver part of it. This was quite annoying as I had to wait a while for them to go back and get what they forgot. The fact that 100% of the times I ordered food something didn't arrive is what really prevents me from giving this place full marks. Overall though, a great place to stay and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “1st Anniversary was great!”
Reviews.Author: stellargirl21
Reviews.Content: We visited Toronto for our first wedding anniversary. We drove to Toronto and it took a little under 4 hours (driving from about 30 minutes north of Detroit). When we arrived to the city, we weren't used to the big city driving. We could see our hotel, but it was a little tough to actually find the little side street that we had to turn down to actually get to the front of the hotel. Once we arrived though, the valet was there to take our car, and the bellhop loaded our bags and we went and checked in. We had no problems checking in, and were in our room in about 5 minutes. The room was nice with a full kitchenette that even included a washer and dryer!! We were in room 3612. We have no major complaints with this hotel except that the room service seemed to take FOREVER! My husband just ordered beer one night and it took almost an hour! All in all though, we had a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “thanks trip advisor”
Reviews.Author: eleanorp
Reviews.Content: Thanks to trip advisor I have just returned from a stay at suites at king street. I work hard at anything I book and when we decided to go to Toronto as part of our trip I went straight on to trip advisor to check out the hotels.The suites looked interesting.I called my travel agent but they did not have it listed..i tried a few others but none had heard of it so I just took the chance and thanks to you we were delighted.Because the price was very good we were worried we were going to a dump.Oh we were so wrong.It was spotless.The room was lovely,the beds were so comfortable.The staff helpful and polite.They are still doing things to it and when it is finished it will be amazing.The vault in the basement will be a sports bar.They have left the safe door it looks great.The breakfast room is the grandhall of the bank with old leather chairs.I could go on and on.If you are going to Toronto,give it a try you will not be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great!”
Reviews.Author: MartinaZT
Reviews.Content: We booked our three-night stay at this hotel after reading the great reviews on tripadvisor and can only recommend it yet again. We had a studio suite on the 28th floor, it was immaculately clean, spacious and quiet. All the staff are friendly and helpful and can't do enough for you.
