We had the buffet breakfast on the Sunday morning ($14.95 each for the full monty or $8.95 each for continental) and it was very good, lots of choice, all fresh etc. We booked one of the complimentary classic cars for a lift to the car rental at union street and it was great fun. If we return to Toronto this hotel would be our first choice. If you don't fancy the hotel food, try Richtree's Market Restaurant at 42 Yonge Street (5 mins away) for breakfast, lunch or dinner - great fresh food and you only pay for what you want. You can also have it as take away. Only one word of warning - we booked an airport pickup via the hotel website, asking for the $60 service. The service is run by a separate company. The guy turned up in a stretch limo which he parked in the multi storey so we had to walk all the way over there...and then he charged us $85 which is the VIP service. We were too tired to argue but thought we'd warn people about it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: DilbertAndFriends
Reviews.Content: The hotel is comprised of two buildings, one is the original bank (complete with vault) and the other is a tower connected to it. I stayed in the original bank building on the fifth floor. The room was large and had high ceilings and was well furnished. The only minor problem was that being on the fifth floor there was some traffic noise but with the room facing Yonge Street it was to be expected. The traffic noise was usually gone by 9pm. The hotel is connected to the P.A.T.H by a door just by the bank vault, very handy for those rainy days. The hotel also has the King Street subway station underneath so there is easy access to the subway. For the money I paid for the room I would say that it was excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, Beautiful view, Lobby under construction”
Reviews.Author: minibargrrl
Reviews.Content: The Suites at One King West is a funky unique hotel. Note: During Aug 2006, the lobby was undergoing construction, it is my understanding this was a residence that is turning into a hotel. The first room we were given reeked of cigarrette smoke, and we were moved quickly. Our second room was fine, the view of the water and city was amazing for the cost! It includes a kichenette, although oddly designed. The elevators can be a problem, you can wait quite a while for one. The hotel has fun old cars they are willing to drive you to close locations too - don't forget to tip. The staff of the hotel is very helpful, although very young and unsure of themselves. The food is NOT GOOD at this hotel. We ordered room service a few times and it was so awful (do not order a burger) that we had to get take out because we couldn't eat it! Even the desserts are bad! I think this will be a great hotel in about a year, once they figure out the kinks!

Reviews.Title: “King of Suites!”
Reviews.Author: bertieg
Reviews.Content: One of the main reasons for choosing this hotel for our trip to Toronto is the positive reviews it got, plus we got a really good deal from the site we bought our trip from. We got an excellent price for such a good hotel. Let's get the negatives out of the way first. The hotel is fairly new and it seems as though the staff may be still in training or not used to their jobs yet as they are a little slack. Don't get me wrong , everyone we spoke to was very nice and polite, it's just that the service could be a bit better. For instance we ordered breakfast on our first morning which never turned up, we had to call reception to find out what happened, however we did get our meal eventually - they did get the order wrong though. But these niggles are far out-weighed by the positives. Firstly, the room was great. It was spacious, and had all the mod cons you could want - fridge, washer-dryer, microwave oven and dishwasher. Secondly the location was great too. Their was a subway stop and streetcar stop right outside the hotel plus a lot of the downtown places to visit are walking distance and the entertainment district, which has theatres, bars and restaurants aplenty, is only a 10 min walk or quick streetcar ride away. Another nice feature of the hotel is that you can book one of their fabulous classic cars to take you anywhere in the vicinity ...for free! We took a rather nice Bentley to the CN tower, which was rather nice - I could've got used to that! Overall a great hotel and one where we would stay again. If they could tighten up the service it would make 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: smokeydope
Reviews.Content: just got back from Toronto yesterday and had a great time at the Suites. Have been on several city breaks and usually spend about Â£70-80 a night for a room and the suites was the best room we have stayed in so far. Got there on evening so early check in was not a problem for us. The desk staff were helpful throughout the stay , helping us with things we forgot to bring with us from uk and giving directions etc. Stayed onthe 27th floor and the view was fabulous. Looked across to the Harbourfront and the Islands and the CN Tower , couldn't ask for more. No street noise but each floor does have air vents on the outside wall which makes a low humming noise( got used to it after one night) The rooms are decorated nicely and the beds are big ( king or larger?). There is a desk and leather chair and big wardrobe and big tv with dvd player and fully equiped kitchenette with dishwasher and washer/dryer( hotel does laundry pack with machine powder and tumble dryer sheets etc for only $3 or Â£1.50 and lots of other hotel packs e.g refreshments and movies) Bathroom is medium in size with a shower( no bath) and nice tolietries. Hotel has restaurant which we used on first night as too tired to go out and thr food was lovely and a really good price. Did not use gym or pool as out all day but had a look and the gym had good equipment but the pool is only small enough to bathe in not swim. Hotel is right next to the King subway which can get you to most places and there are loads of restaurants and shops in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Good Selection”
Reviews.Author: Mygree22
Reviews.Content: This hotel did not allow for early check in, which is fine but gave us a really bad excuse, saying that our specific room wasn't available and it had to be inspected. When we returned at check in time it still wasn't ready for the same reason and the woman at the front desk offer a room upgrade that was ready then (a better suite). Upon entry to the room it was already occupied and to both my and the woman surprise we caught her undress. We just went right in, which in hindsight was a real security breech. Back down at the desk they did nothing to compensate the matter, only offering us our original room that was then ready. The room was extremely cold, with no windows to look out of. The windows were about 12 feet from the floor. Even after placing the heat as high as it could go, it was still freezing and the staff never returned our request to have someone check it. The end result is that both my husband and myself came home seriously sick. This hotel which is a renovated bank should not be listed as a hotel, but actually as mini apartments or condos or something to that affect. It is not the place to take your vacation. Especially at the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: markolw
Reviews.Content: Wow. WOW. What an incredible hotel this is. For $149 CDN/night I got a FULL suite - almost apartment size, which makes sense since some of the units in the hotel are available for sale as well. Pros: Location. A block and a half away from the Hockey Hall of Fame, easy walking distance from Union Station, very close to Yonge St. nightlife, tons of great restaurants nearby, etc, etc. Living room: Yes, a FULL living room with comfy couch, lounge chair with ottoman, very modern but still very comfy styling. Great TV and DVD player included. Bedroom: An absoultely AMAZING bed - easily the equivalent of Westin's Heaenly Bed. Includes another large TV and a full desk/office area. Kitchen: A wonderful kitchen area that even included a full clothes washer/dryer in the cabinets! A nice drawer-style dishwasher, microwave, sink, etc. Bath: Wonderful size, including a large soaking tub, unlike the tiny tubs that most chains use. It wasn't a Jacuzzi, but still nice and deep. Great selection of Neutrogena toiletries were provided. View: Wow. A million dollar view of the city and the lake. Lobby: This used to be a bank - and you can still see the large vault downstairs! A nice touch was historic pictures of the building and area on many of the public area walls. Room service: I'm used to being charged an arm and a leg for room service, but that's NOT the case here! I got a FULL breakfast with large food portions, including drink, taxes, etc for only $13! An amazing bargain for this quality of a hotel. Con: The only one I can think of is that the elevators are a tiny bit slow. That's it. Overall: I'd say for the money this is, by far, the finest hotel I've ever stayed at, and I've travelled extensively all over the world. For the size of the room, the quality of the furnishings, the great staff, great location - the Suites at 1 King West can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit - super hotel”
Reviews.Author: KPaul
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this propery for a short getaway, and we loved it! The valet parking and check-in procedure were fast and friendly; the suite spacious, spotless and well equipped; the elevators fast (the first time we went to the Suites they were very slow). As with our last stay, the central location in the heart of Toronto, close to the primary shopping, restaurant and theater attractions meant we didn't have to use the car - walking to most of what we wanted to see, as well as using their classic car service, served us very well. This time we tried out the main restaurant and found it very good - it is in a converted historic banking hall with a very detailed high ceiling with the coats of arms of the provinces of Canada. Very nice atmosphere. Room service breakfast was so-so; cool french toast and bottled orange juice (rather than the advertised fresh squeezed!) We total recommend this hotel and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: simonp820
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in September (booked through Expedia). Top notch place. Great sized suites with comfy bed and average bathroom. Superb views, great staff/management, free limo service, 10 mins walk to CN Tower, 5 mins to downtown. Not much more I can really say - would definately visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: lmptd
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights in August and the air conditioning was not functioning properly. The first night, I just slept uncomfortably. The next morning, I called the front desk and someone came to "fix" the problem. I left for most of the day after that, but the room was still hot when I returned. They sent someone to fix the problem again, to no avail. I insisted on moving to another room -- which was hotter still. Finally, I ended up moving back to the original room. The person at the front desk claimed that there was no way that they could compensate me for the inconvenience since I booked my hotel through expedia (except they gave me a free drink at the hotel restaurant -- very generous....) Not how I wanted to spend my last night in Toronto! Other than that, the rooms were very nice and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: gmhaggis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days either end of a recent vacation to Canada. Only a few blocks walk from both Union (VIA Rail) station and the Fairmont Royal York Hotel setdown/pickup point for the Airport Express bus. This is an easy 10 minute walk (assuming you can carry any luggage which you might be carrying). On both stays checkin was straightforward and staff were efficient and pleasant enough. The standard studio suites were modern, well equiped, very spacious and clean. Also included a kitchenette area with facilities including hob, microwave, washer, dryer and ample crockery. Note that if you use these facilities then detergents/dish towels can be provided by the hotel at extra cost (or bring your own). Wired internet connection is availalble in the room. On my first stay when asking about usng this was told the cost was $5/day, but this also included unlimited long distance phone calls. I requested this for the first day, but the internet remained avaialble for the remainer of my stay (was still only charged for one day). On the second stay I didn't request the internet, but it still worked (and I was not charged for it). It could be that there system for controlling this is not working. The lobby/reception area was very pleasant and also included the bar. I did not use the hotel restaurant, but did have a few bar meals which were excellent (and reasonably priced). There is a metro streetcar stop just outside the hotel entrance and if you're a caffeine addict there's a Starbucks just across the street. The Eaton shopping center is a few blocks walk along Yonge Street. I also managed to get an excellent rate for this hotel (for both stays) from Expedia and this was significantly cheaper than the hotel's advertised rate. One word or warning, if booking through Expedia (and probably using other online agencies) you can't claim the visitors tax refund on the GST paid on the room. I would definitely stay here again on any furture Toronto visit and highy recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Egglin
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Suites at 1 King West for 5 nights in September. Though we only stayed on the 16th floor we were very happy with our room. Everything we needed. As mentioned in all the other reviews we had the mini kitchen. Great to have the washer /dryer for clothes. The front Desk staff were pleasent and effiencent. We didn't bother with the front desk after that as we had all the information we needed. There are plenty of brouchures in the Lobby if you are a tourist and wondering what to do. The Subway is right outside the door. The hotel is only one 2 blocks from the Eaton Centre( Shopping). Loads of eateries and restaurants on the hotels doorstep. Overall a great stay and would recommend it to anyone going to Toronto be it for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Rob.Rugg
Reviews.Content: We live in Toronto, but we wanted a little break. We decided on the Suites at 1 King W, because it was new and impressive. The rooms are one of the best parts of the hotel because they are all unique and larger than a single room, but smaller than a traditional 2 bed hotel room. The impressive part is the lobby, and the ornate details throughout the historical part. Although some part of the hotel is under construction, you can see how the results will be stunning. The one thing that I wish I did utilize was the free limo service, but I have no idea how to access that. Overall amazing hotel room, service, and location.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Hotel & City”
Reviews.Author: chris036
Reviews.Content: The Suites at 1 King West is one of Toronto's most unmistakable buildings. Once a bank, the 12 storey main building now has a 49 storey oval skysraper planted on top and as such this hotel affords the most elevated view of Toronto - take a look around the City and see if you can find a hotel that's taller !! The lobby is plush and reminiscent of it's days as a financial centre, with the Bank Vault occupying a central position for all to see. Check in was efficient and friendly, we were located on the 42nd floor following my booking request of 'a high floor with a view'. We were not disappointed in any way, with an East facing uninterrupted view across the City & Lake Ontario. The Suite was perhaps smaller than my expectations, but nevertheless was spotlessly clean, and well laid out. Only downside here was the small bathroom, which had no bathtub - very unusual from my travelling experiences across North America. But the kitchenette had just about everything, including dishwasher, washing machine, tumbledryer, microwave, coffee maker, cutlery & plates and fridge. On the 5th floor is a fitness centre, with 2 whirlpools and 2 saunas. Breakfast is served in the massive Dominion Hall on the 2nd floor and was quite an engaging experience ! (tip - it's easier to reach the Hall from the lobby than changing elevators at the 12th floor). Being the landmark that it is, you will struggle NOT to find this Hotel. If you are using the Metro it's located at the top of the steps of King station. We travelled from Pearson Airport by express bus and walked from Union station, which took about 10 minutes with luggage. Excellent hotel, well located in a superb City. Full marks.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, a bit on the small side”
Reviews.Author: Jess500
Reviews.Content: We stayed at 1 King West for 2 nights and had a very enjoyable stay. We were a bit surprised at the small size of the room and the awkward, corner window. However, the room was well appointed and comfortable. They do need to add some counter space in the bathroom, which is also very small. The room was very clean and the bed and duvet comfortable. A large fridge, kitchen sink, dishwasher as well as washer, dryer and microwave were convenient to have in the room. We did make use of the jacuzzi and sauna one night, and they were wonderful. The staff we dealt with were very friendly. We would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Would come back anytime I'm in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: RWC99
Reviews.Content: Fantastic experience! Lovely hotel, great location (with Starbucks right out the front door!), close to many great restaurants and big name shops. Rooms (suites) are AMAZING - dishwasher, laundry washer and dryer! Bathroom is lovely (I had a large walk-in shower), room is large. Front desk staff are friendly and efficient, as are door/bell staff. Nothing to complain about! Definately would return when I have the chance!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: trvlguy39
Reviews.Content: The Suites One King West is a great and wonderful hotel. The staff was very helpful and kind. The room I had, the Premium Suite was very comfortable and roomy. The bedding was quite comfortable. The bathroom amenities were good. Maid service was on a timely basis. Even the other furniture in the room was quite comfortable to sit on. The vintage car service was great. Even though I was able to get service the same night, it is recomended that you reserve your car service at least 24 hours ahead of time. The lobby bar seemed like the place to be. Good drinks fair price. The Dominon Resturant was just ok. The food was your typical hotel food. The service was a little slow. The hotel directs you to the resturant via the 12th floor, this is a little confusing, would reccomend entering via the lobby. Suites One King West is a good value and it is an up and coming 5 star hotel. It does have good potiental. Would definately stay there again. This hotel is in a great location. My next visit to Toronto I would most definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at 1 King West”
Reviews.Author: rwoody
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at this new hotel in the Financial District. Front desk staff were very nice and efficient. Although the rooms are labeled suites, ours was more like an fairly large hotel room with extra amenities (fridge, microwave, washer/dryer, etc.). Still, it was more than adequate, and quite comfy and clean. The views from the upper floors are fantastic. For convenience, it can't be beat. There is a subway stop at the hotel as well as an entrance to the PATH (underground shopping), but the best part is that antique cars are available to take you wherever you want for free (reserve in advance and tip the driver of course). The restaruant (Dominion Club) has an impressive atmoshpere and is very reasonably priced. However, while we found the breakfast to be good we were much less impressed with dinner there. Had it not been raining buckets we would have ventured out to one of Toronto's many fine restaurants. Nevertheless, it is a find and reasonably priced (at least for now) hotel. I would stay there again and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “One the best hotels I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: LorraineR
Reviews.Content: When I was trying to find a hotel in Toronto, I found that they were probably rather more expensive than I had expected. That said I did want a hotel in downtown. The room I booked at 1 King West was booked about 10 weeks before my visit at $159. When I checked in I was allocated a room on the 42nd floor! The room was superb - clean/bright/good bed/ good facilities (coffee maker/washing machine/dishwasher/microwave/and lots of microwaveable dishes) and a fantastic view! Lifts were good - so often in hotels you have to wait for ages for the lift to arrive, only to find it is full when it gets to you - not here - plenty of capacity. I can not recommend this hotel highly enough. It is probably one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in the City”
Reviews.Author: globalgourmet
Reviews.Content: Wow! Thanks to Trip Advisor for this gem of a place. I got an Expedia special at $92/night plus taxes (US) for this centrally located, one-year-old four-star equivalent. Huge, roomy suite (even at this rate, they gave me an upgrade) with an office area, kitchen/living area, bedroom area and roomy bath. Kitchen includes mini-dishwasher, washer and dryer, microwave, dishes, the whole bit. The building is a former downtown bank skyscraper, now a private club below and a combination of hotel and apartments above. Since they're still new, it's worth it to hunt out a special, even though they're a good deal at their rack rate of $149 Canadian. It may be worth calling them directly after you've found your best rate online. The hotel features four classic limos, incuding a Rolls Royce Silver Spur, guests can reserve at no charge for transportation in the local area. I paid an additional $4.99 Canadian a day for high-speed Internet access AND unlimited calls anywhere in Canada and the US. This is really quite a deal. Only rough edges: no concierge yet and the young bell staff they have filling in are not very well informed. And the maid service still has a few rough edges: plastic bags in garbage cans installed with air inside so the anything tossed into them bounces right out, toilet paper and other amenities not always replaced--and no spares in room. But these are minor and will be worked out--my guess--as the place hits its stride. Excellent value. Thanks to those who stayed before me and pointed me in this direction! PS The hot tub is great and the fitness room well equipped, but the "pool" is really just a cold plunge about the same size as the hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: tmarch291
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Suites at 1 King West from 8/26/06 to 8/29/06. I booked at hotels.com, so I got a rate of $93 CDN a night, which is amazing for a four star hotel. I got a studio suite on the 19th floor (Suite 1902) and it had great views of King Street. Service was great....everybody had a smile on their face and they were always willing to help. I ate breakfast in the Dominion Club the first morning I was there. The food was OK, but it wasn't that expensive. The thing I liked most about this hotel was that they didn't nickel and dime you (cough, cough, WESTIN.) Internet access and unlimited phone was only $4.99 a night and rides in the cars were free. My only complaint was that they made you pay $2.00 for dish detergent and laundry powder. They probably should provide that for free, since many other hotels do so. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at 1 King West and I hope to be back there soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: sethdr
Reviews.Content: This hotel was spacious, quiet and very clean. I would sum up the negative points of some other reviews by saying that this property is new and they are clearly still working on "opening" and getting their procedures in place. We had a glitch with our cards upon check-in and the staff upgraded us to a deluxe 2-room suite on the 44th floor with views on 3 sides. We moved to this hotel after having a bad experience at the Cosmpolitan, which is right across the street. We did not have any problems or costs involved with getting our car in and out, and another cool benefit is that the concierge staff has a fleet of vintage cars (Bentley, '60 Cadillac, Rolls) with drivers who will take you to various downtown sites for free (with an advance reservation).

Reviews.Title: “NoKaOi......Second to None!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NoKaOi34
Reviews.Content: An awesome ending to a great vacation..... We always enjoy spending a couple days in Toronto after Induction Weekend at Baseball Hall of Fame. First time at Suites at King West and will definitely be back again. Upper level accomodations with great view of skyline including CN Tower. Took advantage of Lord of the Rings theatre package which was second to none. Only negative was that some things were still "under construction." Highly reccomended!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One King West is a City Centre Gem”
Reviews.Author: RoseEngland
Reviews.Content: I booked late but got an excellent rate online for a stay in July 2006. I am a woman travelling alone from the UK, and had not been to Toronto before so was keen to stay somewhere safe and comfortable in the city centre. This hotel was such a great find and if I go back to Toronto I would not consider staying anywhere else. I am well travelled and expect high standards and this hotel did not disappoint. The suite had amazing views of the city. The room was excellent with every amenity you could need and was spotlessly clean. Other reviews have complained about the time you have to wait for the lifts but I was on the 46th floor and every single time I used the lift it was there almost instantly so I definitely disagree with those comments. I also received excellent service at the front desk, as well as in the lobby bar and the restaurant. I only ate breakfast at the hotel but it was good with lots of choice. Rates at this hotel are way below others of a similar standard in the city and I might therefore have thought I would get an inferior product. This is definitely not the case here and I would really recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a hotel right in the centre of the city, who appreciates excellent accommodation, and expects good service. I couldn't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay there”
Reviews.Author: choon
Reviews.Content: Booked the Suites because of favourable reviews here and wasn't disappointed at all. The tower room might not resemble 'a suite' but it was spacious, clean, well-equipped with everything a holiday couple would need. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. We had a good view of the surrounding. The location, although in the financial district, has enough restaurants we could walk to. The Path [underground pathway] links the hotel to most places downtown. We were there for 3 nights and were very happy there. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Hotel Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: goopguy123
Reviews.Content: After reading the great reviews of The Suites at One Key West in Toronto on your website, we decided to make a reservation. The rates were so incredibly inexpensive that we were a little apprehensive, but, decided to take a chance. The hotel exceeded our expectations! The rooms were brand new. They were extremely clean, the beds were unbelievably comfortable and we had a refrigerator, washer & dryer, and microwave. The service was superb. We were treated like we were VIP's at a 5-star hotel. The valets and concierge were extremely helpful, as were the desk staff. We parked our car with the valet and didn't need it again for the entire stay. We were chauffered around in either a vintage Rolls Royce or Bentley by the professional staff for no charge (we did tip them though). It was such a nice touch to a wonderful vacation. We highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: AsaMe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on two different occations in August for 5 nights and we were really satisfied. Very nice suites , fully equipped and modern. Staff was great ( taking out a Bently when taxi drivers refused the short trip to The Fairmont Royal York with heavy bags) and location perfect. I later checked in at the Fairmont Royal York for the AIDS conference , but it was not nearly as good as the suites, which suprised me a lot. I would highly recommend this hotel. Also very good price when booking ahead on the internet. Ã…sa Mellgren , Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card overcharged - don't get the business package”
Reviews.Author: kuma2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in August 2006. The room was clean and the hotel was well-located. Upon check-in, I was offered their "business package" (or something like that) which includes all long distance calls (within NA). When I checked out, I was charged for both the long distance calls *and* the business package (two separate bills on my credit card). I have called them a few times, but have not received a call back. At some point, it is a waste of my time to keep tracking down a $12 refund. By the way, the business package also promises internet, but beware that (at least in my room) there is no internet jack or wireless; the only "internet" is dial-up. On the plus side, I did enjoy the view of the moon rising over the lake.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: RenoTourist
Reviews.Content: Fantastic value. Perfect location. We got a special via Travelocity at only $85 USD per night with $25 Canadian parking and it was truely a treat. The rooms are small, in fact, very small, as are the bathrooms but are well furnished. The kitchen won't prepare anything unless you can cook with a microwave but the fridge was large for a mini. King size beds and very comfortable. Quiet in all respects. The higher the floor the larger the room and the better the view. Our's was the 13th and it barely could see the lake. It goes up to over 40. Don't bring a car if you can avoid it. The limo service is free but requires an advance reservation, not always available. The subway is just next door and goes about wherever most tourist sites are. Grocery stores are nearby and fairly cheap. Go northeast, not south or west. The lobby and bar are great. Free newspaper. Highly recommended, especially if you get a prepaid deal as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but so-so place”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nites in June 2006. This hotel advertises itself as "SUITES" at 1 King West. I think this is false advertising. My husband & I had a very nice ROOM at a reasonable rate for downtown Toronto, but it was by no means a "suite". It was actually one room with a very small bathroom plus a counter with a sink , a microwave & small frig on the counter and a small dishwasher & small washer & dryer under the counter. It was nice . . . but I guess when I hear the word "suite" I think of more than one room - - - usually a bedroom separate from the living area . . . something like Embassy Suites offers. This was a strange place. We had a terrible time just finding it!! There is no name or address on the front of the building! You have to drive around on a side street to the back of the hotel. When we arrived in our room it was very warm. After looking all around for the thermostat we found that is was BEHIND a very large combination closet/TV armoire. We could not see it to adjust the temperature! We called the desk to see if maybe they had an answer or another room for us. After only 15 minutes the Gen. Manager & a big security guy appeared at our door and moved this huge armoire over about 12 inches so we could get at the thermometer. I have to give the manager a plus for that. This was a nice place but I do resent the fact that its rooms are billed as "suites".

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the Heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: McNewfie72
Reviews.Content: I recently spent two nights at The Suites on King in Toronto. The hotel is very affordable, clean and comfortable. It is also within walking distacne of many Toronto attractions including the Skydome, CN Tower, Air canada Centre and shopping. Again the price was unbeatable. The staff very friendly and the hotel itself was very cool. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Chiefy
Reviews.Content: My expectations were high after reading all the reviews, and I can honestly say that our stay was near perfection. From the minute we drove up and were greeted by the valet, we knew this was going to be an experience. The car was whisked away, and we entered abeautiful lobby.Check in seemed as though they were waiting for us, and we were in our suite on the 32nd flooor in minutes. The accomodations were absolutely 5 star, with an immaculate room, all the amenities that other reviewers spoke about, and a view of the city and the lake that was amazing. The hotel was quiet, with no outside noise. You would think we were alone in the hotel. We walked quite a bit, and the concierge staff was quick with suggestions and directions. We also took a ride one afternoon in one of the antique Cadillacs, which was a nice treat. I would return to the Suites at 1 King West in a heartbeat. The location was a few blocks from the Rodgers Centre and two blocks away from a busy retail/shopping area that the girls had a blast in. Overall, if I could give this hotel more than 5 stars, I would. I can't remember any names of the staff in particular, but each and every one of them seemed to be dedicated to ensuring that my family had the best possible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: SarahJaneJohnson
Reviews.Content: In short cant find anything to fault the Suites on. From the minute we entered the hotel it was plain sailing. Reception check in was quick and efficient, hotel itself is spotless (as expected) and the rooms are extremely well appointed. We had a studio suite, included full kitchenette as per hotel website, and the best air con sytem a great bonus for the humid summer weather. ALL staff were very helpful, friendly and its location, right in the middle of the financial district, is a stones throw from the CN Tower/Rogers Centre etc. But its the little things that made this hotel a great find. We checked in the night before a birthday celebration, and ordered special breakfast for the next morning. this was duly delivered, with choc strawberrys!, and a note wishing Happy Birthday and breakfast was with compliments! It was a very nice touch and this sort of gesture goes a long way. The hotel also as a great car service, Bentley, Rolls Royce, Cadillacs for guests use local..another little nice touch. All in all we had a great time in Toronto, and would highly recommend the Suites, and indeed would definately stay there again. Ask for suite on the higher floor if possible..great views.!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here - you'll love it!”
Reviews.Author: cjohnan
Reviews.Content: We just returned home after spending 3 nights at the Suites at 1 King West in Toronto. The rooms were great and the feature of having a washer and dryer in each room is very unique. We were pampered from the minute we arrived until the minute we left. Our only regret is we only stayed 3 nights. Toronto is a fun city and we felt very safe walking around in the downtown area at night. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location & Staff, Too much construction, disorganized front desk”
Reviews.Author: LyleK
Reviews.Content: We reserved 2 rooms at the bargain price of $CAN 129 per room per night thru a travel agent. We requested that 1 room have twin beds so the teenagers didn't have to share. Before arriving, I found out that the smaller rooms only have 1 King bed and no room for a rollaway. After e-mailing the hotel, they gratiously upgraded a room to include a foldout couch at no charge. Check-in took away, perhaps because of the prearranged upgrade. Rooms were nice, 8th floor, but in the old building with no view. Great location, near food, shopping, banking, subway. Some exterior and interior construction detracts from the building apperance but doesn't effect any functional areas. Arranged for a comp. hotel limo (Bentley) ride to the CN tower for dinner. Worked great. The driver offered to return to pick us up, but it was a nice night and we just walked back. More desk confusion at checkout. We asked ahead of time to keep one room for a late checkout and they agreed. Message never made it intact to housekeeping and supervisor staff as they alternately tried to clean the rooms thinking we were staying another night or knocking asking us when we were leaving. But nice and courteous every time. We'd stay again, especially after construction is done and if a great rate is available.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: BritGuyanese
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at this hotel. Overall, we were very pleased with our choice of hotel. Positive points: . The rooms were large, modern and clean. . The lobby was busy . The gym was nice for a hotel . Complimentaty limousine service a nice touch . Good location, near to Eaton Centre, Financial & Entertainment Districts and Esplanade Negative points: . Check in staff were rude . Concierge were unhelpful and lacked basic knowledge of the city (except for Miles the concierge manager who met on our last day - he was exceptionally good). All in all we were very pleased with our choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was Okay”
Reviews.Author: welikenicehotels
Reviews.Content: I would give it a little more than 3.5 stars but not 4. Maybe I didn't like the room layout. I didn't feel that it was as functional as it was nice. I stayed with my husband and it felt dimly lit and the bathroom was really small. There's also no hooks to hang up towels and no shelving in the shower to put your shampoo and stuff on. We ordered internet service (their corporate package) but couldn't find the internet cable. We called the front desk and they told us where it should be...we still couldn't find it. They sent someone to help and he said that the room didn't have one...oh well...but he said that we could probably request to switch rooms. We only stayed 2 nights so we didn't bother. It is very conveniently located...but I would probably choose the Soho Metropolitan next time. Also...the limo service is limited...we wanted to get to a friend's place downtown and it's a 5-minute drive but it was outside of the limo's desination areas...so we didn't get to use that service. Also, you have to book it in advance. I read that some people were offered the service when they asked how to get somewhere...we wanted to go for some dimsum and they got us cab.

Reviews.Title: “Best all rounder, can't be beaten”
Reviews.Author: Louth_Tourist
Reviews.Content: The Suites at 1 King West are in a perfect location for doing Toronto by foot. Close to all the main tourist attractions and shopping, there is something for everyone. Of course, you do have to walk, and yes you will be tired! The rooms were very clean, equiped with everthing we needed. The fridge is the best! Washer, Dryer, Microwave, DVD, TV.... you could live here if you wanted! The staff were extremely friendly and helpful at all times. The vintage cars are brill, we got a ride, must be booked in advance though. Didn't bother checking out the pool, can't swim! We were on the 20th floor and the view was brilliant. Wouldn't be too bothered with the windows that opened, because there was too much noise outsidewhen opened! I believe you will not get anything as good as here. We stayed a week and even on the last day we were still finding new shops etc. The "PATH" system is unbelieveable, an underground maze of shops & restaurants can be accessed from the basement of the hotel (follow the steps down toward the old vault! To sum it up, extreme value for money at $129 per night!

Reviews.Title: “One King A OK with us”
Reviews.Author: budsfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights at the end of June and the hotel had everything we needed and more. The location is great - half a block to the Hockey Hall of Fame and easy walking to the Theatre District and Rogers Centre. We were able to book a $129./night studio which is an exceptional value for downtown TO. There's not another hotel that can match that for sure. So perhaps there a limited rooms at that price so that's why some folks couldn't get one. We booked early though. It was very nice with amenities a fridge and stuff we never used like dishwasher and washer/dryer set. There are tons of restaurants in the neighbourhood, for breakfast try Richtree in BCE place. It's all fresh food made to order right in front of you and just around the corner was a sports bar called the Bottom Line that had excellent food. I kind of laugh when I hear some folks negative comments like the ones about the windows. Like how many of us go to a hotel to sit and look out the window. It's mostly to sleep while your visiting. If there's a drawback it is there is no pool so if you had small ones that would be a disappointment. I found the staff really nice, doors opened for you and if you want a free ride in the downtown in one of their vintage cars.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spotty service”
Reviews.Author: joannnet
Reviews.Content: Well, based on reviews from this site, my husband and I spent 4 nights here (July 18-21). The location couldn't be better-right in the heart of the financial district, walking distance to everything (CN Tower, theaters, good restaurants, Rogers Center). The amenities were also good, as we enjoyed the sauna and whirlpool most days. Staff, however, are earnest yet ultimately unhelpful. Our first night, for example, we had tickets to a show at Second City, and asked the concierge to recommend and make reservations at a nice restaurant nearby. The hotel's car deposited us about 3 blocks from the theater at a "great Italian restaurant" that turned out not to even exist! (We later called the number on the business card we were given, and there was no connection). Luckily, we happened upon a terrific oyster house on the way to the theater, and had a lovely evening despite the hotel's blunder. Also, although we stayed 4 nights, our room was only serviced once, and that only happened because I stopped at the front desk as we went out for the evening and asked that someone clean the room while we were away. We left the room each day around 10 am and returned between 3 and 4, and every day, found that no maid service had been provided. On Friday, I went down to the sauna around 3:30, then to the whirlpool, and found the water ice cold. When I got back to my room, I called the desk and reported the problem at the spa. 5 minutes later, someone appeared at our door to repair the whirlpool in our room! What, the staff doesn't know that none of their guest rooms have whirlpools??!! Finally, potential guests should know that there is a $25 charge each time you have your car brought from the garage (something they don't tell you at check-in). All-in-all, the price and location are fine, but service is sub par.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: MarcieHatter
Reviews.Content: Would have given this place 5 stars if they hadn't booked us into a bad room first! We'd requested a room on a high floor (seems they've sold all the rooms in the tower now) so the highest they could give us was on the 15th floor. The room itself was fine apart from a large window in the ceiling that had no kind of blind or curtain - I could just imagine how bright it would have been at 4am in the morning! Plus the room had a balcony with a view of the bay - however, all the panels outside that separated the balconies were broken - you could see that workmen were still working on the property as there were power tools left out on the end balcony. Anyway, we were moved to another room without any fuss, this room was on the 11th floor of the old bank building and was much the same, but with curtains! The windows were old wooden sash ones so didn't keep out the traffic noise that well, but overall we had a good stay here. The washer/drier in the room is fantastic, bed very comfortable and the hotel is in a great location. I would recommend staying here if you can get the $129 deal - we booked a couple of months in advance via their own website.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to its promise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited Toronto at the end of June and stayed at 1 King West ( as I understood it was in the heart of downtown Toronto) The place seemed quite large and attractive. It would have been all that if the service matched the decor!!!! I don't know where a hotel could justify having a team of such unhelpful and careeless staff. From the valet to the front desk there was barely any greeting from any of them and I felt like they were doing me a favor by "allowing" me to stay in their hotel establishment! Well let me promise you this 1 king west..... The next time I come to Toronto I will not be staying there. It wasn't pleasant at all. And I am certain that My experince will be duplicated to many others who chose 1 King west over the many other hotels in T.O

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel/location”
Reviews.Author: SeanChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and got a good rate on-line. You can take the Airport Express bus to and from the airport which stops at the Fairmont York Hotel which is about 4 blocks from the King West Hotel. The room was clean, the staff friendly/efficient and it's right on Yonge Street. The AC worked fine, water pressure in the shower was great. I stayed on the 9th floor in a studio suite. Also there's a little gym on the 17th floor with cardio machines, some free weights,separate hot pools and saunas for men/women.

Reviews.Title: “Scammed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: iamit
Reviews.Content: Hotel's website Indicates a $129 rate, but found out that this is just a bait and switch and that this rate is rarely available and if it is it is for a room that does not have real windows looking ouside (looks into a indoor courtyard!). Booked through Expedia instead and based on the reviews thought that it would be great find. Although the room had a nice "new" feel alot of the hotel appears to be under construction in areas and reminded me of some of the seedy hotels in Manhattan that you stay in because they offer better prices than the chains. Fair warning this hotel is not up to the standards of these other suspect reviews, it makes you wonder who is writing them.

Reviews.Title: “What a great addition to downtown!”
Reviews.Author: Slow-travel
Reviews.Content: Thanks to everyone who posted reviews and brought this hotel to our attention. We were stunned by the room size, great staff, and the price. First of all, the lobby is crowded and we were there during Gay Pride Week, which is a busy tourist time in Toronto, so there was a line-up for check-in, making it difficult to get around the lobby. Someone from the bellhop desk came and pulled us out of line and checked us in, apologizing profusely for the wait and also for the fact that he couldn't do keys there and would have to pop over to the front desk for a minute. When he saw that I was having problems pulling my luggage through the crowded lobby, he accompanied us upstairs. The room.... beautiful size, with dishwasher, stovetop, fridge, and washer/dryer combo neatly tucked away. Two big closets and a series of coathooks by the front door, too. Where was this place when my kids were little? The bathroom was an odd shape, but had lots of counter space. The view was fantastic, with floor to ceiling windows. The beds were comfy, with high end linens. The windows open and the lake breeze was quite nice, but traffic noise carried up even to the 10th floor. I will warn, though, that the people in the next room were complaining to us while on the elevator about their room and view. We paid the bottom online rate, so don't know what they paid. The location... can't say enough about this. Right downtown but without the price of the King Eddy and Royal York. I was so sorry that we were only going to an event two blocks away so we couldn't take advantage of the limo service. Oh, and take a minute to go down those stairs in the middle of the lobby to check out the vault (this was originally an historic bank building) and the story of how it was installed many years ago. All in all my only regret is that we weren't staying there for more than a night. What a perfect place for an extended stay!

Reviews.Title: “Ditto Great Place”
Reviews.Author: toela
Reviews.Content: I hate to even say how great this place is, don't want to let the secret out, but I guess others should enjoy it too! The place is sparkling clean, the staff super friendly and professional. The lobby is hugh with lots of special seating nooks, but the best part are the suites. We were only staying two nights so we only had a junior suite, which was hugh and beautifully decorated. The bathroom had a sperate tub and ceramic shower,we had a kitchenette, but only used the fridge, no cooking for me on vacation? King bed, nice desk and sitting area and best of all, ALL THIS, for the price of a regular hotel room, we paid $109.00 + tax, at hotels plus $25.00 parking. We didn't use the free antique car service, although they were quick to offer it, but the hotel is so close to everything we perfered to walk. Just down the street on Yonge St, going towards the water is a really great eating spot called Richtree Market, you enter through the mall, Its got everything! They give you a credit card and you pick what ever you want from any food station and just pay for it at the end, the prices are really reasonable, and the food is great, the service was superb, and the decore is upbeat! We ate almost every meal here for two days. Toronto is a safe fun city and I can't wait to go back! Happy Travels

Reviews.Title: “Cat's meow!”
Reviews.Author: jvb_7
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed in this hotel for a special birthday weekend for her. Although Toronto in the summer is always a fabulous place to be, knowing this hotel was our "home" just made it even more special. The staff went out of their way to be friendly, helpful, and kind. The lobby/bar is a nice place to hang out while you wait for a room or a friend, and it has free wireless access. The hotel is beautiful, clean, and in a perfect location for access to the islands & most places in the city. We rode our bikes everywhere from this hotel and had no problems at all. I can't wait to return--next time based on these reviews I'll have to try the lap pool and the room service!! The kitchenette made it convenient to store a few beverages/fruit. The hotel offers dishsoap/laundrysoap for a small fee. The bed is very comfortable and the view from our room was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ottawagirl33
Reviews.Content: One King West Suites surprised me from the moment I walked in the lobby. It's not your usual lobby hotel. The staff is very friendly and outgoing, the food is great and the in-room dining option is a great value for when you don't feel like leaving your room since the prices were fantastic. The views were spectacular and the rooms impeccably clean, the decor was great and every necessity including cutlery and bowls were present in the kitchenette. The only negatives were the elevators (they were extremely slow and had to wait almost 10 minutes for an elevator on the 25th floor), and the bathrooms were very poorly laid out. I would definitely stay there on my next trip to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with a few limitations”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller8360
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect hotel for our small family (one child) in downtown Toronto. The fitness room, sauna and lap pool were perfect. The in-room amenities were very good. However, be warned that the "full kitchenette" is not a full kitchenette. There is not stove or oven. There is only a microwave. There is a dishwasher and a washer/dryer however. The view was marvelous, but the best thing about the hotel were the location and the friendly/helpful staff. Would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Fancy hotel without the fancy attitude”
Reviews.Author: volta25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for just under a week and really enjoyed our stay. We took the airport shuttle bus and although the bus doesn't stop at the hotel, the driver will stop as close as he/she can depending on traffic. We walked two short blocks with a rolling suit case. The staff at the front desk are very professional and helpful. One morning we asked the concierge for directions and he printed out a map and told us the fastest way to get there. We could have walked but we were tired and decided to take a cab. Be careful when taking a cab to an unknown location and make sure you get directions before you go. We wanted to get to a place that the concierge told us was a 5-minute drive and the taxi driver told us it would be 30-minutes outside of Toronto. We told the driver that we knew where we were headed and it was close but he insisted that it was out of town. Once he found out we were Canadians he told us he was joking with us and we arrived at our location in 5-minutes. We're not sure if it was because we were Canadian that he played this "joke" but if you are travelling from out of country and don't know where you're headed make sure you map out your plans before taking a taxi. The room is really nice with a comfortable bed, plush towels, and modern decor. Our room had a washing machine, a dryer, a fridge, a microwave, a toaster, a coffee maker, a kettle, and even a dishwasher! The room was clean and classy. We ordered room service one night and the prices weren't as ridiculous as most hotels. A sandwich and fries cost about $10.00 and beer was $4.25. The "pool" is very small. It looked like the kind where you set a dial for a current and swim laps. There is a sauna and a whirlpool as well as a fitness room with a number of machines. All these areas were clean. There is a train station right across the street from the hotel too so getting around is a breeze. I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel took care of every need when I proposed to my girlfriend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! I called around numerous hotels in Toronto looking for someone to assist me as I prepared to propose to my girlfriend. Maritza Parra was more than willing to meet all of our needs. She upgraded our room to a loft suite, and even made all the preparations with the chef for a fantastic dinner. While we visited the CN Tower, her staff filled our room with candles, rose petals, and champagne. My fiance was very surprised and it made for a perfect evening. The food was excellent and relatively inexpensive compared to most room service meals. The best touch is the classic cars that will drive you anywhere you want while you stay. The idea of riding to the CN Tower in a limo, and then being picked up in a Rolls Royce is still mind-boggling. The only downside of this hotel as that it was still under contruction during our stay. However, I look forward to going back now that it's complete. Especially since they gave us a free night as an engagement gift!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, no complaints!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Anyone who complains about this hotel has got to be VERY hard to please! This hotel is new, modern, clean and extremely good value. I got a superb deal with expedia for Â£48 per night although I know that the price has gone up since. Upon arrival i was a bit skeptical because although the hotel started with good reviews, i started reading some bad ones, well there was absolutely nothing to worry about. LOCATION - excellent and the subway which is opposite goes anywhere you want to go in minutes. ROOMS - very simplistic, lovely modern furnishings, very clean - the kitchen utensils hadn't even been used and there was plenty of storage space for your belongings. We had a room on the 44th floor and believe me the view was fantastic , beautiful view of the city and lake ontario, it was lovely waking up to that view each day. The reception staff were friendly although i was given some wrong information concerning the credit card deposit from one member of staff, it wasn't a big deal but it was something very basic which they should've known. Didn't waste any money on room service, i find that it is extortionate in any hotel you go and they always expect huge tips so can't cooment on that. Also the elevator is very fast and efficient, house keeping was good, it was daily and the complimentary newspapers delivered to the room each morning is a nce touch. Also the floors are quiet i actually didn't encounter any neighbours during my stay which is good unlike the sheraton where its just too busy and noisy. Fire alarm did go off and it was loud but i found it quite funny, wasn't a problem whenever i am in toronto the only place i will stay is at the suites.

Reviews.Title: “$129 !”
Reviews.Author: fillipo
Reviews.Content: The intro rate of $129 is a joke. Grab it while you can. Where in North America can you get a suite, fully equipped kitchen with dishwasher, washer and dryer? Walking distance to everywhere, including Spadina Chinatown, where we brought back some great Chinese food that we threw in the microwave. There were a few very small glitches, but when you factor in the price, they were a non issue. Anyone complaining about this place does not appreciate value.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, should be 6 stars!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brendan8
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Suits at One King West, and it was one of the best hotels stays ever. When we got there while we were checking in the manager came over and upgraded us to a suit overlooking the Toronto Harbour. The room was very large and luxurious. Later that night we asked about directions to a restaurant and they offered to drive us there. The car they pulled us was not a normal car, but a 1960 restored Cadillac. The service and facilities are unparallel to anything you would ever find in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “There, but not quite”
Reviews.Author: Trackser
Reviews.Content: I would like to give this place a 5 because it was an astounding price for the location and the class, EXCEPT the A/C did not work in our room. We had no problem with check-in (but we had a bit of trouble finding the entrance - driving along busy downtown streets, we found the King & Yonge intersection but had to call via cell to figure out where to enter because nothing is marked "hotel", 1 King West, etc.) and no trouble with amenities, guest services and such. On the elevator, another guest mentioned something about his room being 78 degrees, while others in the car said their A/C was fine. On getting to our room, it was 76 though it had been turned down for several hours. We got quick response to our call for maintenance, and the first night, a guy actually seemed to fix it. It cooled off a little, we slept fine and it was 72 the next morning. The weather got much hotter that day and the next night they weren't able to get the room cooled, though it was cool as a cucumber out in the hallway. In retrospect we should've moved to another room when they offered it the 1st night. Other than that, the room was great. The view was so phenomenal, we didn't even ride up the CN Tower during our rambles. We did take a complimentary ride to dinner in one of the hotel's classic cars. We also used the small washer & dryer in the room, which helped a lot as we were at the end of our vacation and running out of fresh clothes. Bed was very good but the bathroom was right next to it. Of course the location was great, every street you go down in Toronto is full of activity. Would certainly go back, especially given the rate, but I expect it will go up soon. This is a newly-built high rise hotel and they also market it as business suites for longer-term customers. A bit of a unique approach. The hotel bar is good, and reasonably priced. Their restaurant just opened a day before we got there, but had not yet got a liquor licence. Just make sure you get a climate-controlled room, and ask to move if you don't as they are very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mandeeuk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during the recent International Trademark Association convention in Toronto. I expect the hotel was near capacity due to the convention, but the service did not falter. Everyone was extremely friendly and the location was excellent. It was a short walk to Eaton Centre and to the Convention Centre. The room was extremely comfortable and clean with excellent amenities including a washer/dryer and microwave. The bathroom was quite small, but acceptable. I ordered room service on a couple of occasions and it was prompt and good. The windows in the guestrooms open which is a serious bonus in any hotel. The concierge and bar staff in particular were extremely helpful and pleasant. The bar staff went out of their way to make sure I was happy and gave great recommendations for dinner and drinks as well as making a very good cosmo! I used the big, stylish housecar at the concierge's insistence and thought it was a really cool touch. I also made use of the steam room and jacuzzi and absolutely loved it. All in all, I thought this was an amazing hotel both aesthetically and service wise. I would not hesitate to recommend it or to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had problems the moment I stepped foot in this hotel at the front desk!! I had made a reservation months ago at a rate of $179/night for 2 nights. However, the front desk person informed me our rate was $299/night. She said it was impossible that my rate was the one quoted to me months ago. Fortunately, I had in my possession the confirmation that had been emailed to me for $179. Upon arriving in our room, we discovered 2 light bulbs(one of which was a very important one in the bathroom) were burnt out and that the air conditioning was not functioning properly. We immediately contacted the front desk and were informed someone would be to our room shortly to fix the problems. Since we were leaving for dinner, we assumed the problems would be fixed by the time we arrived back in our room later that night. Well, that was not the case. Called the front desk again but, guess what, again no one showed up! By the way, the windows they advertise on their web site as opening, really don't!! It only got worse the next morning. In addition to not having air conditioning, no light in the bathroom, we now had NO HOT WATER for showers!! Called the front desk a third time, FINALLY someone showed up after a short wait. He did change the light bulbs, reset the air conditioner but said nothing could be done about the hot water!! He said everyone was complaining. The A/C worked for a while, but every time it would shut off, we would have to push the reset button!! The following morning around 6am the fire alarms starting going off. Scared us to death, and given our nervousness regarding the general operations of this hotel, you better believe we evacuated our 10th floor room pronto down the fire escape steps!! Fortunately it was a false alarm. The explanation was that dust was accumulating on the top of one of the elevators and it was an environmental alarm/hazard??!! The only high point of the stay was the fact that we were comped one night for our many "inconveniences". Even after that, I still felt we paid too much!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: reddyn
Reviews.Content: I just returned after a four day stay in Toronto with my husband. Frankly, I had wanted to stay in a boutique hotel, i.e. Hotel Le Germain, but because of the many conferences in town made a last minute decision to stay at King's West. My choice to stay here was based on the price and location and the reasonable reviews that it's had on trip advisor. It was better than I had hoped. The rooms are not large but are well appointed. Also, the furnishings are clean and modern with a very nice color scheme. (nice linens, leather headboard) I especially liked the hidden washer and dryer which I used once during our stay. Other nice amenities include access to the vintage cars that give complementary rides wihin downtown, we used this service often. This hotel is non-smoking and as such does not have the musty smell that I tend to associate with hotels. It's extremely well located, we walked everywhere. I read the previous reviews, I was surprised to see that someone rated the hotel with one star. I will say that there must be construction going on somewhere in the hotel as we frequently saw construction workers coming and going on the elevators, but that was our only exposure. I never heard any noise related to construction. In general, I thought this was an excellent find.

Reviews.Title: “Great for travellers or business!”
Reviews.Author: Tobie
Reviews.Content: Despite a few finishing touches being tended to, and training of staff still ongoing, this hotel was an absolutely great spot for an overnight stay and should appeal to a wide variety of clients. The rooms are well designed for longer stays with a microwave, dishwasher, washer and dryer, iron and board.....and a hairdryer (*if you look in the cupboard below the sink). The bathroom has a walk in shower and separate tub so the one sink vanity is somewhat small, but glass shelves add to the storage potential. As well, the bed was comfy (though not "heavenly") and the glass desk/work area with 2 chairs, one an swivel leather desk chair, was good for our morning Starbucks fix...located right across the street. In our suite there was an electric fireplace, with a television on top, a glass fronted armoire for clothing (thank you for "skinny" mirrors!) and a lounge chair and ottoman. I forgot to ask for a higher floor so we were on the 8th, but besides the odd street noise, we found the suite quiet. There was a faint smell of paint in the morning at the elevators, but besides that, you wouldn't know there was any construction going on. The lobby is spacious and tastefully decorated, with two main entrances on opposite sides of the building for easy access to public transit right outside the door. We found all staff very friendly and helpful, but they are still training people and it's obvious from the previous review, they may not have all that worked out quite yet. But our experience was above average in that regard. We did make use of the "courtesy cars" and had a ride in a '72 Rolls to a restaurant in the Distillery District (Boiler House .....fantastic meal, great jazz) which was wonderful. We didn't visit the cafe on site and the restaurant is still under construction, but there is a room service menu and nearby eateries so that wasn't a problem. If you are looking for a more luxurious, spacious suite for a romantic getaway, this might not be the place for you. Otherwise I think it's a real find in downtown Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and convenient”
Reviews.Author: MaryTraveler2
Reviews.Content: When we arrived for a three-day visit to Toronto, we were told that we had been upgraded to a deluxe suite. This was a pleasant, attractively decorated large room with a kitchen area which included not only a refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker, but a dishwasher and a clothes washer and dryer. The location is excellent. We had come to attend the opera, and the hotel was only about two blocks from the Hummingbird Centre. The King Street subway station is just outside either door, or one can reach it via the extensive underground PATH. The staff were very pleasant and did their best to be helpful, although they were often busy and sometimes did not have the answers right at their fingertips. I have a few minor caveats: (1)If one takes the Toronto Airport Express from Pearson Airport, the stop nearest this hotel is at the Royal York, about four blocks away. (2) Our room had an easy chair with an ottoman which looked as though it would be comfortable. It was decorated with a double row of large "nailheads" along the sides and back of the chair, which bumped me in the head when I leaned back and made the chair uncomfortable for me. (I am short, and a taller person probably wouldn't be bothered. There were other places to sit.) (3) The booklet in the room describing the hotel's amenities, room service, etc. implied that if a guest needed information about airport bus schedules, where to rent a car, etc. all that guest had to do was to contact the front desk, using the speed dial on the phone. We didn't use the speed dial, but rather asked in person, and we did get the answers we needed, but we usually had to wait while the desk clerk or valet had to look things up and deal with other matters as well. We weren't in a big hurry, but our questions didn't seem very complicated. As I said, these were minor things. Our stay was pleasant, and we found the hotel comfortable and conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Sales staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was trying to book a block of rooms at this hotel for the guests of my wedding in September. After exchanging voicemail messages with the sales representative, I left 3 additional messages asking her to get back to me, and never heard a response. On my last message, I literally pleaded with her to return my call, and still heard nothing. For a new hotel that is trying to establish itself in the city, it's inexcuseable to completely ignore a customer that has the potential to book 25 rooms in the hotel. I have already begun spreading the word about the poor service at this hotel, and will continue to do so. It's a shame that they have now turned off potential customers without ever having them set foot in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: travellingmom95
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a trip for my 10 yr old and myself to see a Leafs game my only dilemma was where to stay. I had originally booked with the delta chelsea but upon reading reviews on this site was a bit apprehesive. I read some of the things ppl wrote about 1 King West and decided I had to see for myself. ( I have also stayed at the Novotel and Courtyard Marriot downtown and must say, don't ever stay at the Novotel) WOW!! I am so glad I decided to stay here, first off the staff at 1 King West are awesome they were polite, friendly and very helpful. The rooms are beautiful and the view I had in 2305 was great. The location is fabulous there is a variety of resturants within a short walk as well as a grocery store and anything else you may think of. Even my son thought it was great. The only problem I had was that I had to leave! I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will definatly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our stay”
Reviews.Author: ASG100
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights in a beautifully equipped suite on the 39th floor. The views were spectacular. The location of the hotel was ideal for our vacation as we could walk to and from Union Station in 10 minutes completely underground. Every one of the staff we had dealings with were extremely helpful and polite. We would certainly recommend this hotel and it would be our first choice if we were to stay in Toronto again in the future. We did not use the bar or restaurant during our stay so we cannot comment on those facilities. There is, however, a very wide choice of eating places around this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: scoobyskidoo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came from the UK and stayed here for 5 nights to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Before we left I emailed the hotel and requested a high floor room and hypoallergenic bedding - both of which were quickly and politely arranged for me. The hotel itself is wonderful. It is still not finished but we found that the work being carried out was done as quietly as possible and in such a way to be very unobtrusive. To be honest we did not notice it at all. The view from our 34th floor studio suite was fantastic and the suite itself was very well equipped and comfortable. The complimentary internet access was a particular bonus. The location is excellent - in the heart of the financial district and next door to King subway station. The subway system in Toronto is very clean and very safe, even at night. I could carry on for ages, but suffice to say we had a wonderful time and would be hard pushed to find fault with this very high quality, yet very good value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto's Best, no word of a lie”
Reviews.Author: rro
Reviews.Content: Although I live in Toronto, I decided to live in a bit of luxury after a night on the town. The impressive lobby is richly decorated and conviently accessible. I entered through the PATH system, an 11km underground passage-way filled with stores and restaurants that connects all major buildings in downtown Toronto. Although there are only 4 elevators, you realize that the hotel is not as big as a 50 storey building seems. The very slender hotel only has about 10 suites per level. Also, upon exiting the elevators, windows let a west view shine through. The room that I had was uniquely shaped, with angled walls, which maximized light entry. There is a kitchenette which includes a washer and a seperate dryer. I don't know how valuable this is to people, but it certainly looks classy. The marble bathroom had a spacious shower instead of a bathtub (suited towards business travellers). The bed was huge, and the linens were top notch. Another perk for business personalities is the free in-room internet. It certainly left a good impression with me, and will come in handy next time around. Finally, the view (I was only on the 26 level, imagine the 40th) is spectacular. My west facing windows overlooked the lake, the CN Tower, and best of all the sunset. Best of all, the price is very reasonable and better than surrounding hotels. I can not wait until I stay there again, and hope that people will give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall our experience at this hotel was great! The hotel is in a great location if you are looking to do some shopping downtown with the Eaton Center less than a five minute walk away and Yorkville a short cab ride away! The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. There are a few things to note however. When we checked in we asked if it was possible to get two double beds instead of a king and were informed that the hotel only has king beds. They did however have some suites with a king and a pullout available and therefore upgraded us for free! Another thing is that while the rooms are equiped with a fridge, sink, dishwasher, washer, dryer and microwave, there was no blowdryer in the room so you have to bring your own if you want one. We stayed on the 25th floor and the first night we were there it was very windy and as a result very noisy but that is no fault of the hotels. At that height other noise from the street was minimal. Overall it was a great experience and I would definantely stay at this hotel again!

HotelInfo.Name: One King West Hotel & Residence
HotelInfo.Address: 1 King Street West, Toronto, Ontario M5H 1A1, Canada
